1.verse: BLESSED (HAPPY, fortunate, prosperous, and enviable) is the man who walks and lives not in the counsel of the ungodly [following their advice, their plans and purposes], nor stands [submissive and inactive] in the path where sinners walk, nor sits down [to relax and rest] where the scornful [and the mockers] gather.

2.verse: But his delight and desire are in the law of the Lord, and on His law (the precepts, the instructions, the teachings of God) he habitually meditates (ponders and studies) by day and by night.

3.verse: And he shall be like a tree firmly planted [and tended] by the streams of water, ready to bring forth its fruit in its season; its leaf also shall not fade or wither; and everything he does shall prosper [and come to maturity].

4.verse: Not so the wicked [those disobedient and living without God are not so]. But they are like the chaff [worthless, dead, without substance] which the wind drives away.

5.verse: Therefore the wicked [those disobedient and living without God] shall not stand [justified] in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous [those who are upright and in right standing with God].

6.verse: For the Lord knows and is fully acquainted with the way of the righteous, but the way of the ungodly [those living outside God's will] shall perish (end in ruin and come to nought).

1.verse: WHY DO the nations assemble with commotion [uproar and confusion of voices], and why do the people imagine (meditate upon and devise) an empty scheme?

2.verse: The kings of the earth take their places; the rulers take counsel together against the Lord and His Anointed One (the Messiah, the Christ). They say,

3.verse: Let us break Their bands [of restraint] asunder and cast Their cords [of control] from us.

4.verse: He Who sits in the heavens laughs; the Lord has them in derision [and in supreme contempt He mocks them].

5.verse: He speaks to them in His deep anger and troubles (terrifies and confounds) them in His displeasure and fury, saying,

6.verse: Yet have I anointed (installed and placed) My King [firmly] on My holy hill of Zion.

7.verse: I will declare the decree of the Lord: He said to Me, You are My Son; this day [I declare] I have begotten You.

8.verse: Ask of Me, and I will give You the nations as Your inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth as Your possession.

9.verse: You shall break them with a rod of iron; You shall dash them in pieces like potters' ware.

10.verse: Now therefore, O you kings, act wisely; be instructed and warned, O you rulers of the earth.

11.verse: Serve the Lord with reverent awe and worshipful fear; rejoice and be in high spirits with trembling [lest you displease Him].

12.verse: Kiss the Son [pay homage to Him in purity], lest He be angry and you perish in the way, for soon shall His wrath be kindled. O blessed (happy, fortunate, and to be envied) are all those who seek refuge and put their trust in Him!

1.verse: LORD, HOW they are increased who trouble me! Many are they who rise up against me.

2.verse: Many are saying of me, There is no help for him in God. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

3.verse: But You, O Lord, are a shield for me, my glory, and the lifter of my head.

4.verse: With my voice I cry to the Lord, and He hears and answers me out of His holy hill. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: I lay down and slept; I wakened again, for the Lord sustains me.

6.verse: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people who have set themselves against me round about.

7.verse: Arise, O Lord; save me, O my God! For You have struck all my enemies on the cheek; You have broken the teeth of the ungodly.

8.verse: Salvation belongs to the Lord; May Your blessing be upon Your people. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

1.verse: ANSWER ME when I call, O God of my righteousness (uprightness, justice, and right standing with You)! You have freed me when I was hemmed in and enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me and hear my prayer.

2.verse: O you sons of men, how long will you turn my honor and glory into shame? How long will you love vanity and futility and seek after lies? Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

3.verse: But know that the Lord has set apart for Himself [and given distinction to] him who is godly [the man of loving-kindness]. The Lord listens and heeds when I call to Him.

4.verse: Be angry [or stand in awe] and sin not; commune with your own hearts upon your beds and be silent (sorry for the things you say in your hearts). Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: Offer just and right sacrifices; trust (lean on and be confident) in the Lord.

6.verse: Many say, Oh, that we might see some good! Lift up the light of Your countenance upon us, O Lord.

7.verse: You have put more joy and rejoicing in my heart than [they know] when their wheat and new wine have yielded abundantly.

8.verse: In peace I will both lie down and sleep, for You, Lord, alone make me dwell in safety and confident trust.

1.verse: LISTEN TO my words, O Lord, give heed to my sighing and groaning.

2.verse: Hear the sound of my cry, my King and my God, for to You do I pray.

3.verse: In the morning You hear my voice, O Lord; in the morning I prepare [a prayer, a sacrifice] for You and watch and wait [for You to speak to my heart].

4.verse: For You are not a God Who takes pleasure in wickedness; neither will the evil [man] so much as dwell [temporarily] with You.

5.verse: Boasters can have no standing in Your sight; You abhor all evildoers.

6.verse: You will destroy those who speak lies; the Lord abhors [and rejects] the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.

7.verse: But as for me, I will enter Your house through the abundance of Your steadfast love and mercy; I will worship toward and at Your holy temple in reverent fear and awe of You.

8.verse: Lead me, O Lord, in Your righteousness because of my enemies; make Your way level (straight and right) before my face.

9.verse: For there is nothing trustworthy or steadfast or truthful in their talk; their heart is destruction [or a destructive chasm, a yawning gulf]; their throat is an open sepulcher; they flatter and make smooth with their tongue.

10.verse: Hold them guilty, O God; let them fall by their own designs and counsels; cast them out because of the multitude of their transgressions, for they have rebelled against You.

11.verse: But let all those who take refuge and put their trust in You rejoice; let them ever sing and shout for joy, because You make a covering over them and defend them; let those also who love Your name be joyful in You and be in high spirits.

12.verse: For You, Lord, will bless the [uncompromisingly] righteous [him who is upright and in right standing with You]; as with a shield You will surround him with goodwill (pleasure and favor).

1.verse: O LORD, rebuke me not in Your anger nor discipline and chasten me in Your hot displeasure.

2.verse: Have mercy on me and be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am weak (faint and withered away); O Lord, heal me, for my bones are troubled.

3.verse: My [inner] self [as well as my body] is also exceedingly disturbed and troubled. But You, O Lord, how long [until You return and speak peace to me]?

4.verse: Return [to my relief], O Lord, deliver my life; save me for the sake of Your steadfast love and mercy.

5.verse: For in death there is no remembrance of You; in Sheol (the place of the dead) who will give You thanks?

6.verse: I am weary with my groaning; all night I soak my pillow with tears, I drench my couch with my weeping.

7.verse: My eye grows dim because of grief; it grows old because of all my enemies.

8.verse: Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity, for the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping.

9.verse: The Lord has heard my supplication; the Lord receives my prayer.

10.verse: Let all my enemies be ashamed and sorely troubled; let them turn back and be put to shame suddenly.

1.verse: O LORD my God, in You I take refuge and put my trust; save me from all those who pursue and persecute me, and deliver me,

2.verse: Lest my foe tear my life [from my body] like a lion, dragging me away while there is none to deliver.

3.verse: O Lord my God, if I have done this, if there is wrong in my hands,

4.verse: If I have paid back with evil him who was at peace with me or without cause have robbed him who was my enemy,

5.verse: Let the enemy pursue my life and take it; yes, let him trample my life to the ground and lay my honor in the dust. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

6.verse: Arise, O Lord, in Your anger; lift up Yourself against the rage of my enemies; and awake [and stir up] for me the justice and vindication [that] You have commanded.

7.verse: Let the assembly of the peoples be gathered about You, and return on high over them.

8.verse: The Lord judges the people; judge me, O Lord, and do me justice according to my righteousness [my rightness, justice, and right standing with You] and according to the integrity that is in me.

9.verse: Oh, let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, but establish the [uncompromisingly] righteous [those upright and in harmony with You]; for You, Who try the hearts and emotions and thinking powers, are a righteous God.

10.verse: My defense and shield depend on God, Who saves the upright in heart.

11.verse: God is a righteous Judge, yes, a God Who is indignant every day.

12.verse: If a man does not turn and repent, [God] will whet His sword; He has strung and bent His [huge] bow and made it ready [by treading it with His foot].

13.verse: He has also prepared for him deadly weapons; He makes His arrows fiery shafts.

14.verse: Behold, [the wicked man] conceives iniquity and is pregnant with mischief and gives birth to lies.

15.verse: He made a pit and hollowed it out and has fallen into the hole which he made [before the trap was completed].

16.verse: His mischief shall fall back in return upon his own head, and his violence come down [with the loose dirt] upon his own scalp.

17.verse: I will give to the Lord the thanks due to His rightness and justice, and I will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.

1.verse: O LORD, our Lord, how excellent (majestic and glorious) is Your name in all the earth! You have set Your glory on [or above] the heavens.

2.verse: Out of the mouths of babes and unweaned infants You have established strength because of Your foes, that You might silence the enemy and the avenger.

3.verse: When I view and consider Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, the moon and the stars, which You have ordained and established,

4.verse: What is man that You are mindful of him, and the son of [earthborn] man that You care for him?

5.verse: Yet You have made him but a little lower than God [or heavenly beings], and You have crowned him with glory and honor.

6.verse: You made him to have dominion over the works of Your hands; You have put all things under his feet:

7.verse: All sheep and oxen, yes, and the beasts of the field,

8.verse: The birds of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatever passes along the paths of the seas.

9.verse: O Lord, our Lord, how excellent (majestic and glorious) is Your name in all the earth!

1.verse: I WILL praise You, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will show forth (recount and tell aloud) all Your marvelous works and wonderful deeds!

2.verse: I will rejoice in You and be in high spirits; I will sing praise to Your name, O Most High!

3.verse: When my enemies turned back, they stumbled and perished before You.

4.verse: For You have maintained my right and my cause; You sat on the throne judging righteously.

5.verse: You have rebuked the nations, You have destroyed the wicked; You have blotted out their name forever and ever.

6.verse: The enemy have been cut off and have vanished in everlasting ruins, You have plucked up and overthrown their cities; the very memory of them has perished and vanished.

7.verse: But the Lord shall remain and continue forever; He has prepared and established His throne for judgment.

8.verse: And He will judge the world in righteousness (rightness and equity); He will minister justice to the peoples in uprightness.

9.verse: The Lord also will be a refuge and a high tower for the oppressed, a refuge and a stronghold in times of trouble (high cost, destitution, and desperation).

10.verse: And they who know Your name [who have experience and acquaintance with Your mercy] will lean on and confidently put their trust in You, for You, Lord, have not forsaken those who seek (inquire of and for) You [on the authority of God's Word and the right of their necessity].

11.verse: Sing praises to the Lord, Who dwells in Zion! Declare among the peoples His doings!

12.verse: For He Who avenges the blood [of His people shed unjustly] remembers them; He does not forget the cry of the afflicted (the poor and the humble).

13.verse: Have mercy upon me and be gracious to me, O Lord; consider how I am afflicted by those who hate me, You Who lift me up from the gates of death,

14.verse: That I may show forth (recount and tell aloud) all Your praises! In the gates of the Daughter of Zion I will rejoice in Your salvation and Your saving help.

15.verse: The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made; in the net which they hid is their own foot caught.

16.verse: The Lord has made Himself known; He executes judgment; the wicked are snared in the work of their own hands. Higgaion [meditation]. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

17.verse: The wicked shall be turned back [headlong into premature death] into Sheol (the place of the departed spirits of the wicked), even all the nations that forget or are forgetful of God.

18.verse: For the needy shall not always be forgotten, and the expectation and hope of the meek and the poor shall not perish forever.

19.verse: Arise, O Lord! Let not man prevail; let the nations be judged before You.

20.verse: Put them in fear [make them realize their frail nature], O Lord, that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

1.verse: WHY DO You stand afar off, O Lord? Why do You hide Yourself, [veiling Your eyes] in times of trouble (distress and desperation)?

2.verse: The wicked in pride and arrogance hotly pursue and persecute the poor; let them be taken in the schemes which they have devised.

3.verse: For the wicked man boasts (sings the praises) of his own heart's desire, and the one greedy for gain curses and spurns, yes, renounces and despises the Lord.

4.verse: The wicked one in the pride of his countenance will not seek, inquire for, and yearn for God; all his thoughts are that there is no God [so He never punishes].

5.verse: His ways are grievous [or persist] at all times; Your judgments [Lord] are far above and on high out of his sight [so he never thinks about them]; as for all his foes, he sniffs and sneers at them.

6.verse: He thinks in his heart, I shall not be moved; for throughout all generations I shall not come to want or be in adversity.

7.verse: His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, oppression (fraud); under his tongue are trouble and sin (mischief and iniquity).

8.verse: He sits in ambush in the villages; in hiding places he slays the innocent; he watches stealthily for the poor (the helpless and unfortunate).

9.verse: He lurks in secret places like a lion in his thicket; he lies in wait that he may seize the poor (the helpless and the unfortunate); he seizes the poor when he draws him into his net.

10.verse: [The prey] is crushed, sinks down; and the helpless falls by his mighty [claws].

11.verse: [The foe] thinks in his heart, God has quite forgotten; He has hidden His face; He will never see [my deed].

12.verse: Arise, O Lord! O God, lift up Your hand; forget not the humble [patient and crushed].

13.verse: Why does the wicked [man] condemn (spurn and renounce) God? Why has he thought in his heart, You will not call to account?

14.verse: You have seen it; yes, You note trouble and grief (vexation) to requite it with Your hand. The unfortunate commits himself to You; You are the helper of the fatherless.

15.verse: Break the arm of the wicked man; and as for the evil man, search out his wickedness until You find no more.

16.verse: The Lord is King forever and ever; the nations will perish out of His land.

17.verse: O Lord, You have heard the desire and the longing of the humble and oppressed; You will prepare and strengthen and direct their hearts, You will cause Your ear to hear,

18.verse: To do justice to the fatherless and the oppressed, so that man, who is of the earth, may not terrify them any more.

1.verse: IN THE Lord I take refuge [and put my trust]; how can you say to me, Flee like a bird to your mountain?

2.verse: For see, the wicked are bending the bow; they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they [furtively] in darkness may shoot at the upright in heart.

3.verse: If the foundations are destroyed, what can the [unyieldingly] righteous do, or what has He [the Righteous One] wrought or accomplished?

4.verse: The Lord is in His holy temple; the Lord's throne is in heaven. His eyes behold; His eyelids test and prove the children of men.

5.verse: The Lord tests and proves the [unyieldingly] righteous, but His soul abhors the wicked and him who loves violence.

6.verse: Upon the wicked He will rain quick burning coals or snares; fire, brimstone, and a [dreadful] scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.

7.verse: For the Lord is [rigidly] righteous, He loves righteous deeds; the upright shall behold His face, or He beholds the upright.

1.verse: HELP, LORD! For principled and godly people are here no more; faithfulness and the faithful vanish from among the sons of men.

2.verse: To his neighbor each one speaks words without use or worth or truth; with flattering lips and double heart [deceitfully] they speak.

3.verse: May the Lord cut off all flattering lips and the tongues that speak proud boasting,

4.verse: Those who say, With our tongues we prevail; our lips are our own [to command at our will]--who is lord and master over us?

5.verse: Now will I arise, says the Lord, because the poor are oppressed, because of the groans of the needy; I will set him in safety and in the salvation for which he pants.

6.verse: The words and promises of the Lord are pure words, like silver refined in an earthen furnace, purified seven times over.

7.verse: You will keep them and preserve them, O Lord; You will guard and keep us from this [evil] generation forever.

8.verse: The wicked walk or prowl about on every side, as vileness is exalted [and baseness is rated high] among the sons of men.

1.verse: HOW LONG will You forget me, O Lord? Forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?

2.verse: How long must I lay up cares within me and have sorrow in my heart day after day? How long shall my enemy exalt himself over me?

3.verse: Consider and answer me, O Lord my God; lighten the eyes [of my faith to behold Your face in the pitchlike darkness], lest I sleep the sleep of death,

4.verse: Lest my enemy say, I have prevailed over him, and those that trouble me rejoice when I am shaken.

5.verse: But I have trusted, leaned on, and been confident in Your mercy and loving-kindness; my heart shall rejoice and be in high spirits in Your salvation.

6.verse: I will sing to the Lord, because He has dealt bountifully with me.

1.verse: THE [empty-headed] fool has said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable deeds; there is none that does good or right.

2.verse: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men to see if there were any who understood, dealt wisely, and sought after God, inquiring for and of Him and requiring Him [of vital necessity].

3.verse: They are all gone aside, they have all together become filthy; there is none that does good or right, no, not one.

4.verse: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people as they eat bread and who do not call on the Lord?

5.verse: There they shall be in great fear [literally--dreading a dread], for God is with the generation of the [uncompromisingly] righteous (those upright and in right standing with Him).

6.verse: You [evildoers] would put to shame and confound the plans of the poor and patient, but the Lord is his safe refuge.

7.verse: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When the Lord shall restore the fortunes of His people, then Jacob shall rejoice and Israel shall be glad.

1.verse: LORD, WHO shall dwell [temporarily] in Your tabernacle? Who shall dwell [permanently] on Your holy hill?

2.verse: He who walks and lives uprightly and blamelessly, who works rightness and justice and speaks and thinks the truth in his heart,

3.verse: He who does not slander with his tongue, nor does evil to his friend, nor takes up a reproach against his neighbor;

4.verse: In whose eyes a vile person is despised, but he who honors those who fear the Lord (who revere and worship Him); who swears to his own hurt and does not change;

5.verse: [He who] does not put out his money for interest [to one of his own people] and who will not take a bribe against the innocent. He who does these things shall never be moved.

1.verse: KEEP and protect me, O God, for in You I have found refuge, and in You do I put my trust and hide myself.

2.verse: I say to the Lord, You are my Lord; I have no good beside or beyond You.

3.verse: As for the godly (the saints) who are in the land, they are the excellent, the noble, and the glorious, in whom is all my delight.

4.verse: Their sorrows shall be multiplied who choose another god; their drink offerings of blood will I not offer or take their names upon my lips.

5.verse: The Lord is my chosen and assigned portion, my cup; You hold and maintain my lot.

6.verse: The lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; yes, I have a good heritage.

7.verse: I will bless the Lord, Who has given me counsel; yes, my heart instructs me in the night seasons.

8.verse: I have set the Lord continually before me; because He is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

9.verse: Therefore my heart is glad and my glory [my inner self] rejoices; my body too shall rest and confidently dwell in safety,

10.verse: For You will not abandon me to Sheol (the place of the dead), neither will You suffer Your holy one [Holy One] to see corruption.

11.verse: You will show me the path of life; in Your presence is fullness of joy, at Your right hand there are pleasures forevermore.

1.verse: HEAR THE right (my righteous cause), O Lord; listen to my shrill, piercing cry! Give ear to my prayer, that comes from unfeigned and guileless lips.

2.verse: Let my sentence of vindication come from You! May Your eyes behold the things that are just and upright.

3.verse: You have proved my heart; You have visited me in the night; You have tried me and find nothing [no evil purpose in me]; I have purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.

4.verse: Concerning the works of men, by the word of Your lips I have avoided the ways of the violent (the paths of the destroyer).

5.verse: My steps have held closely to Your paths [to the tracks of the One Who has gone on before]; my feet have not slipped.

6.verse: I have called upon You, O God, for You will hear me; incline Your ear to me and hear my speech.

7.verse: Show Your marvelous loving-kindness, O You Who save by Your right hand those who trust and take refuge in You from those who rise up against them.

8.verse: Keep and guard me as the pupil of Your eye; hide me in the shadow of Your wings

9.verse: From the wicked who despoil and oppress me, my deadly adversaries who surround me.

10.verse: They are enclosed in their own prosperity and have shut up their hearts to pity; with their mouths they make exorbitant claims and proudly and arrogantly speak.

11.verse: They track us down in each step we take; now they surround us; they set their eyes to cast us to the ground,

12.verse: Like a lion greedy and eager to tear his prey, and as a young lion lurking in hidden places.

13.verse: Arise, O Lord! Confront and forestall them, cast them down! Deliver my life from the wicked by Your sword,

14.verse: From men by Your hand, O Lord, from men of this world [these poor moths of the night] whose portion in life is idle and vain. Their bellies are filled with Your hidden treasure [what You have stored up]; their children are satiated, and they leave the rest [of their] wealth to their babes.

15.verse: As for me, I will continue beholding Your face in righteousness (rightness, justice, and right standing with You); I shall be fully satisfied, when I awake [to find myself] beholding Your form [and having sweet communion with You].

1.verse: I LOVE You fervently and devotedly, O Lord, my Strength.

2.verse: The Lord is my Rock, my Fortress, and my Deliverer; my God, my keen and firm Strength in Whom I will trust and take refuge, my Shield, and the Horn of my salvation, my High Tower.

3.verse: I will call upon the Lord, Who is to be praised; so shall I be saved from my enemies.

4.verse: The cords or bands of death surrounded me, and the streams of ungodliness and the torrents of ruin terrified me.

5.verse: The cords of Sheol (the place of the dead) surrounded me; the snares of death confronted and came upon me.

6.verse: In my distress [when seemingly closed in] I called upon the Lord and cried to my God; He heard my voice out of His temple (heavenly dwelling place), and my cry came before Him, into His [very] ears.

7.verse: Then the earth quaked and rocked, the foundations also of the mountains trembled; they moved and were shaken because He was indignant and angry.

8.verse: There went up smoke from His nostrils; and lightning out of His mouth devoured; coals were kindled by it.

9.verse: He bowed the heavens also and came down; and thick darkness was under His feet.

10.verse: And He rode upon a cherub [a storm] and flew [swiftly]; yes, He sped on with the wings of the wind.

11.verse: He made darkness His secret hiding place; as His pavilion (His canopy) round about Him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.

12.verse: Out of the brightness before Him there broke forth through His thick clouds hailstones and coals of fire.

13.verse: The Lord also thundered from the heavens, and the Most High uttered His voice, amid hailstones and coals of fire.

14.verse: And He sent out His arrows and scattered them; and He flashed forth lightnings and put them to rout.

15.verse: Then the beds of the sea appeared and the foundations of the world were laid bare at Your rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.

16.verse: He reached from on high, He took me; He drew me out of many waters.

17.verse: He delivered me from my strong enemy and from those who hated and abhorred me, for they were too strong for me.

18.verse: They confronted and came upon me in the day of my calamity, but the Lord was my stay and support.

19.verse: He brought me forth also into a large place; He was delivering me because He was pleased with me and delighted in me.

20.verse: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness (my conscious integrity and sincerity with Him); according to the cleanness of my hands has He recompensed me.

21.verse: For I have kept the ways of the Lord and have not wickedly departed from my God.

22.verse: For all His ordinances were before me, and I put not away His statutes from me.

23.verse: I was upright before Him and blameless with Him, ever [on guard] to keep myself free from my sin and guilt.

24.verse: Therefore has the Lord recompensed me according to my righteousness (my uprightness and right standing with Him), according to the cleanness of my hands in His sight.

25.verse: With the kind and merciful You will show Yourself kind and merciful, with an upright man You will show Yourself upright,

26.verse: With the pure You will show Yourself pure, and with the perverse You will show Yourself contrary.

27.verse: For You deliver an afflicted and humble people but will bring down those with haughty looks.

28.verse: For You cause my lamp to be lighted and to shine; the Lord my God illumines my darkness.

29.verse: For by You I can run through a troop, and by my God I can leap over a wall.

30.verse: As for God, His way is perfect! The word of the Lord is tested and tried; He is a shield to all those who take refuge and put their trust in Him.

31.verse: For who is God except the Lord? Or who is the Rock save our God,

32.verse: The God who girds me with strength and makes my way perfect?

33.verse: He makes my feet like hinds' feet [able to stand firmly or make progress on the dangerous heights of testing and trouble]; He sets me securely upon my high places.

34.verse: He teaches my hands to war, so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

35.verse: You have also given me the shield of Your salvation, and Your right hand has held me up; Your gentleness and condescension have made me great.

36.verse: You have given plenty of room for my steps under me, that my feet would not slip.

37.verse: I pursued my enemies and overtook them; neither did I turn again till they were consumed.

38.verse: I smote them so that they were not able to rise; they fell wounded under my feet.

39.verse: For You have girded me with strength for the battle; You have subdued under me and caused to bow down those who rose up against me.

40.verse: You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me, that I might cut off those who hate me.

41.verse: They cried [for help], but there was none to deliver--even unto the Lord, but He answered them not.

42.verse: Then I beat them small as the dust before the wind; I emptied them out as the dirt and mire of the streets.

43.verse: You have delivered me from the strivings of the people; You made me the head of the nations; a people I had not known served me.

44.verse: As soon as they heard of me, they obeyed me; foreigners submitted themselves cringingly and yielded feigned obedience to me.

45.verse: Foreigners lost heart and came trembling out of their caves or strongholds.

46.verse: The Lord lives! Blessed be my Rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted,

47.verse: The God Who avenges me and subdues peoples under me,

48.verse: Who delivers me from my enemies; yes, You lift me up above those who rise up against me; You deliver me from the man of violence.

49.verse: Therefore will I give thanks and extol You, O Lord, among the nations, and sing praises to Your name.

50.verse: Great deliverances and triumphs gives He to His king; and He shows mercy and steadfast love to His anointed, to David and his offspring forever.

1.verse: THE HEAVENS declare the glory of God; and the firmament shows and proclaims His handiwork.

2.verse: Day after day pours forth speech, and night after night shows forth knowledge.

3.verse: There is no speech nor spoken word [from the stars]; their voice is not heard.

4.verse: Yet their voice [in evidence] goes out through all the earth, their sayings to the end of the world. Of the heavens has God made a tent for the sun,

5.verse: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber; and it rejoices as a strong man to run his course.

6.verse: Its going forth is from the end of the heavens, and its circuit to the ends of it; and nothing [yes, no one] is hidden from the heat of it.

7.verse: The law of the Lord is perfect, restoring the [whole] person; the testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple.

8.verse: The precepts of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart; the commandment of the Lord is pure and bright, enlightening the eyes.

9.verse: The [reverent] fear of the Lord is clean, enduring forever; the ordinances of the Lord are true and righteous altogether.

10.verse: More to be desired are they than gold, even than much fine gold; they are sweeter also than honey and drippings from the honeycomb.

11.verse: Moreover, by them is Your servant warned (reminded, illuminated, and instructed); and in keeping them there is great reward.

12.verse: Who can discern his lapses and errors? Clear me from hidden [and unconscious] faults.

13.verse: Keep back Your servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me! Then shall I be blameless, and I shall be innocent and clear of great transgression.

14.verse: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in Your sight, O Lord, my [firm, impenetrable] Rock and my Redeemer.

1.verse: MAY THE Lord answer you in the day of trouble! May the name of the God of Jacob set you up on high [and defend you];

2.verse: Send you help from the sanctuary and support, refresh, and strengthen you from Zion;

3.verse: Remember all your offerings and accept your burnt sacrifice. Selah [pause, and think of that]!

4.verse: May He grant you according to your heart's desire and fulfill all your plans.

5.verse: We will [shout in] triumph at your salvation and victory, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners. May the Lord fulfill all your petitions.

6.verse: Now I know that the Lord saves His anointed; He will answer him from His holy heaven with the saving strength of His right hand.

7.verse: Some trust in and boast of chariots and some of horses, but we will trust in and boast of the name of the Lord our God.

8.verse: They are bowed down and fallen, but we are risen and stand upright.

9.verse: O Lord, give victory; let the King answer us when we call.

1.verse: THE KING [David] shall joy in Your strength, O Lord; and in Your salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

2.verse: You have given him his heart's desire and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah [pause, and think of that]!

3.verse: For You send blessings of good things to meet him; You set a crown of pure gold on his head.

4.verse: He asked life of You, and You gave it to him--long life forever and evermore.

5.verse: His glory is great because of Your aid; splendor and majesty You bestow upon him.

6.verse: For You make him to be blessed and a blessing forever; You make him exceedingly glad with the joy of Your presence.

7.verse: For the king trusts, relies on, and is confident in the Lord, and through the mercy and steadfast love of the Most High he will never be moved.

8.verse: Your hand shall find all Your enemies; Your right hand shall find all those who hate You.

9.verse: You will make them as if in a blazing oven in the time of Your anger; the Lord will swallow them up in His wrath, and the fire will utterly consume them.

10.verse: Their offspring You will destroy from the earth, and their sons from among the children of men.

11.verse: For they planned evil against You; they conceived a mischievous plot which they are not able to perform.

12.verse: For You will make them turn their backs; You will aim Your bow [of divine justice] at their faces.

13.verse: Be exalted, Lord, in Your strength; we will sing and praise Your power.

1.verse: MY GOD, my God, why have You forsaken me? Why are You so far from helping me, and from the words of my groaning?

2.verse: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but You answer not; and by night I am not silent or find no rest.

3.verse: But You are holy, O You Who dwell in [the holy place where] the praises of Israel [are offered].

4.verse: Our fathers trusted in You; they trusted (leaned on, relied on You, and were confident) and You delivered them.

5.verse: They cried to You and were delivered; they trusted in, leaned on, and confidently relied on You, and were not ashamed or confounded or disappointed.

6.verse: But I am a worm, and no man; I am the scorn of men, and despised by the people.

7.verse: All who see me laugh at me and mock me; they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,

8.verse: He trusted and rolled himself on the Lord, that He would deliver him. Let Him deliver him, seeing that He delights in him!

9.verse: Yet You are He Who took me out of the womb; You made me hope and trust when I was on my mother's breasts.

10.verse: I was cast upon You from my very birth; from my mother's womb You have been my God.

11.verse: Be not far from me, for trouble is near and there is none to help.

12.verse: Many [foes like] bulls have surrounded me; strong bulls of Bashan have hedged me in.

13.verse: Against me they opened their mouths wide, like a ravening and roaring lion.

14.verse: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax; it is softened [with anguish] and melted down within me.

15.verse: My strength is dried up like a fragment of clay pottery; [with thirst] my tongue cleaves to my jaws; and You have brought me into the dust of death.

16.verse: For [like a pack of] dogs they have encompassed me; a company of evildoers has encircled me, they pierced my hands and my feet.

17.verse: I can count all my bones; [the evildoers] gaze at me.

18.verse: They part my clothing among them and cast lots for my raiment (a long, shirtlike garment, a seamless undertunic). )

19.verse: But be not far from me, O Lord; O my Help, hasten to aid me!

20.verse: Deliver my life from the sword, my dear life [my only one] from the power of the dog [the agent of execution].

21.verse: Save me from the lion's mouth; for You have answered me [kindly] from the horns of the wild oxen.

22.verse: I will declare Your name to my brethren; in the midst of the congregation will I praise You.

23.verse: You who fear (revere and worship) the Lord, praise Him! All you offspring of Jacob, glorify Him. Fear (revere and worship) Him, all you offspring of Israel.

24.verse: For He has not despised or abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither has He hidden His face from him, but when he cried to Him, He heard.

25.verse: My praise shall be of You in the great congregation. I will pay to Him my vows [made in the time of trouble] before them who fear (revere and worship) Him.

26.verse: The poor and afflicted shall eat and be satisfied; they shall praise the Lord--they who [diligently] seek for, inquire of and for Him, and require Him [as their greatest need]. May your hearts be quickened now and forever!

27.verse: All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn to the Lord, and all the families of the nations shall bow down and worship before You,

28.verse: For the kingship and the kingdom are the Lord's, and He is the ruler over the nations.

29.verse: All the mighty ones upon earth shall eat [in thanksgiving] and worship; all they that go down to the dust shall bow before Him, even he who cannot keep himself alive.

30.verse: Posterity shall serve Him; they shall tell of the Lord to the next generation.

31.verse: They shall come and shall declare His righteousness to a people yet to be born--that He has done it [that it is finished]!

1.verse: THE LORD is my Shepherd [to feed, guide, and shield me], I shall not lack.

2.verse: He makes me lie down in [fresh, tender] green pastures; He leads me beside the still and restful waters.

3.verse: He refreshes and restores my life (my self); He leads me in the paths of righteousness [uprightness and right standing with Him--not for my earning it, but] for His name's sake.

4.verse: Yes, though I walk through the [deep, sunless] valley of the shadow of death, I will fear or dread no evil, for You are with me; Your rod [to protect] and Your staff [to guide], they comfort me.

5.verse: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil; my [brimming] cup runs over.

6.verse: Surely or only goodness, mercy, and unfailing love shall follow me all the days of my life, and through the length of my days the house of the Lord [and His presence] shall be my dwelling place.

1.verse: THE EARTH is the Lord's, and the fullness of it, the world and they who dwell in it.

2.verse: For He has founded it upon the seas and established it upon the currents and the rivers.

3.verse: Who shall go up into the mountain of the Lord? Or who shall stand in His Holy Place?

4.verse: He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who has not lifted himself up to falsehood or to what is false, nor sworn deceitfully.

5.verse: He shall receive blessing from the Lord and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

6.verse: This is the generation [description] of those who seek Him [who inquire of and for Him and of necessity require Him], who seek Your face, [O God of] Jacob. Selah [pause, and think of that]!

7.verse: Lift up your heads, O you gates; and be lifted up, you age-abiding doors, that the King of glory may come in.

8.verse: Who is the King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord mighty in battle.

9.verse: Lift up your heads, O you gates; yes, lift them up, you age-abiding doors, that the King of glory may come in.

10.verse: Who is [He then] this King of glory? The Lord of hosts, He is the King of glory. Selah [pause, and think of that]!

1.verse: UNTO YOU, O Lord, do I bring my life.

2.verse: O my God, I trust, lean on, rely on, and am confident in You. Let me not be put to shame or [my hope in You] be disappointed; let not my enemies triumph over me.

3.verse: Yes, let none who trust and wait hopefully and look for You be put to shame or be disappointed; let them be ashamed who forsake the right or deal treacherously without cause.

4.verse: Show me Your ways, O Lord; teach me Your paths.

5.verse: Guide me in Your truth and faithfulness and teach me, for You are the God of my salvation; for You [You only and altogether] do I wait [expectantly] all the day long.

6.verse: Remember, O Lord, Your tender mercy and loving-kindness; for they have been ever from of old.

7.verse: Remember not the sins (the lapses and frailties) of my youth or my transgressions; according to Your mercy and steadfast love remember me, for Your goodness' sake, O Lord.

8.verse: Good and upright is the Lord; therefore will He instruct sinners in [His] way.

9.verse: He leads the humble in what is right, and the humble He teaches His way.

10.verse: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and steadfast love, even truth and faithfulness are they for those who keep His covenant and His testimonies.

11.verse: For Your name's sake, O Lord, pardon my iniquity and my guilt, for [they are] great.

12.verse: Who is the man who reverently fears and worships the Lord? Him shall He teach in the way that he should choose.

13.verse: He himself shall dwell at ease, and his offspring shall inherit the land.

14.verse: The secret [of the sweet, satisfying companionship] of the Lord have they who fear (revere and worship) Him, and He will show them His covenant and reveal to them its [deep, inner] meaning.

15.verse: My eyes are ever toward the Lord, for He will pluck my feet out of the net.

16.verse: [Lord] turn to me and be gracious to me, for I am lonely and afflicted.

17.verse: The troubles of my heart are multiplied; bring me out of my distresses.

18.verse: Behold my affliction and my pain and forgive all my sins [of thinking and doing].

19.verse: Consider my enemies, for they abound; they hate me with cruel hatred.

20.verse: O keep me, Lord, and deliver me; let me not be ashamed or disappointed, for my trust and my refuge are in You.

21.verse: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, for I wait for and expect You.

22.verse: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all their troubles.

1.verse: VINDICATE ME, O Lord, for I have walked in my integrity; I have [expectantly] trusted in, leaned on, and relied on the Lord without wavering and I shall not slide.

2.verse: Examine me, O Lord, and prove me; test my heart and my mind.

3.verse: For Your loving-kindness is before my eyes, and I have walked in Your truth [faithfully].

4.verse: I do not sit with false persons, nor fellowship with pretenders;

5.verse: I hate the company of evildoers and will not sit with the wicked.

6.verse: I will wash my hands in innocence, and go about Your altar, O Lord,

7.verse: That I may make the voice of thanksgiving heard and may tell of all Your wondrous works.

8.verse: Lord, I love the habitation of Your house, and the place where Your glory dwells.

9.verse: Gather me not with sinners and sweep me not away [with them], nor my life with bloodthirsty men,

10.verse: In whose hands is wickedness, and their right hands are full of bribes.

11.verse: But as for me, I will walk in my integrity; redeem me and be merciful and gracious to me.

12.verse: My foot stands on an even place; in the congregations will I bless the Lord.

1.verse: THE LORD is my Light and my Salvation--whom shall I fear or dread? The Lord is the Refuge and Stronghold of my life--of whom shall I be afraid?

2.verse: When the wicked, even my enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

3.verse: Though a host encamp against me, my heart shall not fear; though war arise against me, [even then] in this will I be confident.

4.verse: One thing have I asked of the Lord, that will I seek, inquire for, and [insistently] require: that I may dwell in the house of the Lord [in His presence] all the days of my life, to behold and gaze upon the beauty [the sweet attractiveness and the delightful loveliness] of the Lord and to meditate, consider, and inquire in His temple.

5.verse: For in the day of trouble He will hide me in His shelter; in the secret place of His tent will He hide me; He will set me high upon a rock.

6.verse: And now shall my head be lifted up above my enemies round about me; in His tent I will offer sacrifices and shouting of joy; I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to the Lord.

7.verse: Hear, O Lord, when I cry aloud; have mercy and be gracious to me and answer me!

8.verse: You have said, Seek My face [inquire for and require My presence as your vital need]. My heart says to You, Your face (Your presence), Lord, will I seek, inquire for, and require [of necessity and on the authority of Your Word].

9.verse: Hide not Your face from me; turn not Your servant away in anger, You Who have been my help! Cast me not off, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation!

10.verse: Although my father and my mother have forsaken me, yet the Lord will take me up [adopt me as His child].

11.verse: Teach me Your way, O Lord, and lead me in a plain and even path because of my enemies [those who lie in wait for me].

12.verse: Give me not up to the will of my adversaries, for false witnesses have risen up against me; they breathe out cruelty and violence.

13.verse: [What, what would have become of me] had I not believed that I would see the Lord's goodness in the land of the living!

14.verse: Wait and hope for and expect the Lord; be brave and of good courage and let your heart be stout and enduring. Yes, wait for and hope for and expect the Lord.

1.verse: UNTO YOU do I cry, O Lord my Rock, be not deaf and silent to me, lest, if You be silent to me, I become like those going down to the pit [the grave].

2.verse: Hear the voice of my supplication as I cry to You for help, as I lift up my hands toward Your innermost sanctuary (the Holy of Holies).

3.verse: Drag me not away with the wicked, with the workers of iniquity, who speak peace with their neighbors, but malice and mischief are in their hearts.

4.verse: Repay them according to their work and according to the wickedness of their doings; repay them according to the work of their hands; render to them what they deserve.

5.verse: Because they regard not the works of the Lord nor the operations of His hands, He will break them down and not rebuild them.

6.verse: Blessed be the Lord, because He has heard the voice of my supplications.

7.verse: The Lord is my Strength and my [impenetrable] Shield; my heart trusts in, relies on, and confidently leans on Him, and I am helped; therefore my heart greatly rejoices, and with my song will I praise Him.

8.verse: The Lord is their [unyielding] Strength, and He is the Stronghold of salvation to [me] His anointed.

9.verse: Save Your people and bless Your heritage; nourish and shepherd them and carry them forever.

1.verse: ASCRIBE TO the Lord, O sons of the mighty, ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.

2.verse: Give to the Lord the glory due to His name; worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness or in holy array.

3.verse: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters; the God of glory thunders; the Lord is upon many (great) waters.

4.verse: The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty.

5.verse: The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars; yes, the Lord breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon.

6.verse: He makes them also to skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion (Mount Hermon) like a young, wild ox.

7.verse: The voice of the Lord splits and flashes forth forked lightning.

8.verse: The voice of the Lord makes the wilderness tremble; the Lord shakes the Wilderness of Kadesh.

9.verse: The voice of the Lord makes the hinds bring forth their young, and His voice strips bare the forests, while in His temple everyone is saying, Glory!

10.verse: The Lord sat as King over the deluge; the Lord [still] sits as King [and] forever!

11.verse: The Lord will give [unyielding and impenetrable] strength to His people; the Lord will bless His people with peace.

1.verse: I WILL extol You, O Lord, for You have lifted me up and have not let my foes rejoice over me.

2.verse: O Lord my God, I cried to You and You have healed me.

3.verse: O Lord, You have brought my life up from Sheol (the place of the dead); You have kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit (the grave).

4.verse: Sing to the Lord, O you saints of His, and give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.

5.verse: For His anger is but for a moment, but His favor is for a lifetime or in His favor is life. Weeping may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning.

6.verse: As for me, in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

7.verse: By Your favor, O Lord, You have established me as a strong mountain; You hid Your face, and I was troubled.

8.verse: I cried to You, O Lord, and to the Lord I made supplication.

9.verse: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit (the grave)? Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your truth and faithfulness to men?

10.verse: Hear, O Lord, have mercy and be gracious to me! O Lord, be my helper!

11.verse: You have turned my mourning into dancing for me; You have put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness,

12.verse: To the end that my tongue and my heart and everything glorious within me may sing praise to You and not be silent. O Lord my God, I will give thanks to You forever.

1.verse: IN YOU, O Lord, do I put my trust and seek refuge; let me never be put to shame or [have my hope in You] disappointed; deliver me in Your righteousness!

2.verse: Bow down Your ear to me, deliver me speedily! Be my Rock of refuge, a strong Fortress to save me!

3.verse: Yes, You are my Rock and my Fortress; therefore for Your name's sake lead me and guide me.

4.verse: Draw me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me, for You are my Strength and my Stronghold.

5.verse: Into Your hands I commit my spirit; You have redeemed me, O Lord, the God of truth and faithfulness.

6.verse: [You and] I abhor those who pay regard to vain idols; but I trust in, rely on, and confidently lean on the Lord.

7.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in Your mercy and steadfast love, because You have seen my affliction, You have taken note of my life's distresses,

8.verse: And You have not given me into the hand of the enemy; You have set my feet in a broad place.

9.verse: Have mercy and be gracious unto me, O Lord, for I am in trouble; with grief my eye is weakened, also my inner self and my body.

10.verse: For my life is spent with sorrow and my years with sighing; my strength has failed because of my iniquity, and even my bones have wasted away.

11.verse: To all my enemies I have become a reproach, but especially to my neighbors, and a dread to my acquaintances, who flee from me on the street.

12.verse: I am forgotten like a dead man, and out of mind; like a broken vessel am I.

13.verse: For I have heard the slander of many; terror is on every side! While they schemed together against me, they plotted to take my life.

14.verse: But I trusted in, relied on, and was confident in You, O Lord; I said, You are my God.

15.verse: My times are in Your hands; deliver me from the hands of my foes and those who pursue me and persecute me.

16.verse: Let Your face shine on Your servant; save me for Your mercy's sake and in Your loving-kindness.

17.verse: Let me not be put to shame, O Lord, or disappointed, for I am calling upon You; let the wicked be put to shame, let them be silent in Sheol (the place of the dead).

18.verse: Let the lying lips be silenced, which speak insolently against the [consistently] righteous with pride and contempt.

19.verse: Oh, how great is Your goodness, which You have laid up for those who fear, revere, and worship You, goodness which You have wrought for those who trust and take refuge in You before the sons of men!

20.verse: In the secret place of Your presence You hide them from the plots of men; You keep them secretly in Your pavilion from the strife of tongues.

21.verse: Blessed be the Lord! For He has shown me His marvelous loving favor when I was beset as in a besieged city.

22.verse: As for me, I said in my haste and alarm, I am cut off from before Your eyes. But You heard the voice of my supplications when I cried to You for aid.

23.verse: O love the Lord, all you His saints! The Lord preserves the faithful, and plentifully pays back him who deals haughtily.

24.verse: Be strong and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for and hope for and expect the Lord!

1.verse: BLESSED (HAPPY, fortunate, to be envied) is he who has forgiveness of his transgression continually exercised upon him, whose sin is covered.

2.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the man to whom the Lord imputes no iniquity and in whose spirit there is no deceit.

3.verse: When I kept silence [before I confessed], my bones wasted away through my groaning all the day long.

4.verse: For day and night Your hand [of displeasure] was heavy upon me; my moisture was turned into the drought of summer. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: I acknowledged my sin to You, and my iniquity I did not hide. I said, I will confess my transgressions to the Lord [continually unfolding the past till all is told]--then You [instantly] forgave me the guilt and iniquity of my sin. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

6.verse: For this [forgiveness] let everyone who is godly pray--pray to You in a time when You may be found; surely when the great waters [of trial] overflow, they shall not reach [the spirit in] him.

7.verse: You are a hiding place for me; You, Lord, preserve me from trouble, You surround me with songs and shouts of deliverance. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

8.verse: I [the Lord] will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with My eye upon you.

9.verse: Be not like the horse or the mule, which lack understanding, which must have their mouths held firm with bit and bridle, or else they will not come with you.

10.verse: Many are the sorrows of the wicked, but he who trusts in, relies on, and confidently leans on the Lord shall be compassed about with mercy and with loving-kindness.

11.verse: Be glad in the Lord and rejoice, you [uncompromisingly] righteous [you who are upright and in right standing with Him]; shout for joy, all you upright in heart!

1.verse: REJOICE IN the Lord, O you [uncompromisingly] righteous [you upright in right standing with God]; for praise is becoming and appropriate for those who are upright [in heart].

2.verse: Give thanks to the Lord with the lyre; sing praises to Him with the harp of ten strings.

3.verse: Sing to Him a new song; play skillfully [on the strings] with a loud and joyful sound.

4.verse: For the word of the Lord is right; and all His work is done in faithfulness.

5.verse: He loves righteousness and justice; the earth is full of the loving-kindness of the Lord.

6.verse: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made, and all their host by the breath of His mouth.

7.verse: He gathers the waters of the sea as in a bottle; He puts the deeps in storage places.

8.verse: Let all the earth fear the Lord [revere and worship Him]; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.

9.verse: For He spoke, and it was done; He commanded, and it stood fast.

10.verse: The Lord brings the counsel of the nations to nought; He makes the thoughts and plans of the peoples of no effect.

11.verse: The counsel of the Lord stands forever, the thoughts of His heart through all generations.

12.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the nation whose God is the Lord, the people He has chosen as His heritage.

13.verse: The Lord looks from heaven, He beholds all the sons of men;

14.verse: From His dwelling place He looks [intently] upon all the inhabitants of the earth--

15.verse: He Who fashions the hearts of them all, Who considers all their doings.

16.verse: No king is saved by the great size and power of his army; a mighty man is not delivered by [his] much strength.

17.verse: A horse is devoid of value for victory; neither does he deliver any by his great power.

18.verse: Behold, the Lord's eye is upon those who fear Him [who revere and worship Him with awe], who wait for Him and hope in His mercy and loving-kindness,

19.verse: To deliver them from death and keep them alive in famine.

20.verse: Our inner selves wait [earnestly] for the Lord; He is our Help and our Shield.

21.verse: For in Him does our heart rejoice, because we have trusted (relied on and been confident) in His holy name.

22.verse: Let Your mercy and loving-kindness, O Lord, be upon us, in proportion to our waiting and hoping for You.

1.verse: I WILL bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth.

2.verse: My life makes its boast in the Lord; let the humble and afflicted hear and be glad.

3.verse: O magnify the Lord with me, and let us exalt His name together.

4.verse: I sought (inquired of) the Lord and required Him [of necessity and on the authority of His Word], and He heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.

5.verse: They looked to Him and were radiant; their faces shall never blush for shame or be confused.

6.verse: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.

7.verse: The Angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear Him [who revere and worship Him with awe] and each of them He delivers.

8.verse: O taste and see that the Lord [our God] is good! Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the man who trusts and takes refuge in Him.

9.verse: O fear the Lord, you His saints [revere and worship Him]! For there is no want to those who truly revere and worship Him with godly fear.

10.verse: The young lions lack food and suffer hunger, but they who seek (inquire of and require) the Lord [by right of their need and on the authority of His Word], none of them shall lack any beneficial thing.

11.verse: Come, you children, listen to me; I will teach you to revere and worshipfully fear the Lord.

12.verse: What man is he who desires life and longs for many days, that he may see good?

13.verse: Keep your tongue from evil and your lips from speaking deceit.

14.verse: Depart from evil and do good; seek, inquire for, and crave peace and pursue (go after) it!

15.verse: The eyes of the Lord are toward the [uncompromisingly] righteous and His ears are open to their cry.

16.verse: The face of the Lord is against those who do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

17.verse: When the righteous cry for help, the Lord hears, and delivers them out of all their distress and troubles.

18.verse: The Lord is close to those who are of a broken heart and saves such as are crushed with sorrow for sin and are humbly and thoroughly penitent.

19.verse: Many evils confront the [consistently] righteous, but the Lord delivers him out of them all.

20.verse: He keeps all his bones; not one of them is broken.

21.verse: Evil shall cause the death of the wicked; and they who hate the just and righteous shall be held guilty and shall be condemned.

22.verse: The Lord redeems the lives of His servants, and none of those who take refuge and trust in Him shall be condemned or held guilty.

1.verse: CONTEND, O Lord, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me!

2.verse: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for my help!

3.verse: Draw out also the spear and javelin and close up the way of those who pursue and persecute me. Say to me, I am your deliverance!

4.verse: Let them be put to shame and dishonor who seek and require my life; let them be turned back and confounded who plan my hurt!

5.verse: Let them be as chaff before the wind, with the Angel of the Lord driving them on!

6.verse: Let their way be through dark and slippery places, with the Angel of the Lord pursuing and afflicting them.

7.verse: For without cause they hid for me their net; a pit of destruction without cause they dug for my life.

8.verse: Let destruction befall [my foe] unawares; let the net he hid for me catch him; let him fall into that very destruction.

9.verse: Then I shall be joyful in the Lord; I shall rejoice in His deliverance.

10.verse: All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like You, You Who deliver the poor and the afflicted from him who is too strong for him, yes, the poor and the needy from him who snatches away his goods?

11.verse: Malicious and unrighteous witnesses rise up; they ask me of things that I know not.

12.verse: They reward me evil for good to my personal bereavement.

13.verse: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth; I afflicted myself with fasting, and I prayed with head bowed on my breast.

14.verse: I behaved as if grieving for my friend or my brother; I bowed down in sorrow, as one who bewails his mother.

15.verse: But in my stumbling and limping they rejoiced and gathered together [against me]; the smiters (slanderers and revilers) gathered against me, and I knew them not; they ceased not to slander and revile me.

16.verse: Like profane mockers at feasts [making sport for the price of a cake] they gnashed at me with their teeth.

17.verse: Lord, how long will You look on [without action]? Rescue my life from their destructions, my dear and only life from the lions!

18.verse: I will give You thanks in the great assembly; I will praise You among a mighty throng.

19.verse: Let not those who are wrongfully my foes rejoice over me; neither let them wink with the eye who hate me without cause.

20.verse: For they do not speak peace, but they devise deceitful matters against those who are quiet in the land.

21.verse: Yes, they open their mouths wide against me; they say, Aha! Aha! Our eyes have seen it!

22.verse: You have seen this, O Lord; keep not silence! O Lord, be not far from me!

23.verse: Arouse Yourself, awake to the justice due me, even to my cause, my God and my Lord!

24.verse: Judge and vindicate me, O Lord my God, according to Your righteousness (Your rightness and justice); and let [my foes] not rejoice over me!

25.verse: Let them not say in their hearts, Aha, that is what we wanted! Let them not say, We have swallowed him up and utterly destroyed him.

26.verse: Let them be put to shame and confusion together who rejoice at my calamity! Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify and exalt themselves over me!

27.verse: Let those who favor my righteous cause and have pleasure in my uprightness shout for joy and be glad and say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, Who takes pleasure in the prosperity of His servant.

28.verse: And my tongue shall talk of Your righteousness, rightness, and justice, and of [my reasons for] Your praise all the day long.

1.verse: TRANSGRESSION [like an oracle] speaks to the wicked deep in his heart. There is no fear or dread of God before his eyes.

2.verse: For he flatters and deceives himself in his own eyes that his iniquity will not be found out and be hated.

3.verse: The words of his mouth are wrong and deceitful; he has ceased to be wise and to do good.

4.verse: He plans wrongdoing on his bed; he sets himself in a way that is not good; he does not reject or despise evil.

5.verse: Your mercy and loving-kindness, O Lord, extend to the skies, and Your faithfulness to the clouds.

6.verse: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God, Your judgments are like the great deep. O Lord, You preserve man and beast.

7.verse: How precious is Your steadfast love, O God! The children of men take refuge and put their trust under the shadow of Your wings.

8.verse: They relish and feast on the abundance of Your house; and You cause them to drink of the stream of Your pleasures.

9.verse: For with You is the fountain of life; in Your light do we see light.

10.verse: O continue Your loving-kindness to those who know You, Your righteousness (salvation) to the upright in heart.

11.verse: Let not the foot of pride overtake me, and let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.

12.verse: There the workers of iniquity fall and lie prostrate; they are thrust down and shall not be able to rise.

1.verse: FRET NOT yourself because of evildoers, neither be envious against those who work unrighteousness (that which is not upright or in right standing with God).

2.verse: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.

3.verse: Trust (lean on, rely on, and be confident) in the Lord and do good; so shall you dwell in the land and feed surely on His faithfulness, and truly you shall be fed.

4.verse: Delight yourself also in the Lord, and He will give you the desires and secret petitions of your heart.

5.verse: Commit your way to the Lord [roll and repose each care of your load on Him]; trust (lean on, rely on, and be confident) also in Him and He will bring it to pass.

6.verse: And He will make your uprightness and right standing with God go forth as the light, and your justice and right as [the shining sun of] the noonday.

7.verse: Be still and rest in the Lord; wait for Him and patiently lean yourself upon Him; fret not yourself because of him who prospers in his way, because of the man who brings wicked devices to pass.

8.verse: Cease from anger and forsake wrath; fret not yourself--it tends only to evildoing.

9.verse: For evildoers shall be cut off, but those who wait and hope and look for the Lord [in the end] shall inherit the earth.

10.verse: For yet a little while, and the evildoers will be no more; though you look with care where they used to be, they will not be found.

11.verse: But the meek [in the end] shall inherit the earth and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

12.verse: The wicked plot against the [uncompromisingly] righteous (the upright in right standing with God); they gnash at them with their teeth.

13.verse: The Lord laughs at [the wicked], for He sees that their own day [of defeat] is coming.

14.verse: The wicked draw the sword and bend their bows to cast down the poor and needy, to slay those who walk uprightly (blameless in conduct and in conversation).

15.verse: The swords [of the wicked] shall enter their own hearts, and their bows shall be broken.

16.verse: Better is the little that the [uncompromisingly] righteous have than the abundance [of possessions] of many who are wrong and wicked.

17.verse: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, but the Lord upholds the [consistently] righteous.

18.verse: The Lord knows the days of the upright and blameless, and their heritage will abide forever.

19.verse: They shall not be put to shame in the time of evil; and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.

20.verse: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord shall be as the fat of lambs [that is consumed in smoke] and as the glory of the pastures. They shall vanish; like smoke shall they consume away.

21.verse: The wicked borrow and pay not again [for they may be unable], but the [uncompromisingly] righteous deal kindly and give [for they are able].

22.verse: For such as are blessed of God shall [in the end] inherit the earth, but they that are cursed of Him shall be cut off.

23.verse: The steps of a [good] man are directed and established by the Lord when He delights in his way [and He busies Himself with his every step].

24.verse: Though he falls, he shall not be utterly cast down, for the Lord grasps his hand in support and upholds him.

25.verse: I have been young and now am old, yet have I not seen the [uncompromisingly] righteous forsaken or their seed begging bread.

26.verse: All day long they are merciful and deal graciously; they lend, and their offspring are blessed.

27.verse: Depart from evil and do good; and you will dwell forever [securely].

28.verse: For the Lord delights in justice and forsakes not His saints; they are preserved forever, but the offspring of the wicked [in time] shall be cut off.

29.verse: [Then] the [consistently] righteous shall inherit the land and dwell upon it forever.

30.verse: The mouth of the [uncompromisingly] righteous utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks with justice.

31.verse: The law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.

32.verse: The wicked lie in wait for the [uncompromisingly] righteous and seek to put them to death.

33.verse: The Lord will not leave them in their hands, or [suffer them to] condemn them when they are judged.

34.verse: Wait for and expect the Lord and keep and heed His way, and He will exalt you to inherit the land; [in the end] when the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.

35.verse: I have seen a wicked man in great power and spreading himself like a green tree in its native soil,

36.verse: Yet he passed away, and behold, he was not; yes, I sought and inquired for him, but he could not be found.

37.verse: Mark the blameless man and behold the upright, for there is a happy end for the man of peace.

38.verse: As for transgressors, they shall be destroyed together; in the end the wicked shall be cut off.

39.verse: But the salvation of the [consistently] righteous is of the Lord; He is their Refuge and secure Stronghold in the time of trouble.

40.verse: And the Lord helps them and delivers them; He delivers them from the wicked and saves them, because they trust and take refuge in Him.

1.verse: O LORD, rebuke me not in Your wrath, neither chasten me in Your hot displeasure.

2.verse: For Your arrows have sunk into me and stick fast, and Your hand has come down upon me and pressed me sorely.

3.verse: There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your indignation; neither is there any health or rest in my bones because of my sin.

4.verse: For my iniquities have gone over my head [like waves of a flood]; as a heavy burden they weigh too much for me.

5.verse: My wounds are loathsome and corrupt because of my foolishness.

6.verse: I am bent and bowed down greatly; I go about mourning all the day long.

7.verse: For my loins are filled with burning; and there is no soundness in my flesh.

8.verse: I am faint and sorely bruised [deadly cold and quite worn out]; I groan by reason of the disquiet and moaning of my heart.

9.verse: Lord, all my desire is before You; and my sighing is not hidden from You.

10.verse: My heart throbs, my strength fails me; as for the light of my eyes, it also is gone from me.

11.verse: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my plague; and my neighbors and my near ones stand afar off.

12.verse: They also that seek and demand my life lay snares for me, and they that seek and require my hurt speak crafty and mischievous things; they meditate treachery and deceit all the day long.

13.verse: But I, like a deaf man, hear not; and I am like a dumb man who opens not his mouth.

14.verse: Yes, I have become like a man who hears not, in whose mouth are no arguments or replies.

15.verse: For in You, O Lord, do I hope; You will answer, O Lord my God.

16.verse: For I pray, Let them not rejoice over me, who when my foot slips boast against me.

17.verse: For I am ready to halt and fall; my pain and sorrow are continually before me.

18.verse: For I do confess my guilt and iniquity; I am filled with sorrow for my sin.

19.verse: But my enemies are vigorous and strong, and those who hate me wrongfully are multiplied.

20.verse: They also that render evil for good are adversaries to me, because I follow the thing that is good.

21.verse: Forsake me not, O Lord; O my God, be not far from me.

22.verse: Make haste to help me, O Lord, my Salvation.

1.verse: I SAID, I will take heed and guard my ways, that I may sin not with my tongue; I will muzzle my mouth as with a bridle while the wicked are before me.

2.verse: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace without profit and had no comfort away from good, while my distress was renewed.

3.verse: My heart was hot within me. While I was musing, the fire burned; then I spoke with my tongue:

4.verse: Lord, make me to know my end and [to appreciate] the measure of my days--what it is; let me know and realize how frail I am [how transient is my stay here].

5.verse: Behold, You have made my days as [short as] handbreadths, and my lifetime is as nothing in Your sight. Truly every man at his best is merely a breath! Selah [pause, and think calmly of that]!

6.verse: Surely every man walks to and fro--like a shadow in a pantomime; surely for futility and emptiness he is in turmoil; each one heaps up riches, not knowing who will gather them.

7.verse: And now, Lord, what do I wait for and expect? My hope and expectation are in You.

8.verse: Deliver me from all my transgressions; make me not the scorn and reproach of the [self-confident] fool!

9.verse: I am dumb, I open not my mouth, for it is You Who has done it.

10.verse: Remove Your stroke away from me; I am consumed by the conflict and the blow of Your hand.

11.verse: When with rebukes You correct and chasten man for sin, You waste his beauty like a moth and what is dear to him consumes away; surely every man is a mere breath. Selah [pause, and think calmly of that]!

12.verse: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear to my cry; hold not Your peace at my tears! For I am Your passing guest, a temporary resident, as all my fathers were.

13.verse: O look away from me and spare me, that I may recover cheerfulness and encouraging strength and know gladness before I go and am no more!

1.verse: I WAITED patiently and expectantly for the Lord; and He inclined to me and heard my cry.

2.verse: He drew me up out of a horrible pit [a pit of tumult and of destruction], out of the miry clay (froth and slime), and set my feet upon a rock, steadying my steps and establishing my goings.

3.verse: And He has put a new song in my mouth, a song of praise to our God. Many shall see and fear (revere and worship) and put their trust and confident reliance in the Lord.

4.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the man who makes the Lord his refuge and trust, and turns not to the proud or to followers of false gods.

5.verse: Many, O Lord my God, are the wonderful works which You have done, and Your thoughts toward us; no one can compare with You! If I should declare and speak of them, they are too many to be numbered.

6.verse: Sacrifice and offering You do not desire, nor have You delight in them; You have given me the capacity to hear and obey [Your law, a more valuable service than] burnt offerings and sin offerings [which] You do not require.

7.verse: Then said I, Behold, I come; in the volume of the book it is written of me;

8.verse: I delight to do Your will, O my God; yes, Your law is within my heart.

9.verse: I have proclaimed glad tidings of righteousness in the great assembly [tidings of uprightness and right standing with God]. Behold, I have not restrained my lips, as You know, O Lord.

10.verse: I have not concealed Your righteousness within my heart; I have proclaimed Your faithfulness and Your salvation. I have not hid away Your steadfast love and Your truth from the great assembly.

11.verse: Withhold not Your tender mercy from me, O Lord; let Your loving-kindness and Your truth continually preserve me!

12.verse: For innumerable evils have compassed me about; my iniquities have taken such hold on me that I am not able to look up. They are more than the hairs of my head, and my heart has failed me and forsaken me.

13.verse: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me; O Lord, make haste to help me!

14.verse: Let them be put to shame and confounded together who seek and require my life to destroy it; let them be driven backward and brought to dishonor who wish me evil and delight in my hurt!

15.verse: Let them be desolate by reason of their shame who say to me, Aha, aha!

16.verse: Let all those that seek and require You rejoice and be glad in You; let such as love Your salvation say continually, The Lord be magnified!

17.verse: [As for me] I am poor and needy, yet the Lord takes thought and plans for me. You are my Help and my Deliverer. O my God, do not tarry!

1.verse: BLESSED (HAPPY, fortunate, to be envied) is he who considers the weak and the poor; the Lord will deliver him in the time of evil and trouble.

2.verse: The Lord will protect him and keep him alive; he shall be called blessed in the land; and You will not deliver him to the will of his enemies.

3.verse: The Lord will sustain, refresh, and strengthen him on his bed of languishing; all his bed You [O Lord] will turn, change, and transform in his illness.

4.verse: I said, Lord, be merciful and gracious to me; heal my inner self, for I have sinned against You.

5.verse: My enemies speak evil of me, [saying], When will he die and his name perish?

6.verse: And when one comes to see me, he speaks falsehood and empty words, while his heart gathers mischievous gossip [against me]; when he goes away, he tells it abroad.

7.verse: All who hate me whisper together about me; against me do they devise my hurt [imagining the worst for me].

8.verse: An evil disease, say they, is poured out upon him and cleaves fast to him; and now that he is bedfast, he will not rise up again.

9.verse: Even my own familiar friend, in whom I trusted (relied on and was confident), who ate of my bread, has lifted up his heel against me.

10.verse: But You, O Lord, be merciful and gracious to me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

11.verse: By this I know that You favor and delight in me, because my enemy does not triumph over me.

12.verse: And as for me, You have upheld me in my integrity and set me in Your presence forever.

13.verse: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting and to everlasting [from this age to the next, and forever]! Amen and Amen (so be it).

1.verse: AS THE hart pants and longs for the water brooks, so I pant and long for You, O God.

2.verse: My inner self thirsts for God, for the living God. When shall I come and behold the face of God?

3.verse: My tears have been my food day and night, while men say to me all day long, Where is your God?

4.verse: These things I [earnestly] remember and pour myself out within me: how I went slowly before the throng and led them in procession to the house of God [like a bandmaster before his band, timing the steps to the sound of music and the chant of song], with the voice of shouting and praise, a throng keeping festival.
