5.verse: Why are you cast down, O my inner self? And why should you moan over me and be disquieted within me? Hope in God and wait expectantly for Him, for I shall yet praise Him, my Help and my God.

6.verse: O my God, my life is cast down upon me [and I find the burden more than I can bear]; therefore will I [earnestly] remember You from the land of the Jordan [River] and the [summits of Mount] Hermon, from the little mountain Mizar.

7.verse: [Roaring] deep calls to [roaring] deep at the thunder of Your waterspouts; all Your breakers and Your rolling waves have gone over me.

8.verse: Yet the Lord will command His loving-kindness in the daytime, and in the night His song shall be with me, a prayer to the God of my life.

9.verse: I will say to God my Rock, Why have You forgotten me? Why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

10.verse: As with a sword [crushing] in my bones, my enemies taunt and reproach me, while they say continually to me, Where is your God?

11.verse: Why are you cast down, O my inner self? And why should you moan over me and be disquieted within me? Hope in God and wait expectantly for Him, for I shall yet praise Him, Who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

1.verse: JUDGE and vindicate me, O God; plead and defend my cause against an ungodly nation. O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man!

2.verse: For You are the God of my strength [my Stronghold--in Whom I take refuge]; why have You cast me off? Why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

3.verse: O send out Your light and Your truth, let them lead me; let them bring me to Your holy hill and to Your dwelling.

4.verse: Then will I go to the altar of God, to God, my exceeding joy; yes, with the lyre will I praise You, O God, my God!

5.verse: Why are you cast down, O my inner self? And why should you moan over me and be disquieted within me? Hope in God and wait expectantly for Him, for I shall yet praise Him, Who is the help of my [sad] countenance, and my God.

1.verse: WE HAVE heard with our ears, O God; our fathers have told us [what] work You did in their days, in the days of old.

2.verse: You drove out the nations with Your hand and it was Your power that gave [Israel] a home by rooting out the [heathen] peoples, but [Israel] You spread out.

3.verse: For they got not the land [of Canaan] in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them; but Your right hand and Your arm and the light of Your countenance [did it], because You were favorable toward and did delight in them.

4.verse: You are my King, O God; command victories and deliverance for Jacob (Israel).

5.verse: Through You shall we push down our enemies; through Your name shall we tread them under who rise up against us.

6.verse: For I will not trust in and lean on my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

7.verse: But You have saved us from our foes and have put them to shame who hate us.

8.verse: In God we have made our boast all the day long, and we will give thanks to Your name forever. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

9.verse: But now You have cast us off and brought us to dishonor, and You go not out with our armies.

10.verse: You make us to turn back from the enemy, and they who hate us take spoil for themselves.

11.verse: You have made us like sheep intended for mutton and have scattered us in exile among the nations.

12.verse: You sell Your people for nothing, and have not increased Your wealth by their price.

13.verse: You have made us the taunt of our neighbors, a scoffing and a derision to those who are round about us.

14.verse: You make us a byword among the nations, a shaking of the heads among the people.

15.verse: My dishonor is before me all day long, and shame has covered my face

16.verse: At the words of the taunter and reviler, by reason of the enemy and the revengeful.

17.verse: All this is come upon us, yet have we not forgotten You, neither have we been false to Your covenant [which You made with our fathers].

18.verse: Our hearts are not turned back, neither have our steps declined from Your path,

19.verse: Though You have distressingly broken us in the place of jackals and covered us with deep darkness, even with the shadow of death.

20.verse: If we had forgotten the name of our God or stretched out our hands to a strange god,

21.verse: Would not God discover this? For He knows the secrets of the heart.

22.verse: No, but for Your sake we are killed all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

23.verse: Awake! Why do You sleep, O Lord? Arouse Yourself, cast us not off forever!

24.verse: Why do You hide Your face and forget our affliction and our oppression?

25.verse: For our lives are bowed down to the dust; our bodies cleave to the ground.

26.verse: Rise up! Come to our help, and deliver us for Your mercy's sake and because of Your steadfast love!

1.verse: MY HEART overflows with a goodly theme; I address my psalm to a King. My tongue is like the pen of a ready writer.

2.verse: You are fairer than the children of men; graciousness is poured upon Your lips; therefore God has blessed You forever.

3.verse: Gird Your sword upon Your thigh, O mighty One, in Your glory and Your majesty!

4.verse: And in Your majesty ride on triumphantly for the cause of truth, humility, and righteousness (uprightness and right standing with God); and let Your right hand guide You to tremendous things.

5.verse: Your arrows are sharp; the peoples fall under You; Your darts pierce the hearts of the King's enemies.

6.verse: Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; the scepter of righteousness is the scepter of Your kingdom.

7.verse: You love righteousness, uprightness, and right standing with God and hate wickedness; therefore God, Your God, has anointed You with the oil of gladness above Your fellows.

8.verse: Your garments are all fragrant with myrrh, aloes, and cassia; stringed instruments make You glad.

9.verse: Kings' daughters are among Your honorable women; at Your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.

10.verse: Hear, O daughter, consider, submit, and consent to my instruction: forget also your own people and your father's house;

11.verse: So will the King desire your beauty; because He is your Lord, be submissive and reverence and honor Him.

12.verse: And, O daughter of Tyre, the richest of the people shall entreat your favor with a gift.

13.verse: The King's daughter in the inner part [of the palace] is all glorious; her clothing is inwrought with gold.

14.verse: She shall be brought to the King in raiment of needlework; with the virgins, her companions that follow her, she shall be brought to You.

15.verse: With gladness and rejoicing will they be brought; they will enter into the King's palace.

16.verse: Instead of Your fathers shall be Your sons, whom You will make princes in all the land.

17.verse: I will make Your name to be remembered in all generations; therefore shall the people praise and give You thanks forever and ever.

1.verse: GOD IS our Refuge and Strength [mighty and impenetrable to temptation], a very present and well-proved help in trouble.

2.verse: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth should change and though the mountains be shaken into the midst of the seas,

3.verse: Though its waters roar and foam, though the mountains tremble at its swelling and tumult. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

4.verse: There is a river whose streams shall make glad the city of God, the holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High.

5.verse: God is in the midst of her, she shall not be moved; God will help her right early [at the dawn of the morning].

6.verse: The nations raged, the kingdoms tottered and were moved; He uttered His voice, the earth melted.

7.verse: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our Refuge (our Fortress and High Tower). Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

8.verse: Come, behold the works of the Lord, Who has wrought desolations and wonders in the earth.

9.verse: He makes wars to cease to the end of the earth; He breaks the bow into pieces and snaps the spear in two; He burns the chariots in the fire.

10.verse: Let be and be still, and know (recognize and understand) that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations! I will be exalted in the earth!

11.verse: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our Refuge (our High Tower and Stronghold). Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

1.verse: O CLAP your hands, all you peoples! Shout to God with the voice of triumph and songs of joy!

2.verse: For the Lord Most High excites terror, awe, and dread; He is a great King over all the earth.

3.verse: He subdued peoples under us, and nations under our feet.

4.verse: He chose our inheritance for us, the glory and pride of Jacob, whom He loves. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: God has ascended amid shouting, the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.

6.verse: Sing praises to God, sing praises! Sing praises to our King, sing praises!

7.verse: For God is the King of all the earth; sing praises in a skillful psalm and with understanding.

8.verse: God reigns over the nations; God sits upon His holy throne.

9.verse: The princes and nobles of the peoples are gathered together, a [united] people for the God of Abraham, for the shields of the earth belong to God; He is highly exalted.

1.verse: GREAT IS the Lord, and highly to be praised in the city of our God! His holy mountain,

2.verse: Fair and beautiful in elevation, is the joy of all the earth--Mount Zion [the City of David], to the northern side [Mount Moriah and the temple], the [whole] city of the Great King!

3.verse: God has made Himself known in her palaces as a Refuge (a High Tower and a Stronghold).

4.verse: For, behold, the kings assembled, they came onward and they passed away together.

5.verse: They looked, they were amazed; they were stricken with terror and took to flight [affrighted and dismayed].

6.verse: Trembling took hold of them there, and pain as of a woman in childbirth.

7.verse: With the east wind You shattered the ships of Tarshish.

8.verse: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it forever. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

9.verse: We have thought of Your steadfast love, O God, in the midst of Your temple.

10.verse: As is Your name, O God, so is Your praise to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is full of righteousness (rightness and justice).

11.verse: Let Mount Zion be glad! Let the daughters of Judah rejoice because of Your [righteous] judgments!

12.verse: Walk about Zion, and go round about her, number her towers (her lofty and noble deeds of past days),

13.verse: Consider well her ramparts, go through her palaces and citadels, that you may tell the next generation [and cease recalling disappointments].

14.verse: For this God is our God forever and ever; He will be our guide [even] until death.

1.verse: HEAR THIS, all you peoples; give ear, all you inhabitants of the world,

2.verse: Both low and high, rich and poor together:

3.verse: My mouth shall speak wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be understanding.

4.verse: I will submit and consent to a parable or proverb; to the music of a lyre I will unfold my riddle (my problem).

5.verse: Why should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of those who would supplant me surrounds me on every side,

6.verse: Even of those who trust in and lean on their wealth and boast of the abundance of their riches?

7.verse: None of them can by any means redeem [either himself or] his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him--

8.verse: For the ransom of a life is too costly, and [the price one can pay] can never suffice--

9.verse: So that he should live on forever and never see the pit (the grave) and corruption.

10.verse: For he sees that even wise men die; the [self-confident] fool and the stupid alike perish and leave their wealth to others.

11.verse: Their inward thought is that their houses will continue forever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands their own [apart from God] and after their own names.

12.verse: But man, with all his honor and pomp, does not remain; he is like the beasts that perish.

13.verse: This is the fate of those who are foolishly confident, yet after them men approve their sayings. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

14.verse: Like sheep they are appointed for Sheol (the place of the dead); death shall be their shepherd. And the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their form and beauty shall be consumed, for Sheol shall be their dwelling.

15.verse: But God will redeem me from the power of Sheol (the place of the dead); for He will receive me. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

16.verse: Be not afraid when [an ungodly] one is made rich, when the wealth and glory of his house are increased;

17.verse: For when he dies he will carry nothing away; his glory will not descend after him.

18.verse: Though while he lives he counts himself happy and prosperous, and though a man gets praise when he does well [for himself],

19.verse: He will go to the generation of his fathers, who will nevermore see the light.

20.verse: A man who is held in honor and understands not is like the beasts that perish.

1.verse: THE MIGHTY One, God, the Lord, speaks and calls the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.

2.verse: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shines forth.

3.verse: Our God comes and does not keep silence; a fire devours before Him, and round about Him a mighty tempest rages.

4.verse: He calls to the heavens above and to the earth, that He may judge His people:

5.verse: Gather together to Me My saints [those who have found grace in My sight], those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.

6.verse: And the heavens declare His righteousness (rightness and justice), for God, He is judge. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

7.verse: Hear, O My people, and I will speak; O Israel, I will testify to you and against you: I am God, your God.

8.verse: I do not reprove you for your sacrifices; your burnt offerings are continually before Me.

9.verse: I will accept no bull from your house nor he-goat out of your folds.

10.verse: For every beast of the forest is Mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills or upon the mountains where thousands are.

11.verse: I know and am acquainted with all the birds of the mountains, and the wild animals of the field are Mine and are with Me, in My mind.

12.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell you, for the world and its fullness are Mine.

13.verse: Shall I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?

14.verse: Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and pay your vows to the Most High,

15.verse: And call on Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall honor and glorify Me.

16.verse: But to the wicked, God says: What right have you to recite My statutes or take My covenant or pledge on your lips,

17.verse: Seeing that you hate instruction and correction and cast My words behind you [discarding them]?

18.verse: When you see a thief, you associate with him, and you have taken part with adulterers.

19.verse: You give your mouth to evil, and your tongue frames deceit.

20.verse: You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother's son.

21.verse: These things you have done and I kept silent; you thought I was once entirely like you. But [now] I will reprove you and put [the charge] in order before your eyes.

22.verse: Now consider this, you who forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.

23.verse: He who brings an offering of praise and thanksgiving honors and glorifies Me; and he who orders his way aright [who prepares the way that I may show him], to him I will demonstrate the salvation of God.

1.verse: HAVE MERCY upon me, O God, according to Your steadfast love; according to the multitude of Your tender mercy and loving-kindness blot out my transgressions.

2.verse: Wash me thoroughly [and repeatedly] from my iniquity and guilt and cleanse me and make me wholly pure from my sin!

3.verse: For I am conscious of my transgressions and I acknowledge them; my sin is ever before me.

4.verse: Against You, You only, have I sinned and done that which is evil in Your sight, so that You are justified in Your sentence and faultless in Your judgment.

5.verse: Behold, I was brought forth in [a state of] iniquity; my mother was sinful who conceived me [and I too am sinful].

6.verse: Behold, You desire truth in the inner being; make me therefore to know wisdom in my inmost heart.

7.verse: Purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean [ceremonially]; wash me, and I shall [in reality] be whiter than snow.

8.verse: Make me to hear joy and gladness and be satisfied; let the bones which You have broken rejoice.

9.verse: Hide Your face from my sins and blot out all my guilt and iniquities.

10.verse: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right, persevering, and steadfast spirit within me.

11.verse: Cast me not away from Your presence and take not Your Holy Spirit from me.

12.verse: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation and uphold me with a willing spirit.

13.verse: Then will I teach transgressors Your ways, and sinners shall be converted and return to You.

14.verse: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness and death, O God, the God of my salvation, and my tongue shall sing aloud of Your righteousness (Your rightness and Your justice).

15.verse: O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth shall show forth Your praise.

16.verse: For You delight not in sacrifice, or else would I give it; You find no pleasure in burnt offering.

17.verse: My sacrifice [the sacrifice acceptable] to God is a broken spirit; a broken and a contrite heart [broken down with sorrow for sin and humbly and thoroughly penitent], such, O God, You will not despise.

18.verse: Do good in Your good pleasure to Zion; rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.

19.verse: Then will You delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, justice, and right, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering; then bullocks will be offered upon Your altar.

1.verse: WHY BOAST you of mischief done against the loving-kindness of God [and the godly], O mighty [sinful] man, day after day?

2.verse: Your tongue devises wickedness; it is like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

3.verse: You love evil more than good, and lying rather than to speak righteousness, justice, and right. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

4.verse: You love all destroying and devouring words, O deceitful tongue.

5.verse: God will likewise break you down and destroy you forever; He will lay hold of you and pluck you out of your tent and uproot you from the land of the living. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

6.verse: The [uncompromisingly] righteous also shall see [it] and be in reverent fear and awe, but about you they will [scoffingly] laugh, saying,

7.verse: See, this is the man who made not God his strength (his stronghold and high tower) but trusted in and confidently relied on the abundance of his riches, seeking refuge and security for himself through his wickedness.

8.verse: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; I trust in and confidently rely on the loving-kindness and the mercy of God forever and ever.

9.verse: I will thank You and confide in You forever, because You have done it [delivered me and kept me safe]. I will wait on, hope in and expect in Your name, for it is good, in the presence of Your saints (Your kind and pious ones).

1.verse: THE [empty-headed] fool has said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt and evil are they, and doing abominable iniquity; there is none who does good.

2.verse: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men to see if there were any who understood, who sought (inquired after and desperately required) God.

3.verse: Every one of them has gone back [backslidden and fallen away]; they have altogether become filthy and corrupt; there is none who does good, no, not one.

4.verse: Have those who work evil no knowledge (no understanding)? They eat up My people as they eat bread; they do not call upon God.

5.verse: There they are, in terror and dread, where there was [and had been] no terror and dread! For God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you; you have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.

6.verse: Oh, that the salvation and deliverance of Israel would come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of His people, then will Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad.

1.verse: SAVE ME, O God, by Your name; judge and vindicate me by Your mighty strength and power.

2.verse: Hear my pleading and my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.

3.verse: For strangers and insolent men are rising up against me, and violent men and ruthless ones seek and demand my life; they do not set God before them. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

4.verse: Behold, God is my helper and ally; the Lord is my upholder and is with them who uphold my life.

5.verse: He will pay back evil to my enemies; in Your faithfulness [Lord] put an end to them.

6.verse: With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to You; I will give thanks and praise Your name, O Lord, for it is good.

7.verse: For He has delivered me out of every trouble, and my eye has looked [in triumph] on my enemies.

1.verse: LISTEN TO my prayer, O God, and hide not Yourself from my supplication!

2.verse: Attend to me and answer me; I am restless and distraught in my complaint and must moan

3.verse: [And I am distracted] at the noise of the enemy, because of the oppression and threats of the wicked; for they would cast trouble upon me, and in wrath they persecute me.

4.verse: My heart is grievously pained within me, and the terrors of death have fallen upon me.

5.verse: Fear and trembling have come upon me; horror and fright have overwhelmed me.

6.verse: And I say, Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and be at rest.

7.verse: Yes, I would wander far away, I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

8.verse: I would hasten to escape and to find a shelter from the stormy wind and tempest.

9.verse: Destroy [their schemes], O Lord, confuse their tongues, for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

10.verse: Day and night they go about on its walls; iniquity and mischief are in its midst.

11.verse: Violence and ruin are within it; fraud and guile do not depart from its streets and marketplaces.

12.verse: For it is not an enemy who reproaches and taunts me--then I might bear it; nor is it one who has hated me who insolently vaunts himself against me--then I might hide from him.

13.verse: But it was you, a man my equal, my companion and my familiar friend.

14.verse: We had sweet fellowship together and used to walk to the house of God in company.

15.verse: Let desolations and death come suddenly upon them; let them go down alive to Sheol (the place of the dead), for evils are in their habitations, in their hearts, and their inmost part.

16.verse: As for me, I will call upon God, and the Lord will save me.

17.verse: Evening and morning and at noon will I utter my complaint and moan and sigh, and He will hear my voice.

18.verse: He has redeemed my life in peace from the battle that was against me [so that none came near me], for they were many who strove with me.

19.verse: God will hear and humble them, even He Who abides of old--Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!--because in them there has been no change [of heart], and they do not fear, revere, and worship God.

20.verse: [My companion] has put forth his hands against those who were at peace with him; he has broken and profaned his agreement [of friendship and loyalty].

21.verse: The words of his mouth were smoother than cream or butter, but war was in his heart; his words were softer than oil, yet they were drawn swords.

22.verse: Cast your burden on the Lord [releasing the weight of it] and He will sustain you; He will never allow the [consistently] righteous to be moved (made to slip, fall, or fail).

23.verse: But You, O God, will bring down the wicked into the pit of destruction; men of blood and treachery shall not live out half their days. But I will trust in, lean on, and confidently rely on You.

1.verse: BE MERCIFUL and gracious to me, O God, for man would trample me or devour me; all the day long the adversary oppresses me.

2.verse: They that lie in wait for me would swallow me up or trample me all day long, for they are many who fight against me, O Most High!

3.verse: What time I am afraid, I will have confidence in and put my trust and reliance in You.

4.verse: By [the help of] God I will praise His word; on God I lean, rely, and confidently put my trust; I will not fear. What can man, who is flesh, do to me?

5.verse: All day long they twist my words and trouble my affairs; all their thoughts are against me for evil and my hurt.

6.verse: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they watch my steps, even as they have [expectantly] waited for my life.

7.verse: They think to escape with iniquity, and shall they? In Your indignation bring down the peoples, O God.

8.verse: You number and record my wanderings; put my tears into Your bottle--are they not in Your book?

9.verse: Then shall my enemies turn back in the day that I cry out; this I know, for God is for me.

10.verse: In God, Whose word I praise, in the Lord, Whose word I praise,

11.verse: In God have I put my trust and confident reliance; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?

12.verse: Your vows are upon me, O God; I will render praise to You and give You thank offerings.

13.verse: For You have delivered my life from death, yes, and my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of life and of the living.

1.verse: BE MERCIFUL and gracious to me, O God, be merciful and gracious to me, for my soul takes refuge and finds shelter and confidence in You; yes, in the shadow of Your wings will I take refuge and be confident until calamities and destructive storms are passed.

2.verse: I will cry to God Most High, Who performs on my behalf and rewards me [Who brings to pass His purposes for me and surely completes them]!

3.verse: He will send from heaven and save me from the slanders and reproaches of him who would trample me down or swallow me up, and He will put him to shame. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]! God will send forth His mercy and loving-kindness and His truth and faithfulness.

4.verse: My life is among lions; I must lie among those who are aflame--the sons of men whose teeth are spears and arrows, their tongues sharp swords.

5.verse: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens! Let Your glory be over all the earth!

6.verse: They set a net for my steps; my very life was bowed down. They dug a pit in my way; into the midst of it they themselves have fallen. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

7.verse: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is steadfast and confident! I will sing and make melody.

8.verse: Awake, my glory (my inner self); awake, harp and lyre! I will awake right early [I will awaken the dawn]!

9.verse: I will praise and give thanks to You, O Lord, among the peoples; I will sing praises to You among the nations.

10.verse: For Your mercy and loving-kindness are great, reaching to the heavens, and Your truth and faithfulness to the clouds.

11.verse: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let Your glory be over all the earth.

1.verse: DO YOU indeed in silence speak righteousness, O you mighty ones? [Or is the righteousness, rightness, and justice you should speak quite dumb?] Do you judge fairly and uprightly, O you sons of men?

2.verse: No, in your heart you devise wickedness; you deal out in the land the violence of your hands.

3.verse: The ungodly are perverse and estranged from the womb; they go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies.

4.verse: Their poison is like the venom of a serpent; they are like the deaf adder or asp that stops its ear,

5.verse: Which listens not to the voice of charmers or of the enchanter never casting spells so cunningly.

6.verse: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths; break out the fangs of the young lions, O Lord.

7.verse: Let them melt away as water which runs on apace; when he aims his arrows, let them be as if they were headless or split apart.

8.verse: Let them be as a snail dissolving slime as it passes on or as a festering sore which wastes away, like [the child to which] a woman gives untimely birth that has not seen the sun.

9.verse: Before your pots can feel the thorns [that are placed under them for fuel], He will take them away as with a whirlwind, the green and the burning ones alike.

10.verse: The [unyieldingly] righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked.

11.verse: Men will say, Surely there is a reward for the [uncompromisingly] righteous; surely there is a God Who judges on the earth.

1.verse: DELIVER ME from my enemies, O my God; defend and protect me from those who rise up against me.

2.verse: Deliver me from and lift me above those who work evil and save me from bloodthirsty men.

3.verse: For, behold, they lie in wait for my life; fierce and mighty men are banding together against me, not for my transgression nor for any sin of mine, O Lord.

4.verse: They run and prepare themselves, though there is no fault in me; rouse Yourself [O Lord] to meet and help me, and see!

5.verse: You, O Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, arise to visit all the nations; spare none and be not merciful to any who treacherously plot evil. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

6.verse: They return at evening, they howl and snarl like dogs, and go [prowling] about the city.

7.verse: Behold, they belch out [insults] with their mouths; swords [of sarcasm, ridicule, slander, and lies] are in their lips, for who, they think, hears us?

8.verse: But You, O Lord, will laugh at them [in scorn]; You will hold all the nations in derision.

9.verse: O my Strength, I will watch and give heed to You and sing praises; for God is my Defense (my Protector and High Tower).

10.verse: My God in His mercy and steadfast love will meet me; God will let me look [triumphantly] on my enemies (those who lie in wait for me).

11.verse: Slay them not, lest my people forget; scatter them by Your power and make them wander to and fro, and bring them down, O Lord our Shield!

12.verse: For the sin of their mouths and the words of their lips, let them even be trapped and taken in their pride, and for the cursing and lying which they utter.

13.verse: Consume them in wrath, consume them so that they shall be no more; and let them know unto the ends of the earth that God rules over Jacob (Israel). Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

14.verse: And at evening let them return; let them howl and snarl like dogs, and go prowling about the city.

15.verse: Let them wander up and down for food and tarry all night if they are not satisfied (not getting their fill).

16.verse: But I will sing of Your mighty strength and power; yes, I will sing aloud of Your mercy and loving-kindness in the morning; for You have been to me a defense (a fortress and a high tower) and a refuge in the day of my distress.

17.verse: Unto You, O my Strength, I will sing praises; for God is my Defense, my Fortress, and High Tower, the God Who shows me mercy and steadfast love.

1.verse: O GOD, You have rejected us and cast us off, broken down [our defenses], and scattered us; You have been angry--O restore us and turn Yourself to us again!

2.verse: You have made the land to quake and tremble, You have rent it [open]; repair its breaches, for it shakes and totters.

3.verse: You have made Your people suffer hard things; You have given us to drink wine that makes us reel and be dazed.

4.verse: [But now] You have set up a banner for those who fear and worshipfully revere You [to which they may flee from the bow], a standard displayed because of the truth. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: That Your beloved ones may be delivered, save with Your right hand and answer us [or me].

6.verse: God has spoken in His holiness [in His promises]: I will rejoice, I will divide and portion out [the land] Shechem and the Valley of Succoth [west to east].

7.verse: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine; Ephraim also is My helmet (the defense of My head); Judah is My scepter and My lawgiver.

8.verse: Moab is My washpot [reduced to vilest servitude]; upon Edom I cast My shoe in triumph; over Philistia I raise the shout of victory.

9.verse: Who will bring me [David] into the strong city [of Petra]? Who will lead me into Edom?

10.verse: Have You not rejected us, O God? And will You not go forth, O God, with our armies?

11.verse: O give us help against the adversary, for vain (ineffectual and to no purpose) is the help or salvation of man.

12.verse: Through God we shall do valiantly, for He it is Who shall tread down our adversaries.

1.verse: HEAR MY cry, O God; listen to my prayer.

2.verse: From the end of the earth will I cry to You, when my heart is overwhelmed and fainting; lead me to the rock that is higher than I [yes, a rock that is too high for me].

3.verse: For You have been a shelter and a refuge for me, a strong tower against the adversary.

4.verse: I will dwell in Your tabernacle forever; let me find refuge and trust in the shelter of Your wings. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: For You, O God, have heard my vows; You have given me the heritage of those who fear, revere, and honor Your name.

6.verse: May You prolong the [true] King's life [adding days upon days], and may His years be to the last generation [of this world and the generations of the world to come].

7.verse: May He sit enthroned forever before [the face of] God; O ordain that loving-kindness and faithfulness may watch over Him!

8.verse: So will I sing praise to Your name forever, paying my vows day by day.

1.verse: FOR GOD alone my soul waits in silence; from Him comes my salvation.

2.verse: He only is my Rock and my Salvation, my Defense and my Fortress, I shall not be greatly moved.

3.verse: How long will you set upon a man that you may slay him, all of you, like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?

4.verse: They only consult to cast him down from his height [to dishonor him]; they delight in lies. They bless with their mouths, but they curse inwardly. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: My soul, wait only upon God and silently submit to Him; for my hope and expectation are from Him.

6.verse: He only is my Rock and my Salvation; He is my Defense and my Fortress, I shall not be moved.

7.verse: With God rests my salvation and my glory; He is my Rock of unyielding strength and impenetrable hardness, and my refuge is in God!

8.verse: Trust in, lean on, rely on, and have confidence in Him at all times, you people; pour out your hearts before Him. God is a refuge for us (a fortress and a high tower). Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

9.verse: Men of low degree [in the social scale] are emptiness (futility, a breath) and men of high degree [in the same scale] are a lie and a delusion. In the balances they go up; they are together lighter than a breath.

10.verse: Trust not in and rely confidently not on extortion and oppression, and do not vainly hope in robbery; if riches increase, set not your heart on them.

11.verse: God has spoken once, twice have I heard this: that power belongs to God.

12.verse: Also to You, O Lord, belong mercy and loving-kindness, for You render to every man according to his work.

1.verse: O GOD, You are my God, earnestly will I seek You; my inner self thirsts for You, my flesh longs and is faint for You, in a dry and weary land where no water is.

2.verse: So I have looked upon You in the sanctuary to see Your power and Your glory.

3.verse: Because Your loving-kindness is better than life, my lips shall praise You.

4.verse: So will I bless You while I live; I will lift up my hands in Your name.

5.verse: My whole being shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise You with joyful lips

6.verse: When I remember You upon my bed and meditate on You in the night watches.

7.verse: For You have been my help, and in the shadow of Your wings will I rejoice.

8.verse: My whole being follows hard after You and clings closely to You; Your right hand upholds me.

9.verse: But those who seek and demand my life to ruin and destroy it shall [themselves be destroyed and] go into the lower parts of the earth [into the underworld of the dead].

10.verse: They shall be given over to the power of the sword; they shall be a prey for foxes and jackals.

11.verse: But the king shall rejoice in God; everyone who swears by Him [that is, who binds himself by God's authority, acknowledging His supremacy, and devoting himself to His glory and service alone; every such one] shall glory, for the mouths of those who speak lies shall be stopped.

1.verse: HEAR MY voice, O God, in my complaint; guard and preserve my life from the terror of the enemy.

2.verse: Hide me from the secret counsel and conspiracy of the ungodly, from the scheming of evildoers,

3.verse: Who whet their tongues like a sword, who aim venomous words like arrows,

4.verse: Who shoot from ambush at the blameless man; suddenly do they shoot at him, without self-reproach or fear.

5.verse: They encourage themselves in an evil purpose, they talk of laying snares secretly; they say, Who will discover us ?

6.verse: They think out acts of injustice and say, We have accomplished a well-devised thing! For the inward thought of each one [is unsearchable] and his heart is deep.

7.verse: But God will shoot an unexpected arrow at them; and suddenly shall they be wounded.

8.verse: And they will be made to stumble, their own tongues turning against them; all who gaze upon them will shake their heads and flee away.

9.verse: And all men shall [reverently] fear and be in awe; and they will declare the work of God, for they will wisely consider and acknowledge that it is His doing.

10.verse: The [uncompromisingly] righteous shall be glad in the Lord and shall trust and take refuge in Him; and all the upright in heart shall glory and offer praise.

1.verse: TO YOU belongs silence (the submissive wonder of reverence which bursts forth into praise) and praise is due and fitting to You, O God, in Zion; and to You shall the vow be performed.

2.verse: O You Who hear prayer, to You shall all flesh come.

3.verse: Iniquities and much varied guilt prevail against me; [yet] as for our transgressions, You forgive and purge them away [make atonement for them and cover them out of Your sight]!

4.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the man whom You choose and cause to come near, that he may dwell in Your courts! We shall be satisfied with the goodness of Your house, Your holy temple.

5.verse: By fearful and glorious things [that terrify the wicked but make the godly sing praises] do You answer us in righteousness (rightness and justice), O God of our salvation, You Who are the confidence and hope of all the ends of the earth and of those far off on the seas;

6.verse: Who by [Your] might have founded the mountains, being girded with power,

7.verse: Who still the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples,

8.verse: So that those who dwell in earth's farthest parts are afraid of [nature's] signs of Your presence. You make the places where morning and evening have birth to shout for joy.

9.verse: You visit the earth and saturate it with water; You greatly enrich it; the river of God is full of water; You provide them with grain when You have so prepared the earth.

10.verse: You water the field's furrows abundantly, You settle the ridges of it; You make the soil soft with showers, blessing the sprouting of its vegetation.

11.verse: You crown the year with Your bounty and goodness, and the tracks of Your [chariot wheels] drip with fatness.

12.verse: The [luxuriant] pastures in the uncultivated country drip [with moisture], and the hills gird themselves with joy.

13.verse: The meadows are clothed with flocks, the valleys also are covered with grain; they shout for joy and sing together.

1.verse: MAKE A joyful noise unto God, all the earth;

2.verse: Sing forth the honor and glory of His name; make His praise glorious!

3.verse: Say to God, How awesome and fearfully glorious are Your works! Through the greatness of Your power shall Your enemies submit themselves to You [with feigned and reluctant obedience].

4.verse: All the earth shall bow down to You and sing [praises] to You; they shall praise Your name in song. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: Come and see the works of God; see how [to save His people He smites their foes; He is] terrible in His doings toward the children of men.

6.verse: He turned the sea into dry land, they crossed through the river on foot; there did we rejoice in Him.

7.verse: He rules by His might forever, His eyes observe and keep watch over the nations; let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

8.verse: Bless our God, O peoples, give Him grateful thanks and make the voice of His praise be heard,

9.verse: Who put and kept us among the living, and has not allowed our feet to slip.

10.verse: For You, O God, have proved us; You have tried us as silver is tried, refined, and purified.

11.verse: You brought us into the net (the prison fortress, the dungeon); You laid a heavy burden upon our loins.

12.verse: You caused men to ride over our heads [when we were prostrate]; we went through fire and through water, but You brought us out into a broad, moist place [to abundance and refreshment and the open air].

13.verse: I will come into Your house with burnt offerings [of entire consecration]; I will pay You my vows,

14.verse: Which my lips uttered and my mouth promised when I was in distress.

15.verse: I will offer to You burnt offerings of fat lambs, with rams consumed in sweet-smelling smoke; I will offer bullocks and he-goats. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

16.verse: Come and hear, all you who reverently and worshipfully fear God, and I will declare what He has done for me!

17.verse: I cried aloud to Him; He was extolled and high praise was under my tongue.

18.verse: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me;

19.verse: But certainly God has heard me; He has given heed to the voice of my prayer.

20.verse: Blessed be God, Who has not rejected my prayer nor removed His mercy and loving-kindness from being [as it always is] with me.

1.verse: GOD BE merciful and gracious to us and bless us and cause His face to shine upon us and among us--Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!--

2.verse: That Your way may be known upon earth, Your saving power (Your deliverances and Your salvation) among all nations.

3.verse: Let the peoples praise You [turn away from their idols] and give thanks to You, O God; let all the peoples praise and give thanks to You.

4.verse: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy, for You will judge the peoples fairly and guide, lead, or drive the nations upon earth. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: Let the peoples praise You [turn away from their idols] and give thanks to You, O God; let all the peoples praise and give thanks to You!

6.verse: The earth has yielded its harvest [in evidence of God's approval]; God, even our own God, will bless us.

7.verse: God will bless us, and all the ends of the earth shall reverently fear Him.

1.verse: GOD IS [already] beginning to arise, and His enemies to scatter; let them also who hate Him flee before Him!

2.verse: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away; as wax melts before the fire, so let the wicked perish before the presence of God.

3.verse: But let the [uncompromisingly] righteous be glad; let them be in high spirits and glory before God, yes, let them [jubilantly] rejoice!

4.verse: Sing to God, sing praises to His name, cast up a highway for Him Who rides through the deserts--His name is the Lord--be in high spirits and glory before Him!

5.verse: A father of the fatherless and a judge and protector of the widows is God in His holy habitation.

6.verse: God places the solitary in families and gives the desolate a home in which to dwell; He leads the prisoners out to prosperity; but the rebellious dwell in a parched land.

7.verse: O God, when You went forth before Your people, when You marched through the wilderness--Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!--

8.verse: The earth trembled, the heavens also poured down [rain] at the presence of God; yonder Sinai quaked at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

9.verse: You, O God, did send a plentiful rain; You did restore and confirm Your heritage when it languished and was weary.

10.verse: Your flock found a dwelling place in it; You, O God, in Your goodness did provide for the poor and needy.

11.verse: The Lord gives the word [of power]; the women who bear and publish [the news] are a great host.

12.verse: The kings of the enemies' armies, they flee, they flee! She who tarries at home divides the spoil [left behind].

13.verse: Though you [the slackers] may lie among the sheepfolds [in slothful ease, yet for Israel] the wings of a dove are covered with silver, its pinions excessively green with gold [are trophies taken from the enemy].

14.verse: When the Almighty scattered kings in [the land], it was as when it snows on Zalmon [a wooded hill near Shechem].

15.verse: Is Mount Bashan the high mountain of summits, Mount Bashan [east of the Jordan] the mount of God?

16.verse: Why do you look with grudging and envy, you many-peaked mountains, at the mountain [of the city called Zion] which God has desired for His dwelling place? Yes, the Lord will dwell in it forever.

17.verse: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands upon thousands. The Lord is among them as He was in Sinai, [so also] in the Holy Place (the sanctuary in Jerusalem).

18.verse: You have ascended on high. You have led away captive a train of vanquished foes; You have received gifts of men, yes, of the rebellious also, that the Lord God might dwell there with them.

19.verse: Blessed be the Lord, Who bears our burdens and carries us day by day, even the God Who is our salvation! Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

20.verse: God is to us a God of deliverances and salvation; and to God the Lord belongs escape from death [setting us free].

21.verse: But God will shatter the heads of His enemies, the hairy scalp of such a one as goes on still in his trespasses and guilty ways.

22.verse: The Lord said, I will bring back [your enemies] from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the [Red] Sea,

23.verse: That you may crush them, dipping your foot in blood, that the tongues of your dogs may have their share from the foe.

24.verse: They see Your goings, O God, even the [solemn processions] of my God, my King, into the sanctuary [in holiness].

25.verse: The singers go in front, the players on instruments last; between them the maidens are playing on tambourines.

26.verse: Bless, give thanks, and gratefully praise God in full congregations, even the Lord, O you who are from [Jacob] the fountain of Israel.

27.verse: There is little Benjamin in the lead [in the procession], the princes of Judah and their company, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.

28.verse: Your God has commanded your strength [your might in His service and impenetrable hardness to temptation]; O God, display Your might and strengthen what You have wrought for us!

29.verse: [Out of respect] for Your temple at Jerusalem kings shall bring gifts to You.

30.verse: Rebuke the wild beasts dwelling among the reeds [in Egypt], the herd of bulls (the leaders) with the calves of the peoples; trample underfoot those who lust for tribute money; scatter the peoples who delight in war.

31.verse: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall hasten to stretch out her hands [with the offerings of submission] to God.

32.verse: Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth, sing praises to the Lord! Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

33.verse: [Sing praises] to Him Who rides upon the heavens, the ancient heavens; behold, He sends forth His voice, His mighty voice.

34.verse: Ascribe power and strength to God; His majesty is over Israel, and His strength and might are in the skies.

35.verse: O God, awe-inspiring, profoundly impressive, and terrible are You out of Your holy places; the God of Israel Himself gives strength and fullness of might to His people. Blessed be God!

1.verse: SAVE ME, O God, for the waters have come up to my neck [they threaten my life].

2.verse: I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold; I have come into deep waters, where the floods overwhelm me.

3.verse: I am weary with my crying; my throat is parched; my eyes fail with waiting [hopefully] for my God.

4.verse: Those who hate me without cause are more than the hairs of my head; those who would cut me off and destroy me, being my enemies wrongfully, are many and mighty. I am [forced] to restore what I did not steal.

5.verse: O God, You know my folly and blundering; my sins and my guilt are not hidden from You.

6.verse: Let not those who wait and hope and look for You, O Lord of hosts, be put to shame through me; let not those who seek and inquire for and require You [as their vital necessity] be brought to confusion and dishonor through me, O God of Israel.

7.verse: Because for Your sake I have borne taunt and reproach; confusion and shame have covered my face.

8.verse: I have become a stranger to my brethren, and an alien to my mother's children.

9.verse: For zeal for Your house has eaten me up, and the reproaches and insults of those who reproach and insult You have fallen upon me.

10.verse: When I wept and humbled myself with fasting, I was jeered at and humiliated;

11.verse: When I made sackcloth my clothing, I became a byword (an object of scorn) to them.

12.verse: They who sit in [the city's] gate talk about me, and I am the song of the drunkards.

13.verse: But as for me, my prayer is to You, O Lord. At an acceptable and opportune time, O God, in the multitude of Your mercy and the abundance of Your loving-kindness hear me, and in the truth and faithfulness of Your salvation answer me.

14.verse: Rescue me out of the mire, and let me not sink; let me be delivered from those who hate me and from out of the deep waters.

15.verse: Let not the floodwaters overflow and overwhelm me, neither let the deep swallow me up nor the [dug] pit [with water perhaps in the bottom] close its mouth over me.

16.verse: Hear and answer me, O Lord, for Your loving-kindness is sweet and comforting; according to Your plenteous tender mercy and steadfast love turn to me.

17.verse: Hide not Your face from Your servant, for I am in distress; O answer me speedily!

18.verse: Draw close to me and redeem me; ransom and set me free because of my enemies [lest they glory in my prolonged distress]!

19.verse: You know my reproach and my shame and my dishonor; my adversaries are all before You [fully known to You].

20.verse: Insults and reproach have broken my heart; I am full of heaviness and I am distressingly sick. I looked for pity, but there was none, and for comforters, but I found none.

21.verse: They gave me also gall [poisonous and bitter] for my food, and in my thirst they gave me vinegar (a soured wine) to drink.

22.verse: Let their own table [with all its abundance and luxury] become a snare to them; and when they are secure in peace [or at their sacrificial feasts, let it become] a trap to them.

23.verse: Let their eyes be darkened so that they cannot see, and make their loins tremble continually [from terror, dismay, and feebleness].

24.verse: Pour out Your indignation upon them, and let the fierceness of Your burning anger catch up with them.

25.verse: Let their habitation and their encampment be a desolation; let no one dwell in their tents.

26.verse: For they pursue and persecute him whom You have smitten, and they gossip about those whom You have wounded, [adding] to their grief and pain.

27.verse: Let one [unforgiven] perverseness and iniquity accumulate upon another for them [in Your book], and let them not come into Your righteousness or be justified and acquitted by You.

28.verse: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living and the book of life and not be enrolled among the [uncompromisingly] righteous (those upright and in right standing with God).

29.verse: But I am poor, sorrowful, and in pain; let Your salvation, O God, set me up on high.

30.verse: I will praise the name of God with a song and will magnify Him with thanksgiving,

31.verse: And it will please the Lord better than an ox or a bullock that has horns and hoofs.

32.verse: The humble shall see it and be glad; you who seek God, inquiring for and requiring Him [as your first need], let your hearts revive and live!

33.verse: For the Lord hears the poor and needy and despises not His prisoners (His miserable and wounded ones).

34.verse: Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and everything that moves in them.

35.verse: For God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah; and [His servants] shall remain and dwell there and have it in their possession;

36.verse: The children of His servants shall inherit it, and those who love His name shall dwell in it.

1.verse: MAKE HASTE, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O Lord!

2.verse: Let them be put to shame and confounded that seek and demand my life; let them be turned backward and brought to confusion and dishonor who desire and delight in my hurt.

3.verse: Let them be turned back and appalled because of their shame and disgrace who say, Aha, aha!

4.verse: May all those who seek, inquire of and for You, and require You [as their vital need] rejoice and be glad in You; and may those who love Your salvation say continually, Let God be magnified!

5.verse: But I am poor and needy; hasten to me, O God! You are my Help and my Deliverer; O Lord, do not tarry!

1.verse: IN YOU, O Lord, do I put my trust and confidently take refuge; let me never be put to shame or confusion!

2.verse: Deliver me in Your righteousness and cause me to escape; bow down Your ear to me and save me!

3.verse: Be to me a rock of refuge in which to dwell, and a sheltering stronghold to which I may continually resort, which You have appointed to save me, for You are my Rock and my Fortress.

4.verse: Rescue me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the grasp of the unrighteous and ruthless man.

5.verse: For You are my hope; O Lord God, You are my trust from my youth and the source of my confidence.

6.verse: Upon You have I leaned and relied from birth; You are He Who took me from my mother's womb and You have been my benefactor from that day. My praise is continually of You.

7.verse: I am as a wonder and surprise to many, but You are my strong refuge.

8.verse: My mouth shall be filled with Your praise and with Your honor all the day.

9.verse: Cast me not off nor send me away in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength is spent and my powers fail.

10.verse: For my enemies talk against me; those who watch for my life consult together,

11.verse: Saying, God has forsaken him; pursue and persecute and take him, for there is none to deliver him.

12.verse: O God, be not far from me! O my God, make haste to help me!

13.verse: Let them be put to shame and consumed who are adversaries to my life; let them be covered with reproach, scorn, and dishonor who seek and require my hurt.

14.verse: But I will hope continually, and will praise You yet more and more.

15.verse: My mouth shall tell of Your righteous acts and of Your deeds of salvation all the day, for their number is more than I know.

16.verse: I will come in the strength and with the mighty acts of the Lord God; I will mention and praise Your righteousness, even Yours alone.

17.verse: O God, You have taught me from my youth, and hitherto have I declared Your wondrous works.

18.verse: Yes, even when I am old and gray-headed, O God, forsake me not, [but keep me alive] until I have declared Your mighty strength to [this] generation, and Your might and power to all that are to come.

19.verse: Your righteousness also, O God, is very high [reaching to the heavens], You Who have done great things; O God, who is like You, or who is Your equal?

20.verse: You Who have shown us [all] troubles great and sore will quicken us again and will bring us up again from the depths of the earth.

21.verse: Increase my greatness (my honor) and turn and comfort me.

22.verse: I will also praise You with the harp, even Your truth and faithfulness, O my God; unto You will I sing praises with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.

23.verse: My lips shall shout for joy when I sing praises to You, and my inner being, which You have redeemed.

24.verse: My tongue also shall talk of Your righteousness all the day long; for they are put to shame, for they are confounded, who seek and demand my hurt.

1.verse: GIVE THE king [knowledge of] Your [way of] judging, O God, and [the spirit of] Your righteousness to the king's son [to control all his actions].

2.verse: Let him judge and govern Your people with righteousness, and Your poor and afflicted ones with judgment and justice.

3.verse: The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the hills, through [the general establishment of] righteousness.

4.verse: May he judge and defend the poor of the people, deliver the children of the needy, and crush the oppressor,

5.verse: So that they may revere and fear You while the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.

6.verse: May he [Solomon as a type of King David's greater Son] be like rain that comes down upon the mown grass, like showers that water the earth.

7.verse: In His [Christ's] days shall the [uncompromisingly] righteous flourish and peace abound till there is a moon no longer.

8.verse: He [Christ] shall have dominion also from sea to sea and from the River [Euphrates] to the ends of the earth.

9.verse: Those who dwell in the wilderness shall bow before Him and His enemies shall lick the dust.

10.verse: The kings of Tarshish and of the coasts shall bring offerings; the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.

11.verse: Yes, all kings shall fall down before Him, all nations shall serve Him.

12.verse: For He delivers the needy when he calls out, the poor also and him who has no helper.

13.verse: He will have pity on the poor and weak and needy and will save the lives of the needy.

14.verse: He will redeem their lives from oppression and fraud and violence, and precious and costly shall their blood be in His sight.

15.verse: And He shall live; and to Him shall be given gold of Sheba; prayer also shall be made for Him and through Him continually, and they shall bless and praise Him all the day long.

16.verse: There shall be abundance of grain in the soil upon the top of the mountains [the least fruitful places in the land]; the fruit of it shall wave like [the forests of] Lebanon, and [the inhabitants of] the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.

17.verse: His name shall endure forever; His name shall continue as long as the sun [indeed, His name continues before the sun]. And men shall be blessed and bless themselves by Him; all nations shall call Him blessed!

18.verse: Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel, Who alone does wondrous things!

19.verse: Blessed be His glorious name forever; let the whole earth be filled with His glory! Amen and Amen!

20.verse: The prayers of David son of Jesse are ended.

1.verse: TRULY GOD is [only] good to Israel, even to those who are upright and pure in heart.

2.verse: But as for me, my feet were almost gone, my steps had well-nigh slipped.

3.verse: For I was envious of the foolish and arrogant when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

4.verse: For they suffer no violent pangs in their death, but their strength is firm.

5.verse: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they smitten and plagued like other men.

6.verse: Therefore pride is about their necks like a chain; violence covers them like a garment [like a long, luxurious robe].

7.verse: Their eyes stand out with fatness, they have more than heart could wish; and the imaginations of their minds overflow [with follies].

8.verse: They scoff, and wickedly utter oppression; they speak loftily [from on high, maliciously and blasphemously].

9.verse: They set their mouths against and speak down from heaven, and their tongues swagger through the earth [invading even heaven with blasphemy and smearing earth with slanders].

10.verse: Therefore His people return here, and waters of a full cup [offered by the wicked] are [blindly] drained by them.

11.verse: And they say, How does God know? Is there knowledge in the Most High?

12.verse: Behold, these are the ungodly, who always prosper and are at ease in the world; they increase in riches.

13.verse: Surely then in vain have I cleansed my heart and washed my hands in innocency.

14.verse: For all the day long have I been smitten and plagued, and chastened every morning.

15.verse: Had I spoken thus [and given expression to my feelings], I would have been untrue and have dealt treacherously against the generation of Your children.

16.verse: But when I considered how to understand this, it was too great an effort for me and too painful

17.verse: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then I understood [for I considered] their end.

18.verse: [After all] You do set the [wicked] in slippery places; You cast them down to ruin and destruction.

19.verse: How they become a desolation in a moment! They are utterly consumed with terrors!

20.verse: As a dream [which seems real] until one awakens, so, O Lord, when You arouse Yourself [to take note of the wicked], You will despise their outward show.

21.verse: For my heart was grieved, embittered, and in a state of ferment, and I was pricked in my heart [as with the sharp fang of an adder].

22.verse: So foolish, stupid, and brutish was I, and ignorant; I was like a beast before You.

23.verse: Nevertheless I am continually with You; You do hold my right hand.

24.verse: You will guide me with Your counsel, and afterward receive me to honor and glory.

25.verse: Whom have I in heaven but You? And I have no delight or desire on earth besides You.

26.verse: My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the Rock and firm Strength of my heart and my Portion forever.

27.verse: For behold, those who are far from You shall perish; You will destroy all who are false to You and like [spiritual] harlots depart from You.

28.verse: But it is good for me to draw near to God; I have put my trust in the Lord God and made Him my refuge, that I may tell of all Your works.

1.verse: O GOD, why do You cast us off forever? Why does Your anger burn and smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?

2.verse: [Earnestly] remember Your congregation which You have acquired of old, which You have redeemed to be the tribe of Your heritage; remember Mount Zion, where You have dwelt.

3.verse: Direct Your feet [quickly] to the perpetual ruins and desolations; the foe has devastated and desecrated everything in the sanctuary.

4.verse: In the midst of Your Holy Place Your enemies have roared [with their battle cry]; they set up their own [idol] emblems for signs [of victory].

5.verse: They seemed like men who lifted up axes upon a thicket of trees to make themselves a record.

6.verse: And then all the carved wood of the Holy Place they broke down with hatchets and hammers.

7.verse: They have set Your sanctuary on fire; they have profaned the dwelling place of Your Name by casting it to the ground.

8.verse: They said in their hearts, Let us make havoc [of such places] altogether. They have burned up all God's meetinghouses in the land.

9.verse: We do not see our symbols; there is no longer any prophet, neither does any among us know for how long.

10.verse: O God, how long is the adversary to scoff and reproach? Is the enemy to blaspheme and revile Your name forever?

11.verse: Why do You hold back Your hand, even Your right hand? Draw it out of Your bosom and consume them [make an end of them]!

12.verse: Yet God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

13.verse: You did divide the [Red] Sea by Your might; You broke the heads of the [Egyptian] dragons in the waters.

14.verse: You crushed the heads of Leviathan (Egypt); You did give him as food for the creatures inhabiting the wilderness.

15.verse: You did cleave open [the rock bringing forth] fountains and streams; You dried up mighty, ever-flowing rivers (the Jordan).

16.verse: The day is Yours, the night also is Yours; You have established the [starry] light and the sun.

17.verse: You have fixed all the borders of the earth [the divisions of land and sea and of the nations]; You have made summer and winter. [Acts17:26.]

18.verse: [Earnestly] remember how the enemy has scoffed, O Lord, and reproached You, and how a foolish and impious people has blasphemed Your name.

19.verse: Oh, do not deliver the life of your turtledove to the wild beast (to the greedy multitude); forget not the life [of the multitude] of Your poor forever.

20.verse: Have regard for the covenant [You made with Abraham], for the dark places of the land are full of the habitations of violence.

21.verse: Oh, let not the downtrodden return in shame; let the oppressed and needy praise Your name.

22.verse: Arise, O God, plead Your own cause; remember [earnestly] how the foolish and impious man scoffs and reproaches You day after day and all day long.

23.verse: Do not forget the [clamoring] voices of Your adversaries, the tumult of those who rise up against You, which ascends continually.

1.verse: WE GIVE praise and thanks to You, O God, we praise and give thanks; Your wondrous works declare that Your Name is near and they who invoke Your Name rehearse Your wonders.

2.verse: When the proper time has come [for executing My judgments], I will judge uprightly [says the Lord].

3.verse: When the earth totters, and all the inhabitants of it, it is I Who will poise and keep steady its pillars. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

4.verse: I said to the arrogant and boastful, Deal not arrogantly [do not boast]; and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn [of personal aggrandizement].

5.verse: Lift not up your [aggressive] horn on high, speak not with a stiff neck and insolent arrogance.

6.verse: For not from the east nor from the west nor from the south come promotion and lifting up.

7.verse: But God is the Judge! He puts down one and lifts up another.

8.verse: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup [of His wrath], and the wine foams and is red, well mixed; and He pours out from it, and all the wicked of the earth must drain it and drink its dregs.

9.verse: But I will declare and rejoice forever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

10.verse: All the horns of the ungodly also will I cut off [says the Lord], but the horns of the [uncompromisingly] righteous shall be exalted.

1.verse: IN JUDAH God is known and renowned; His name is highly praised and is great in Israel.

2.verse: In [Jeru]Salem also is His tabernacle, and His dwelling place is in Zion.

3.verse: There He broke the bow's flashing arrows, the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

4.verse: Glorious and excellent are You from the mountains of prey [splendid and majestic, more than the everlasting mountains].

5.verse: The stouthearted are stripped of their spoil, they have slept the sleep [of death]; and none of the men of might could raise their hands.

6.verse: At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both chariot [rider] and horse are cast into a dead sleep [of death].

7.verse: You, even You, are to be feared [with awe and reverence]! Who may stand in Your presence when once Your anger is roused?

8.verse: You caused sentence to be heard from heaven; the earth feared and was still--

9.verse: When God arose to [establish] judgment, to save all the meek and oppressed of the earth. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

10.verse: Surely the wrath of man shall praise You; the remainder of wrath shall You restrain and gird and arm Yourself with it.

11.verse: Vow and pay to the Lord your God; let all who are round about Him bring presents to Him Who ought to be [reverently] feared.

12.verse: He will cut off the spirit [of pride and fury] of princes; He is terrible to the [ungodly] kings of the earth.

1.verse: I WILL cry to God with my voice, even to God with my voice, and He will give ear and hearken to me.

2.verse: In the day of my trouble I seek (inquire of and desperately require) the Lord; in the night my hand is stretched out [in prayer] without slacking up; I refuse to be comforted.

3.verse: I [earnestly] remember God; I am disquieted and I groan; I muse in prayer, and my spirit faints [overwhelmed]. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

4.verse: You hold my eyes from closing; I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

5.verse: I consider the days of old, the years of bygone times [of prosperity].

6.verse: I call to remembrance my song in the night; with my heart I meditate and my spirit searches diligently:

7.verse: Will the Lord cast off forever? And will He be favorable no more?

8.verse: Have His mercy and loving-kindness ceased forever? Have His promises ended for all time?

9.verse: Has God [deliberately] abandoned or forgotten His graciousness? Has He in anger shut up His compassion? Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

10.verse: And I say, This [apparent desertion of Israel by God] is my appointed lot and trial, but I will recall the years of the right hand of the Most High [in loving-kindness extended toward us], for this is my grief, that the right hand of the Most High changes.

11.verse: I will [earnestly] recall the deeds of the Lord; yes, I will [earnestly] remember the wonders [You performed for our fathers] of old.

12.verse: I will meditate also upon all Your works and consider all Your [mighty] deeds.

13.verse: Your way, O God, is in the sanctuary [in holiness, away from sin and guilt]. Who is a great God like our God?

14.verse: You are the God Who does wonders; You have demonstrated Your power among the peoples.

15.verse: You have with Your [mighty] arm redeemed Your people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

16.verse: When the waters [at the Red Sea and the Jordan] saw You, O God, they were afraid; the deep shuddered also, for [all] the waters saw You.

17.verse: The clouds poured down water, the skies sent out a sound [of rumbling thunder]; Your arrows went forth [in forked lightning].

18.verse: The voice of Your thunder was in the whirlwind, the lightnings illumined the world; the earth trembled and shook.

19.verse: Your way [in delivering Your people] was through the sea, and Your paths through the great waters, yet Your footsteps were not traceable, but were obliterated.

20.verse: You led Your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

1.verse: GIVE EAR, O my people, to my teaching; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

2.verse: I will open my mouth in a parable (in instruction by numerous examples); I will utter dark sayings of old [that hide important truth]--

3.verse: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

4.verse: We will not hide them from their children, but we will tell to the generation to come the praiseworthy deeds of the Lord, and His might, and the wonderful works that He has performed.

5.verse: For He established a testimony (an express precept) in Jacob and appointed a law in Israel, commanding our fathers that they should make [the great facts of God's dealings with Israel] known to their children,

6.verse: That the generation to come might know them, that the children still to be born might arise and recount them to their children,

7.verse: That they might set their hope in God and not forget the works of God, but might keep His commandments

8.verse: And might not be as their fathers--a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that set not their hearts aright nor prepared their hearts to know God, and whose spirits were not steadfast and faithful to God.

9.verse: The children of Ephraim were armed and carrying bows, yet they turned back in the day of battle.

10.verse: They kept not the covenant of God and refused to walk according to His law

11.verse: And forgot His works and His wonders that He had shown them.

12.verse: Marvelous things did He in the sight of their fathers in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan [where Pharaoh resided].

13.verse: He divided the [Red] Sea and caused them to pass through it, and He made the waters stand like a heap.

14.verse: In the daytime also He led them with a [pillar of] cloud and all the night with a light of fire.

15.verse: He split rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink abundantly as out of the deep.

16.verse: He brought streams also out of the rock [at Rephidim and Kadesh] and caused waters to run down like rivers.

17.verse: Yet they still went on to sin against Him by provoking and rebelling against the Most High in the wilderness (in the land of drought).

18.verse: And they tempted God in their hearts by asking for food according to their [selfish] desire and appetite.

19.verse: Yes, they spoke against God; they said, Can God furnish [the food for] a table in the wilderness?

20.verse: Behold, He did smite the rock so that waters gushed out and the streams overflowed; but can He give bread also? Can He provide flesh for His people?

21.verse: Therefore, when the Lord heard, He was [full of] wrath; a fire was kindled against Jacob, His anger mounted up against Israel,

22.verse: Because in God they believed not [they relied not on Him, they adhered not to Him], and they trusted not in His salvation (His power to save).

23.verse: Yet He commanded the clouds above and opened the doors of heaven;

24.verse: And He rained down upon them manna to eat and gave them heaven's grain.

25.verse: Everyone ate the bread of the mighty [man ate angels' food]; God sent them meat in abundance.

26.verse: He let forth the east wind to blow in the heavens, and by His power He guided the south wind.

27.verse: He rained flesh also upon them like the dust, and winged birds [quails] like the sand of the seas.

28.verse: And He let [the birds] fall in the midst of their camp, round about their tents.

29.verse: So they ate and were well filled; He gave them what they craved and lusted after.

30.verse: But scarce had they stilled their craving, and while their meat was yet in their mouths,

31.verse: The wrath of God came upon them and slew the strongest and sturdiest of them and smote down Israel's chosen youth.

32.verse: In spite of all this, they sinned still more, for they believed not in (relied not on and adhered not to Him for) His wondrous works.

33.verse: Therefore their days He consumed like a breath [in emptiness, falsity, and futility] and their years in terror and sudden haste.

34.verse: When He slew [some of] them, [the remainder] inquired after Him diligently, and they repented and sincerely sought God [for a time].

35.verse: And they [earnestly] remembered that God was their Rock, and the Most High God their Redeemer.

36.verse: Nevertheless they flattered Him with their mouths and lied to Him with their tongues.

37.verse: For their hearts were not right or sincere with Him, neither were they faithful and steadfast to His covenant.

38.verse: But He, full of [merciful] compassion, forgave their iniquity and destroyed them not; yes, many a time He turned His anger away and did not stir up all His wrath and indignation.

39.verse: For He [earnestly] remembered that they were but flesh, a wind that goes and does not return.

40.verse: How often they defied and rebelled against Him in the wilderness and grieved Him in the desert!

41.verse: And time and again they turned back and tempted God, provoking and incensing the Holy One of Israel.

42.verse: They remembered not [seriously the miracles of the working of] His hand, nor the day when He delivered them from the enemy,

43.verse: How He wrought His miracles in Egypt and His wonders in the field of Zoan [where Pharaoh resided]

44.verse: And turned their rivers into blood, and their streams, so that they could not drink from them.

45.verse: He sent swarms of [venomous] flies among them which devoured them, and frogs which destroyed them.

46.verse: He gave also their crops to the caterpillar and [the fruit of] their labor to the locust.

47.verse: He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore trees with frost and [great chunks of] ice.

48.verse: He [caused them to shut up their cattle or] gave them up also to the hail and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

49.verse: He let loose upon them the fierceness of His anger, His wrath and indignation and distress, by sending [a mission of] angels of calamity and woe among them.

50.verse: He leveled and made a straight path for His anger [to give it free course]; He did not spare [the Egyptian families] from death but gave their beasts over to the pestilence and the life [of their eldest] over to the plague.

51.verse: He smote all the firstborn in Egypt, the chief of their strength in the tents [of the land of the sons] of Ham.

52.verse: But [God] led His own people forth like sheep and guided them [with a shepherd's care] like a flock in the wilderness.

53.verse: And He led them on safely and in confident trust, so that they feared not; but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

54.verse: And He brought them to His holy border, the border of [Canaan] His sanctuary, even to this mountain [Zion] which His right hand had acquired.

55.verse: He drove out the nations also before [Israel] and allotted their land as a heritage, measured out and partitioned; and He made the tribes of Israel to dwell in the tents of those dispossessed.

56.verse: Yet they tempted and provoked and rebelled against the Most High God and kept not His testimonies.

57.verse: But they turned back and dealt unfaithfully and treacherously like their fathers; they were twisted like a warped and deceitful bow [that will not respond to the archer's aim].

58.verse: For they provoked Him to [righteous] anger with their high places [for idol worship] and moved Him to jealousy with their graven images.

59.verse: When God heard this, He was full of [holy] wrath; and He utterly rejected Israel, greatly abhorring and loathing [her ways],

60.verse: So that He forsook the tabernacle at Shiloh, the tent in which He had dwelt among men [and never returned to it again],

61.verse: And delivered His strength and power (the ark of the covenant) into captivity, and His glory into the hands of the foe (the Philistines).

62.verse: He gave His people over also to the sword and was wroth with His heritage [Israel].

63.verse: The fire [of war] devoured their young men, and their bereaved virgins were not praised in a wedding song.
