64.verse: Their priests [Hophni and Phinehas] fell by the sword, and their widows made no lamentation [for the bodies came not back from the scene of battle, and the widow of Phinehas also died that day].

65.verse: Then the Lord awakened as from sleep, as a strong man whose consciousness of power is heightened by wine.

66.verse: And He smote His adversaries in the back [as they fled]; He put them to lasting shame and reproach.

67.verse: Moreover, He rejected the tent of Joseph and chose not the tribe of Ephraim [in which the tabernacle had been accustomed to stand].

68.verse: But He chose the tribe of Judah [as Israel's leader], Mount Zion, which He loved [to replace Shiloh as His capital].

69.verse: And He built His sanctuary [exalted] like the heights [of the heavens] and like the earth which He established forever.

70.verse: He chose David His servant and took him from the sheepfolds;

71.verse: From tending the ewes that had their young He brought him to be the shepherd of Jacob His people, of Israel His inheritance.

72.verse: So [David] was their shepherd with an upright heart; he guided them by the discernment and skillfulness [which controlled] his hands.

1.verse: O GOD, the nations have come into [the land of Your people] Your inheritance; Your sacred temple have they defiled; they have made Jerusalem heaps of ruins.

2.verse: The dead bodies of Your servants they have given as food to the birds of the heavens, the flesh of Your saints to the beasts of the earth.

3.verse: Their blood they have poured out like water round about Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.

4.verse: [Because of such humiliation] we have become a taunt and reproach to our neighbors, a mocking and derision to those who are round about us.

5.verse: How long, O Lord? Will You be angry forever? Shall Your jealousy [which cannot endure a divided allegiance] burn like fire?

6.verse: Pour out Your wrath on the Gentile nations who do not acknowledge You, and upon the kingdoms that do not call on Your name.

7.verse: For they have devoured Jacob and laid waste his dwelling and his pasture.

8.verse: O do not [earnestly] remember against us the iniquities and guilt of our forefathers! Let Your compassion and tender mercy speedily come to meet us, for we are brought very low.

9.verse: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of Your name! Deliver us, forgive us, and purge away our sins for Your name's sake.

10.verse: Why should the Gentile nations say, Where is their God? Let vengeance for the blood of Your servants which is poured out be known among the nations in our sight [not delaying until some future generation].

11.verse: Let the groaning and sighing of the prisoner come before You; according to the greatness of Your power and Your arm spare those who are appointed to die!

12.verse: And return into the bosom of our neighbors sevenfold the taunts with which they have taunted and scoffed at You, O Lord!

13.verse: Then we Your people, the sheep of Your pasture, will give You thanks forever; we will show forth and publish Your praise from generation to generation.

1.verse: GIVE EAR, O Shepherd of Israel, You Who lead Joseph like a flock; You Who sit enthroned upon the cherubim [of the ark of the covenant], shine forth

2.verse: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh! Stir up Your might, and come to save us!

3.verse: Restore us again, O God; and cause Your face to shine [in pleasure and approval on us], and we shall be saved!

4.verse: O Lord God of hosts, how long will You be angry with Your people's prayers?

5.verse: You have fed them with the bread of tears, and You have given them tears to drink in large measure.

6.verse: You make us a strife and scorn to our neighbors, and our enemies laugh among themselves.

7.verse: Restore us again, O God of hosts; and cause Your face to shine [upon us with favor as of old], and we shall be saved!

8.verse: You brought a vine [Israel] out of Egypt; You drove out the [heathen] nations and planted it [in Canaan].

9.verse: You prepared room before it, and it took deep root and it filled the land.

10.verse: The mountains were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs of it were like the great cedars [cedars of God].

11.verse: [Israel] sent out its boughs to the [Mediterranean] Sea and its branches to the [Euphrates] River.

12.verse: Why have You broken down its hedges and walls so that all who pass by pluck from its fruit?

13.verse: The boar out of the wood wastes it and the wild beast of the field feeds on it.

14.verse: Turn again, we beseech You, O God of hosts! Look down from heaven and see, visit, and have regard for this vine!

15.verse: [Protect and maintain] the stock which Your right hand planted, and the branch (the son) that You have reared and made strong for Yourself.

16.verse: They have burned it with fire, it is cut down; may they perish at the rebuke of Your countenance.

17.verse: Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand, upon the son of man whom You have made strong for Yourself.

18.verse: Then will we not depart from You; revive us (give us life) and we will call upon Your name.

19.verse: Restore us, O Lord God of hosts; cause Your face to shine [in pleasure, approval, and favor on us], and we shall be saved!

1.verse: SING ALOUD to God our Strength! Shout for joy to the God of Jacob!

2.verse: Raise a song, sound the timbrel, the sweet lyre with the harp.

3.verse: Blow the trumpet at the New Moon, at the full moon, on our feast day.

4.verse: For this is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.

5.verse: This He ordained in Joseph [the savior] for a testimony when He went out over the land of Egypt. The speech of One Whom I knew not did I hear [saying],

6.verse: I removed his shoulder from the burden; his hands were freed from the basket.

7.verse: You called in distress and I delivered you; I answered you in the secret place of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

8.verse: Hear, O My people, and I will admonish you--O Israel, if you would listen to Me!

9.verse: There shall no strange god be among you, neither shall you worship any alien god.

10.verse: I am the Lord your God, Who brought you up out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide and I will fill it.

11.verse: But My people would not hearken to My voice, and Israel would have none of Me.

12.verse: So I gave them up to their own hearts' lust and let them go after their own stubborn will, that they might follow their own counsels.

13.verse: Oh, that My people would listen to Me, that Israel would walk in My ways!

14.verse: Speedily then I would subdue their enemies and turn My hand against their adversaries.

15.verse: [Had Israel listened to Me in Egypt, then] those who hated the Lord would have come cringing before Him, and their defeat would have lasted forever.

16.verse: [God] would feed [Israel now] also with the finest of the wheat; and with honey out of the rock would I satisfy you.

1.verse: GOD STANDS in the assembly [of the representatives] of God; in the midst of the magistrates or judges He gives judgment [as] among the gods.

2.verse: How long will you [magistrates or judges] judge unjustly and show partiality to the wicked? Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

3.verse: Do justice to the weak (poor) and fatherless; maintain the rights of the afflicted and needy.

4.verse: Deliver the poor and needy; rescue them out of the hand of the wicked.

5.verse: [The magistrates and judges] know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in the darkness [of complacent satisfaction]; all the foundations of the earth [the fundamental principles upon which rests the administration of justice] are shaking.

6.verse: I said, You are gods [since you judge on My behalf, as My representatives]; indeed, all of you are children of the Most High.

7.verse: But you shall die as men and fall as one of the princes.

8.verse: Arise, O God, judge the earth! For to You belong all the nations.

1.verse: KEEP NOT silence, O God; hold not Your peace or be still, O God.

2.verse: For, behold, Your enemies are in tumult, and those who hate You have raised their heads.

3.verse: They lay crafty schemes against Your people and consult together against Your hidden and precious ones.

4.verse: They have said, Come, and let us wipe them out as a nation; let the name of Israel be in remembrance no more.

5.verse: For they have consulted together with one accord and one heart; against You they make a covenant--

6.verse: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, of Moab and the Hagrites,

7.verse: Gebal and Ammon and Amalek, the Philistines, with the inhabitants of Tyre.

8.verse: Assyria also has joined with them; they have helped the children of Lot [the Ammonites and the Moabites] and have been an arm to them. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

9.verse: Do to them as [You did to] the Midianites, as to Sisera and Jabin at the brook of Kishon,

10.verse: Who perished at Endor, who became like manure for the earth.

11.verse: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, yes, all their princes as Zebah and Zalmunna,

12.verse: Who say, Let us take possession for ourselves of the pastures of God.

13.verse: O my God, make them like whirling dust, like stubble or chaff before the wind!

14.verse: As fire consumes the forest, and as the flame sets the mountains ablaze,

15.verse: So pursue and afflict them with Your tempest and terrify them with Your tornado or hurricane.

16.verse: Fill their faces with shame, that they may seek, inquire for, and insistently require Your name, O Lord.

17.verse: Let them be put to shame and dismayed forever; yes, let them be put to shame and perish,

18.verse: That they may know that You, Whose name alone is the Lord, are the Most High over all the earth.

1.verse: HOW LOVELY are Your tabernacles, O Lord of hosts!

2.verse: My soul yearns, yes, even pines and is homesick for the courts of the Lord; my heart and my flesh cry out and sing for joy to the living God.

3.verse: Yes, the sparrow has found a house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young--even Your altars, O Lord of hosts, my King and my God.

4.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) are those who dwell in Your house and Your presence; they will be singing Your praises all the day long. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the man whose strength is in You, in whose heart are the highways to Zion.

6.verse: Passing through the Valley of Weeping (Baca), they make it a place of springs; the early rain also fills [the pools] with blessings.

7.verse: They go from strength to strength [increasing in victorious power]; each of them appears before God in Zion.

8.verse: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob! Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

9.verse: Behold our shield [the king as Your agent], O God, and look upon the face of Your anointed!

10.verse: For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand [anywhere else]; I would rather be a doorkeeper and stand at the threshold in the house of my God than to dwell [at ease] in the tents of wickedness.

11.verse: For the Lord God is a Sun and Shield; the Lord bestows [present] grace and favor and [future] glory (honor, splendor, and heavenly bliss)! No good thing will He withhold from those who walk uprightly.

12.verse: O Lord of hosts, blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the man who trusts in You [leaning and believing on You, committing all and confidently looking to You, and that without fear or misgiving]!

1.verse: LORD, YOU have [at last] been favorable and have dealt graciously with Your land [of Canaan]; You have brought back [from Babylon] the captives of Jacob.

2.verse: You have forgiven and taken away the iniquity of Your people, You have covered all their sin. Selah [pause, and calmly realize what that means]!

3.verse: You have withdrawn all Your wrath and indignation, You have turned away from the blazing anger [which You had let loose].

4.verse: Restore us, O God of our salvation, and cause Your anger toward us to cease [forever].

5.verse: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You prolong Your anger [and disfavor] and spread it out to all generations?

6.verse: Will You not revive us again, that Your people may rejoice in You?

7.verse: Show us Your mercy and loving-kindness, O Lord, and grant us Your salvation.

8.verse: I will listen [with expectancy] to what God the Lord will say, for He will speak peace to His people, to His saints (those who are in right standing with Him)--but let them not turn again to [self-confident] folly.

9.verse: Surely His salvation is near to those who reverently and worshipfully fear Him, [and is ready to be appropriated] that [the manifest presence of God, His] glory may tabernacle and abide in our land.

10.verse: Mercy and loving-kindness and truth have met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

11.verse: Truth shall spring up from the earth, and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

12.verse: Yes, the Lord will give what is good, and our land will yield its increase.

13.verse: Righteousness shall go before Him and shall make His footsteps a way in which to walk.

1.verse: INCLINE YOUR ear, O Lord, and answer me, for I am poor and distressed, needy and desiring.

2.verse: Preserve my life, for I am godly and dedicated; O my God, save Your servant, for I trust in You [leaning and believing on You, committing all and confidently looking to You, without fear or doubt].

3.verse: Be merciful and gracious to me, O Lord, for to You do I cry all the day.

4.verse: Make me, Your servant, to rejoice, O Lord, for to You do I lift myself up.

5.verse: For You, O Lord, are good, and ready to forgive [our trespasses, sending them away, letting them go completely and forever]; and You are abundant in mercy and loving-kindness to all those who call upon You.

6.verse: Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer; and listen to the cry of my supplications.

7.verse: In the day of my trouble I will call on You, for You will answer me.

8.verse: There is none like unto You among the gods, O Lord, neither are their works like unto Yours.

9.verse: All nations whom You have made shall come and fall down before You, O Lord; and they shall glorify Your name.

10.verse: For You are great and work wonders! You alone are God.

11.verse: Teach me Your way, O Lord, that I may walk and live in Your truth; direct and unite my heart [solely, reverently] to fear and honor Your name.

12.verse: I will confess and praise You, O Lord my God, with my whole (united) heart; and I will glorify Your name forevermore.

13.verse: For great is Your mercy and loving-kindness toward me; and You have delivered me from the depths of Sheol [from the exceeding depths of affliction].

14.verse: O God, the proud and insolent are risen against me; a rabble of violent and ruthless men has sought and demanded my life, and they have not set You before them.

15.verse: But You, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in mercy and loving-kindness and truth.

16.verse: O turn to me and have mercy and be gracious to me; grant strength (might and inflexibility to temptation) to Your servant and save the son of Your handmaiden.

17.verse: Show me a sign of [Your evident] goodwill and favor, that those who hate me may see it and be put to shame, because You, Lord, [will show Your approval of me when You] help and comfort me.

1.verse: ON THE holy hills stands the city [of Jerusalem and the temple] God founded.

2.verse: The Lord loves the gates of Zion [through which the crowds of pilgrims enter from all nations] more than all the dwellings of Jacob (Israel).

3.verse: Glorious things are spoken of you, O city of God. Selah [pause, and calmly realize what that means]!

4.verse: I will make mention of Rahab [the poetic name for Egypt] and Babylon as among those who know [the city of God]--behold, Philistia and Tyre, with Ethiopia (Cush)--[saying], This man was born there.

5.verse: Yes, of Zion it shall be said, This man and that man were born in her, for the Most High Himself will establish her.

6.verse: The Lord shall count, when He registers the peoples, that this man was born there. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

7.verse: The singers as well as the players on instruments shall say, All my springs (my sources of life and joy) are in you [city of our God].

1.verse: O LORD, the God of my salvation, I have cried to You for help by day; at night I am in Your presence.

2.verse: Let my prayer come before You and really enter into Your presence; incline Your ear to my cry!

3.verse: For I am full of troubles, and my life draws near to Sheol (the place of the dead).

4.verse: I am counted among those who go down into the pit (the grave); I am like a man who has no help or strength [a mere shadow],

5.verse: Cast away among the dead, like the slain that lie in a [nameless] grave, whom You [seriously] remember no more, and they are cut off from Your hand.

6.verse: You have laid me in the depths of the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.

7.verse: Your wrath lies hard upon me, and You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

8.verse: You have put my [familiar] friends far from me; You have made me an abomination to them. I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.

9.verse: My eye grows dim because of sorrow and affliction. Lord, I have called daily on You; I have spread forth my hands to You.

10.verse: Will You show wonders to the dead? Shall the departed arise and praise You? Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

11.verse: Shall Your steadfast love be declared in the grave? Or Your faithfulness in Abaddon (Sheol, as a place of ruin and destruction)?

12.verse: Shall Your wonders be known in the dark? And Your righteousness in the place of forgetfulness [where the dead forget and are forgotten]?

13.verse: But to You I cry, O Lord; and in the morning shall my prayer come to meet You.

14.verse: Lord, why do You cast me off? Why do You hide Your face from me?

15.verse: I was afflicted and close to death from my youth up; while I suffer Your terrors I am distracted [I faint].

16.verse: Your fierce wrath has swept over me; Your terrors have destroyed me.

17.verse: They surround me like a flood all day long; together they have closed in upon me.

18.verse: Lover and friend have You put far from me; my familiar friends are darkness and the grave.

1.verse: I WILL sing of the mercy and loving-kindness of the Lord forever; with my mouth will I make known Your faithfulness from generation to generation.

2.verse: For I have said, Mercy and loving-kindness shall be built up forever; Your faithfulness will You establish in the very heavens [unchangeable and perpetual].

3.verse: [You have said] I have made a covenant with My chosen one, I have sworn to David My servant,

4.verse: Your Seed I will establish forever, and I will build up your throne for all generations. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

5.verse: Let heaven (the angels) praise Your wonders, O Lord, Your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones (the holy angels).

6.verse: For who in the heavens can be compared to the Lord? Who among the mighty [heavenly beings] can be likened to the Lord,

7.verse: A God greatly feared and revered in the council of the holy (angelic) ones, and to be feared and worshipfully revered above all those who are round about Him?

8.verse: O Lord God of hosts, who is a mighty one like unto You, O Lord? And Your faithfulness is round about You [an essential part of You at all times].

9.verse: You rule the raging of the sea; when its waves arise, You still them.

10.verse: You have broken Rahab (Egypt) in pieces; with Your mighty arm You have scattered Your enemies.

11.verse: The heavens are Yours, the earth also is Yours; the world and all that is in it, You have founded them.

12.verse: The north and the south, You have created them; Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon joyously praise Your name.

13.verse: You have a mighty arm; strong is Your hand, Your right hand is soaring high.

14.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne; mercy and loving-kindness and truth go before Your face.

15.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) are the people who know the joyful sound [who understand and appreciate the spiritual blessings symbolized by the feasts]; they walk, O Lord, in the light and favor of Your countenance!

16.verse: In Your name they rejoice all the day, and in Your righteousness they are exalted.

17.verse: For You are the glory of their strength [their proud adornment], and by Your favor our horn is exalted and we walk with uplifted faces!

18.verse: For our shield belongs to the Lord, and our king to the Holy One of Israel.

19.verse: Once You spoke in a vision to Your devoted ones and said, I have endowed one who is mighty [a hero, giving him the power to help--to be a champion for Israel]; I have exalted one chosen from among the people.

20.verse: I have found David My servant; with My holy oil have I anointed him,

21.verse: With whom My hand shall be established and ever abide; My arm also shall strengthen him.

22.verse: The enemy shall not exact from him or do him violence or outwit him, nor shall the wicked afflict and humble him.

23.verse: I will beat down his foes before his face and smite those who hate him.

24.verse: My faithfulness and My mercy and loving-kindness shall be with him, and in My name shall his horn be exalted [great power and prosperity shall be conferred upon him].

25.verse: I will set his hand in control also on the [Mediterranean] Sea, and his right hand on the rivers [Euphrates with its tributaries].

26.verse: He shall cry to Me, You are my Father, my God, and the Rock of my salvation!

27.verse: Also I will make him the firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.

28.verse: My mercy and loving-kindness will I keep for him forevermore, and My covenant shall stand fast and be faithful with him.

29.verse: His Offspring also will I make to endure forever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

30.verse: If his children forsake My law and walk not in My ordinances,

31.verse: If they break or profane My statutes and keep not My commandments,

32.verse: Then will I punish their transgression with the rod [of chastisement], and their iniquity with stripes.

33.verse: Nevertheless, My loving-kindness will I not break off from him, nor allow My faithfulness to fail [to lie and be false to him].

34.verse: My covenant will I not break or profane, nor alter the thing that is gone out of My lips.

35.verse: Once [for all] have I sworn by My holiness, which cannot be violated; I will not lie to David:

36.verse: His Offspring shall endure forever, and his throne [shall continue] as the sun before Me.

37.verse: It shall be established forever as the moon, the faithful witness in the heavens. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

38.verse: But [in apparent contradiction to all this] You [even You the faithful Lord] have cast off and rejected; You have been full of wrath against Your anointed.

39.verse: You have despised and loathed and renounced the covenant with Your servant; You have profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.

40.verse: You have broken down all his hedges and his walls; You have brought his strongholds to ruin.

41.verse: All who pass along the road spoil and rob him; he has become the scorn and reproach of his neighbors.

42.verse: You have exalted the right hand of his foes; You have made all his enemies rejoice.

43.verse: Moreover, You have turned back the edge of his sword and have not made him to stand in battle.

44.verse: You have made his glory and splendor to cease and have hurled to the ground his throne.

45.verse: The days of his youth have You shortened; You have covered him with shame. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

46.verse: How long, O Lord? Will You hide Yourself forever? How long shall Your wrath burn like fire?

47.verse: O [earnestly] remember how short my time is and what a mere fleeting life mine is. For what emptiness, falsity, futility, and frailty You have created all men!

48.verse: What man can live and shall not see death, or can deliver himself from the [powerful] hand of Sheol (the place of the dead)? Selah [pause, and calmly consider that]!

49.verse: Lord, where are Your former loving-kindnesses [shown in the reigns of David and Solomon], which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?

50.verse: Remember, Lord, and earnestly imprint [on Your heart] the reproach of Your servants, scorned and insulted, how I bear in my bosom the reproach of all the many and mighty peoples,

51.verse: With which Your enemies have taunted, O Lord, with which they have mocked the footsteps of Your anointed.

52.verse: Blessed be the Lord forevermore! Amen and Amen.

1.verse: LORD, YOU have been our dwelling place and our refuge in all generations [says Moses].

2.verse: Before the mountains were brought forth or ever You had formed and given birth to the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting You are God.

3.verse: You turn man back to dust and corruption, and say, Return, O sons of the earthborn [to the earth]!

4.verse: For a thousand years in Your sight are but as yesterday when it is past, or as a watch in the night.

5.verse: You carry away [these disobedient people, doomed to die within forty years] as with a flood; they are as a sleep [vague and forgotten as soon as they are gone]. In the morning they are like grass which grows up--

6.verse: In the morning it flourishes and springs up; in the evening it is mown down and withers.

7.verse: For we [the Israelites in the wilderness] are consumed by Your anger, and by Your wrath are we troubled, overwhelmed, and frightened away.

8.verse: Our iniquities, our secret heart and its sins [which we would so like to conceal even from ourselves], You have set in the [revealing] light of Your countenance.

9.verse: For all our days [out here in this wilderness, says Moses] pass away in Your wrath; we spend our years as a tale that is told [for we adults know we are doomed to die soon, without reaching Canaan].

10.verse: The days of our years are threescore years and ten (seventy years)--or even, if by reason of strength, fourscore years (eighty years); yet is their pride [in additional years] only labor and sorrow, for it is soon gone, and we fly away.

11.verse: Who knows the power of Your anger? [Who worthily connects this brevity of life with Your recognition of sin?] And Your wrath, who connects it with the reverent and worshipful fear that is due You?

12.verse: So teach us to number our days, that we may get us a heart of wisdom.

13.verse: Turn, O Lord [from Your fierce anger]! How long--? Revoke Your sentence and be compassionate and at ease toward Your servants.

14.verse: O satisfy us with Your mercy and loving-kindness in the morning [now, before we are older], that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

15.verse: Make us glad in proportion to the days in which You have afflicted us and to the years in which we have suffered evil.

16.verse: Let Your work [the signs of Your power] be revealed to Your servants, and Your [glorious] majesty to their children.

17.verse: And let the beauty and delightfulness and favor of the Lord our God be upon us; confirm and establish the work of our hands--yes, the work of our hands, confirm and establish it.

1.verse: HE WHO dwells in the secret place of the Most High shall remain stable and fixed under the shadow of the Almighty [Whose power no foe can withstand].

2.verse: I will say of the Lord, He is my Refuge and my Fortress, my God; on Him I lean and rely, and in Him I [confidently] trust!

3.verse: For [then] He will deliver you from the snare of the fowler and from the deadly pestilence.

4.verse: [Then] He will cover you with His pinions, and under His wings shall you trust and find refuge; His truth and His faithfulness are a shield and a buckler.

5.verse: You shall not be afraid of the terror of the night, nor of the arrow (the evil plots and slanders of the wicked) that flies by day,

6.verse: Nor of the pestilence that stalks in darkness, nor of the destruction and sudden death that surprise and lay waste at noonday.

7.verse: A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand, but it shall not come near you.

8.verse: Only a spectator shall you be [yourself inaccessible in the secret place of the Most High] as you witness the reward of the wicked.

9.verse: Because you have made the Lord your refuge, and the Most High your dwelling place,

10.verse: There shall no evil befall you, nor any plague or calamity come near your tent.

11.verse: For He will give His angels [especial] charge over you to accompany and defend and preserve you in all your ways [of obedience and service].

12.verse: They shall bear you up on their hands, lest you dash your foot against a stone.

13.verse: You shall tread upon the lion and adder; the young lion and the serpent shall you trample underfoot.

14.verse: Because he has set his love upon Me, therefore will I deliver him; I will set him on high, because he knows and understands My name [has a personal knowledge of My mercy, love, and kindness--trusts and relies on Me, knowing I will never forsake him, no, never].

15.verse: He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.

16.verse: With long life will I satisfy him and show him My salvation.

1.verse: IT IS a good and delightful thing to give thanks to the Lord, to sing praises [with musical accompaniment] to Your name, O Most High,

2.verse: To show forth Your loving-kindness in the morning and Your faithfulness by night,

3.verse: With an instrument of ten strings and with the lute, with a solemn sound upon the lyre.

4.verse: For You, O Lord, have made me glad by Your works; at the deeds of Your hands I joyfully sing.

5.verse: How great are Your doings, O Lord! Your thoughts are very deep.

6.verse: A man in his rude and uncultivated state knows not, neither does a [self-confident] fool understand this:

7.verse: That though the wicked spring up like grass and all evildoers flourish, they are doomed to be destroyed forever.

8.verse: But You, Lord, are on high forever.

9.verse: For behold, Your adversaries, O Lord, for behold, Your enemies shall perish; all the evildoers shall be scattered.

10.verse: But my horn (emblem of excessive strength and stately grace) You have exalted like that of a wild ox; I am anointed with fresh oil.

11.verse: My eye looks upon those who lie in wait for me; my ears hear the evildoers that rise up against me.

12.verse: The [uncompromisingly] righteous shall flourish like the palm tree [be long-lived, stately, upright, useful, and fruitful]; they shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon [majestic, stable, durable, and incorruptible].

13.verse: Planted in the house of the Lord, they shall flourish in the courts of our God.

14.verse: [Growing in grace] they shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be full of sap [of spiritual vitality] and [rich in the] verdure [of trust, love, and contentment].

15.verse: [They are living memorials] to show that the Lord is upright and faithful to His promises; He is my Rock, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.

1.verse: THE LORD reigns, He is clothed with majesty; the Lord is robed, He has girded Himself with strength and power; the world also is established, that it cannot be moved.

2.verse: Your throne is established from of old; You are from everlasting.

3.verse: The floods have lifted up, O Lord, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up the roaring of their waves.

4.verse: The Lord on high is mightier and more glorious than the noise of many waters, yes, than the mighty breakers and waves of the sea.

5.verse: Your testimonies are very sure; holiness [apparent in separation from sin, with simple trust and hearty obedience] is becoming to Your house, O Lord, forever.

1.verse: O LORD God, You to Whom vengeance belongs, O God, You to Whom vengeance belongs, shine forth!

2.verse: Rise up, O Judge of the earth; render to the proud a fit compensation!

3.verse: Lord, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph and exult?

4.verse: They pour out arrogant words, speaking hard things; all the evildoers boast loftily.

5.verse: They crush Your people, O Lord, and afflict Your heritage.

6.verse: They slay the widow and the transient stranger and murder the unprotected orphan.

7.verse: Yet they say, The Lord does not see, neither does the God of Jacob notice it.

8.verse: Consider and understand, you stupid ones among the people! And you [self-confident] fools, when will you become wise?

9.verse: He Who planted the ear, shall He not hear? He Who formed the eye, shall He not see?

10.verse: He Who disciplines and instructs the nations, shall He not punish, He Who teaches man knowledge?

11.verse: The Lord knows the thoughts of man, that they are vain (empty and futile--only a breath).

12.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the man whom You discipline and instruct, O Lord, and teach out of Your law,

13.verse: That You may give him power to keep himself calm in the days of adversity, until the [inevitable] pit of corruption is dug for the wicked.

14.verse: For the Lord will not cast off nor spurn His people, neither will He abandon His heritage.

15.verse: For justice will return to the [uncompromisingly] righteous, and all the upright in heart will follow it.

16.verse: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

17.verse: Unless the Lord had been my help, I would soon have dwelt in [the land where there is] silence.

18.verse: When I said, My foot is slipping, Your mercy and loving-kindness, O Lord, held me up.

19.verse: In the multitude of my [anxious] thoughts within me, Your comforts cheer and delight my soul!

20.verse: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with You--they who frame and hide their unrighteous doings under [the sacred name of] law?

21.verse: They band themselves together against the life of the [consistently] righteous and condemn the innocent to death.

22.verse: But the Lord has become my High Tower and Defense, and my God the Rock of my refuge.

23.verse: And He will turn back upon them their own iniquity and will wipe them out by means of their own wickedness; the Lord our God will wipe them out.

1.verse: O COME, let us sing to the Lord; let us make a joyful noise to the Rock of our salvation!

2.verse: Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving; let us make a joyful noise to Him with songs of praise!

3.verse: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.

4.verse: In His hand are the deep places of the earth; the heights and strength of the hills are His also.

5.verse: The sea is His, for He made it; and His hands formed the dry land.

6.verse: O come, let us worship and bow down, let us kneel before the Lord our Maker [in reverent praise and supplication].

7.verse: For He is our God and we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand. Today, if you will hear His voice,

8.verse: Harden not your hearts as at Meribah and as at Massah in the day of temptation in the wilderness,

9.verse: When your fathers tried My patience and tested Me, proved Me, and saw My work [of judgment].

10.verse: Forty years long was I grieved and disgusted with that generation, and I said, It is a people that do err in their hearts, and they do not approve, acknowledge, or regard My ways.

11.verse: Wherefore I swore in My wrath that they would not enter My rest [the land of promise].

1.verse: O SING to the Lord a new song; sing to the Lord, all the earth!

2.verse: Sing to the Lord, bless (affectionately praise) His name; show forth His salvation from day to day.

3.verse: Declare His glory among the nations, His marvelous works among all the peoples.

4.verse: For great is the Lord and greatly to be praised; He is to be reverently feared and worshiped above all [so-called] gods.

5.verse: For all the gods of the nations are [lifeless] idols, but the Lord made the heavens.

6.verse: Honor and majesty are before Him; strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.

7.verse: Ascribe to the Lord, O you families of the peoples, ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.

8.verse: Give to the Lord the glory due His name; bring an offering and come [before Him] into His courts.

9.verse: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness; tremble before and reverently fear Him, all the earth.

10.verse: Say among the nations that the Lord reigns; the world also is established, so that it cannot be moved; He shall judge and rule the people righteously and with justice.

11.verse: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; let the sea roar, and all the things which fill it;

12.verse: Let the field be exultant, and all that is in it! Then shall all the trees of the wood sing for joy

13.verse: Before the Lord, for He comes, for He comes to judge and govern the earth! He shall judge the world with righteousness and justice and the peoples with His faithfulness and truth.

1.verse: THE LORD reigns, let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles and coastlands be glad!

2.verse: Clouds and darkness are round about Him [as at Sinai]; righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.

3.verse: Fire goes before Him and burns up His adversaries round about.

4.verse: His lightnings illumine the world; the earth sees and trembles.

5.verse: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

6.verse: The heavens declare His righteousness, and all the peoples see His glory.

7.verse: Let all those be put to shame who serve graven images, who boast in idols. Fall prostrate before Him, all you gods.

8.verse: Zion heard and was glad, and the daughters of Judah rejoiced [in relief] because of Your judgments, O Lord.

9.verse: For You, Lord, are high above all the earth; You are exalted far above all gods.

10.verse: O you who love the Lord, hate evil; He preserves the lives of His saints (the children of God), He delivers them out of the hand of the wicked.

11.verse: Light is sown for the [uncompromisingly] righteous and strewn along their pathway, and joy for the upright in heart [the irrepressible joy which comes from consciousness of His favor and protection].

12.verse: Rejoice in the Lord, you [consistently] righteous (upright and in right standing with God), and give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness.

1.verse: O SING to the Lord a new song, for He has done marvelous things; His right hand and His holy arm have wrought salvation for Him.

2.verse: The Lord has made known His salvation; His righteousness has He openly shown in the sight of the nations.

3.verse: He has [earnestly] remembered His mercy and loving-kindness, His truth and His faithfulness toward the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth have witnessed the salvation of our God.

4.verse: Make a joyful noise to the Lord, all the earth; break forth and sing for joy, yes, sing praises!

5.verse: Sing praises to the Lord with the lyre, with the lyre and the voice of melody.

6.verse: With trumpets and the sound of the horn make a joyful noise before the King, the Lord!

7.verse: Let the sea roar, and all that fills it, the world, and those who dwell in it!

8.verse: Let the rivers clap their hands; together let the hills sing for joy

9.verse: Before the Lord, for He is coming to judge [and rule] the earth; with righteousness will He judge [and rule] the world, and the peoples with equity.

1.verse: THE LORD reigns, let the peoples tremble [with reverential fear]! He sits [enthroned] above the cherubim, let the earth quake!

2.verse: The Lord is great in Zion, and He is high above all the peoples.

3.verse: Let them confess and praise Your great name, awesome and reverence inspiring! It is holy, and holy is He!

4.verse: The strength of the king who loves righteousness and equity You establish in uprightness; You execute justice and righteousness in Jacob (Israel).

5.verse: Extol the Lord our God and worship at His footstool! Holy is He!

6.verse: Moses and Aaron were among His priests, and Samuel was among those who called upon His name; they called upon the Lord, and He answered them.

7.verse: He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud; they kept His testimonies and the statutes that He gave them.

8.verse: You answered them, O Lord our God; You were a forgiving God to them, although avenging their evildoing and wicked practices.

9.verse: Extol the Lord our God and worship at His holy hill, for the Lord our God is holy!

1.verse: MAKE A joyful noise to the Lord, all you lands!

2.verse: Serve the Lord with gladness! Come before His presence with singing!

3.verse: Know (perceive, recognize, and understand with approval) that the Lord is God! It is He Who has made us, not we ourselves [and we are His]! We are His people and the sheep of His pasture.

4.verse: Enter into His gates with thanksgiving and a thank offering and into His courts with praise! Be thankful and say so to Him, bless and affectionately praise His name!

5.verse: For the Lord is good; His mercy and loving-kindness are everlasting, His faithfulness and truth endure to all generations.

1.verse: I WILL sing of mercy and loving-kindness and justice; to You, O Lord, will I sing.

2.verse: I will behave myself wisely and give heed to the blameless way--O when will You come to me? I will walk within my house in integrity and with a blameless heart.

3.verse: I will set no base or wicked thing before my eyes. I hate the work of them who turn aside [from the right path]; it shall not grasp hold of me.

4.verse: A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will know no evil person or thing.

5.verse: Whoso privily slanders his neighbor, him will I cut off [from me]; he who has a haughty look and a proud and arrogant heart I cannot and I will not tolerate.

6.verse: My eyes shall [look with favor] upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he who walks blamelessly, he shall minister to me.

7.verse: He who works deceit shall not dwell in my house; he who tells lies shall not continue in my presence.

8.verse: Morning after morning I will root up all the wicked in the land, that I may eliminate all the evildoers from the city of the Lord.

1.verse: HEAR MY prayer, O Lord, and let my cry come to You.

2.verse: Hide not Your face from me in the day when I am in distress! Incline Your ear to me; in the day when I call, answer me speedily.

3.verse: For my days consume away like smoke, and my bones burn like a firebrand or like a hearth.

4.verse: My heart is smitten like grass and withered, so that [in absorption] I forget to eat my food.

5.verse: By reason of my loud groaning [from suffering and trouble] my flesh cleaves to my bones.

6.verse: I am like a melancholy pelican or vulture of the wilderness; I am like a [desolate] owl of the waste places.

7.verse: I am sleepless and lie awake [mourning], like a bereaved sparrow alone on the housetop.

8.verse: My adversaries taunt and reproach me all the day; and they who are angry with me use my name as a curse.

9.verse: For I have eaten the ashes [in which I sat] as if they were bread and have mingled my drink with weeping

10.verse: Because of Your indignation and Your wrath, for You have taken me up and cast me away.

11.verse: My days are like an evening shadow that stretches out and declines [with the sun]; and I am withered like grass.

12.verse: But You, O Lord, are enthroned forever; and the fame of Your name endures to all generations.

13.verse: You will arise and have mercy and loving-kindness for Zion, for it is time to have pity and compassion for her; yes, the set time has come [the moment designated].

14.verse: For Your servants take [melancholy] pleasure in the stones [of her ruins] and show pity for her dust.

15.verse: So the nations shall fear and worshipfully revere the name of the Lord, and all the kings of the earth Your glory.

16.verse: When the Lord builds up Zion, He will appear in His glory;

17.verse: He will regard the plea of the destitute and will not despise their prayer.

18.verse: Let this be recorded for the generation yet unborn, that a people yet to be created shall praise the Lord.

19.verse: For He looked down from the height of His sanctuary, from heaven did the Lord behold the earth,

20.verse: To hear the sighing and groaning of the prisoner, to loose those who are appointed to death,

21.verse: So that men may declare the name of the Lord in Zion and His praise in Jerusalem

22.verse: When peoples are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to worship and serve the Lord.

23.verse: He has afflicted and weakened my strength, humbling and bringing me low [with sorrow] in the way; He has shortened my days [aging me prematurely].

24.verse: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days, You Whose years continue throughout all generations.

25.verse: At the beginning You existed and laid the foundations of the earth; the heavens are the work of Your hands.

26.verse: They shall perish, but You shall remain and endure; yes, all of them shall wear out and become old like a garment. Like clothing You shall change them, and they shall be changed and pass away.

27.verse: But You remain the same, and Your years shall have no end.

28.verse: The children of Your servants shall dwell safely and continue, and their descendants shall be established before You.

1.verse: BLESS (AFFECTIONATELY, gratefully praise) the Lord, O my soul; and all that is [deepest] within me, bless His holy name!

2.verse: Bless (affectionately, gratefully praise) the Lord, O my soul, and forget not [one of] all His benefits--

3.verse: Who forgives [every one of] all your iniquities, Who heals [each one of] all your diseases,

4.verse: Who redeems your life from the pit and corruption, Who beautifies, dignifies, and crowns you with loving-kindness and tender mercy;

5.verse: Who satisfies your mouth [your necessity and desire at your personal age and situation] with good so that your youth, renewed, is like the eagle's [strong, overcoming, soaring]!

6.verse: The Lord executes righteousness and justice [not for me only, but] for all who are oppressed.

7.verse: He made known His ways [of righteousness and justice] to Moses, His acts to the children of Israel.

8.verse: The Lord is merciful and gracious, slow to anger and plenteous in mercy and loving-kindness.

9.verse: He will not always chide or be contending, neither will He keep His anger forever or hold a grudge.

10.verse: He has not dealt with us after our sins nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

11.verse: For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great are His mercy and loving-kindness toward those who reverently and worshipfully fear Him.

12.verse: As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.

13.verse: As a father loves and pities his children, so the Lord loves and pities those who fear Him [with reverence, worship, and awe].

14.verse: For He knows our frame, He [earnestly] remembers and imprints [on His heart] that we are dust.

15.verse: As for man, his days are as grass; as a flower of the field, so he flourishes.

16.verse: For the wind passes over it and it is gone, and its place shall know it no more.

17.verse: But the mercy and loving-kindness of the Lord are from everlasting to everlasting upon those who reverently and worshipfully fear Him, and His righteousness is to children's children--

18.verse: To such as keep His covenant [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying it] and to those who [earnestly] remember His commandments to do them [imprinting them on their hearts].

19.verse: The Lord has established His throne in the heavens, and His kingdom rules over all.

20.verse: Bless (affectionately, gratefully praise) the Lord, you His angels, you mighty ones who do His commandments, hearkening to the voice of His word.

21.verse: Bless (affectionately, gratefully praise) the Lord, all you His hosts, you His ministers who do His pleasure.

22.verse: Bless the Lord, all His works in all places of His dominion; bless (affectionately, gratefully praise) the Lord, O my soul!

1.verse: BLESS (AFFECTIONATELY, gratefully praise) the Lord, O my soul! O Lord my God, You are very great! You are clothed with honor and majesty--

2.verse: [You are the One] Who covers Yourself with light as with a garment, Who stretches out the heavens like a curtain or a tent,

3.verse: Who lays the beams of the upper room of His abode in the waters [above the firmament], Who makes the clouds His chariot, Who walks on the wings of the wind,

4.verse: Who makes winds His messengers, flames of fire His ministers.

5.verse: You laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be moved forever.

6.verse: You covered it with the deep as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.

7.verse: At Your rebuke they fled; at the voice of Your thunder they hastened away.

8.verse: The mountains rose, the valleys sank down to the place which You appointed for them.

9.verse: You have set a boundary [for the waters] which they may not pass over, that they turn not again to deluge the earth.

10.verse: He sends forth springs into the valleys; their waters run among the mountains.

11.verse: They give drink to every [wild] beast of the field; the wild asses quench their thirst there.

12.verse: Beside them the birds of the heavens have their nests; they sing among the branches.

13.verse: He waters the mountains from His upper rooms; the earth is satisfied and abounds with the fruit of His works.

14.verse: He causes vegetation to grow for the cattle, and all that the earth produces for man to cultivate, that he may bring forth food out of the earth--

15.verse: And wine that gladdens the heart of man, to make his face shine more than oil, and bread to support, refresh, and strengthen man's heart.

16.verse: The trees of the Lord are watered abundantly and are filled with sap, the cedars of Lebanon which He has planted,

17.verse: Where the birds make their nests; as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.

18.verse: The high mountains are for the wild goats; the rocks are a refuge for the conies and badgers.

19.verse: [The Lord] appointed the moon for the seasons; the sun knows [the exact time of] its setting.

20.verse: You [O Lord] make darkness and it becomes night, in which creeps forth every wild beast of the forest.

21.verse: The young lions roar after their prey and seek their food from God.

22.verse: When the sun arises, they withdraw themselves and lie down in their dens.

23.verse: Man goes forth to his work and remains at his task until evening.

24.verse: O Lord, how many and varied are Your works! In wisdom have You made them all; the earth is full of Your riches and Your creatures.

25.verse: Yonder is the sea, great and wide, in which are swarms of innumerable creeping things, creatures both small and great.

26.verse: There go the ships of the sea, and Leviathan (the sea monster), which You have formed to sport in it.

27.verse: These all wait and are dependent upon You, that You may give them their food in due season.

28.verse: When You give it to them, they gather it up; You open Your hand, and they are filled with good things.

29.verse: When You hide Your face, they are troubled and dismayed; when You take away their breath, they die and return to their dust.

30.verse: When You send forth Your Spirit and give them breath, they are created, and You replenish the face of the ground.

31.verse: May the glory of the Lord endure forever; may the Lord rejoice in His works--

32.verse: Who looks on the earth, and it quakes and trembles, Who touches the mountains, and they smoke!

33.verse: I will sing to the Lord as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have any being.

34.verse: May my meditation be sweet to Him; as for me, I will rejoice in the Lord.

35.verse: Let sinners be consumed from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless (affectionately, gratefully praise) the Lord, O my soul! Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: O GIVE thanks unto the Lord, call upon His name, make known His doings among the peoples!

2.verse: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him; meditate on and talk of all His marvelous deeds and devoutly praise them.

3.verse: Glory in His holy name; let the hearts of those rejoice who seek and require the Lord [as their indispensable necessity].

4.verse: Seek, inquire of and for the Lord, and crave Him and His strength (His might and inflexibility to temptation); seek and require His face and His presence [continually] evermore.

5.verse: [Earnestly] remember the marvelous deeds that He has done, His miracles and wonders, the judgments and sentences which He pronounced [upon His enemies, as in Egypt].

6.verse: O you offspring of Abraham His servant, you children of Jacob, His chosen ones,

7.verse: He is the Lord our God; His judgments are in all the earth.

8.verse: He is [earnestly] mindful of His covenant and forever it is imprinted on His heart, the word which He commanded and established to a thousand generations,

9.verse: The covenant which He made with Abraham, and His sworn promise to Isaac,

10.verse: Which He confirmed to Jacob as a statute, to Israel as an everlasting covenant,

11.verse: Saying, Unto you will I give the land of Canaan as your measured portion, possession, and inheritance.

12.verse: When they were but a few men in number, in fact, very few, and were temporary residents and strangers in it,

13.verse: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people,

14.verse: He allowed no man to do them wrong; in fact, He reproved kings for their sakes,

15.verse: Saying, Touch not My anointed, and do My prophets no harm.

16.verse: Moreover, He called for a famine upon the land [of Egypt]; He cut off every source of bread.

17.verse: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold as a servant.

18.verse: His feet they hurt with fetters; he was laid in chains of iron and his soul entered into the iron,

19.verse: Until his word [to his cruel brothers] came true, until the word of the Lord tried and tested him.

20.verse: The king sent and loosed him, even the ruler of the peoples, and let him go free.

21.verse: He made Joseph lord of his house and ruler of all his substance,

22.verse: To bind his princes at his pleasure and teach his elders wisdom.

23.verse: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

24.verse: There [the Lord] greatly increased His people and made them stronger than their oppressors.

25.verse: He turned the hearts [of the Egyptians] to hate His people, to deal craftily with His servants.

26.verse: He sent Moses His servant, and Aaron, whom He had chosen.

27.verse: They showed His signs among them, wonders and miracles in the land of Ham (Egypt).

28.verse: He sent [thick] darkness and made the land dark, and they [God's two servants] rebelled not against His word.

29.verse: He turned [Egypt's] waters into blood and caused their fish to die.

30.verse: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, even in the chambers of their kings.

31.verse: He spoke, and there came swarms of beetles and flies and mosquitoes and lice in all their borders.

32.verse: He gave them hail for rain, with lightning like flaming fire in their land.

33.verse: He smote their vines also and their fig trees and broke the [ice-laden] trees of their borders.

34.verse: He spoke, and the locusts came, and the grasshoppers, and that without number,

35.verse: And ate up all the vegetation in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.

36.verse: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the beginning and chief substance of all their strength.

37.verse: He brought [Israel] forth also with silver and gold, and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

38.verse: Egypt was glad when they departed, for the fear of them had fallen upon the people.

39.verse: The Lord spread a cloud for a covering [by day], and a fire to give light in the night.

40.verse: [The Israelites] asked, and He brought quails and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

41.verse: He opened the rock, and water gushed out; it ran in the dry places like a river.

42.verse: For He [earnestly] remembered His holy word and promise to Abraham His servant.

43.verse: And He brought forth His people with joy, and His chosen ones with gladness and singing,

44.verse: And gave them the lands of the nations [of Canaan], and they reaped the fruits of those peoples' labor,

45.verse: That they might observe His statutes and keep His laws [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them]. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! (Hallelujah!) O give thanks to the Lord, for He is good; for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever!

2.verse: Who can put into words and tell the mighty deeds of the Lord? Or who can show forth all the praise [that is due Him]?

3.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) are those who observe justice [treating others fairly] and who do right and are in right standing with God at all times.

4.verse: [Earnestly] remember me, O Lord, when You favor Your people! O visit me also when You deliver them, and grant me Your salvation!--

5.verse: That I may see and share the welfare of Your chosen ones, that I may rejoice in the gladness of Your nation, that I may glory with Your heritage.

6.verse: We have sinned, as did also our fathers; we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

7.verse: Our fathers in Egypt understood not nor appreciated Your miracles; they did not [earnestly] remember the multitude of Your mercies nor imprint Your loving-kindness [on their hearts], but they were rebellious and provoked the Lord at the sea, even at the Red Sea.

8.verse: Nevertheless He saved them for His name's sake [to prove the righteousness of the divine character], that He might make His mighty power known.

9.verse: He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it dried up; so He led them through the depths as through a pastureland.

10.verse: And He saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the [Egyptian] enemy.

11.verse: And the waters covered their adversaries; not one of them was left.

12.verse: Then [Israel] believed His words [trusting in, relying on them]; they sang His praise.

13.verse: But they hastily forgot His works; they did not [earnestly] wait for His plans [to develop] regarding them,

14.verse: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness and tempted and tried to restrain God [with their insistent desires] in the desert.

15.verse: And He gave them their request, but sent leanness into their souls and [thinned their numbers by] disease and death.

16.verse: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron [the high priest], the holy one of the Lord.

17.verse: Therefore the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan and closed over the company of Abiram.

18.verse: And a fire broke out in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

19.verse: They made a calf in Horeb and worshiped a molten image.

20.verse: Thus they exchanged Him Who was their Glory for the image of an ox that eats grass [they traded their Honor for the image of a calf]!

21.verse: They forgot God their Savior, Who had done such great things in Egypt,

22.verse: Wonders and miracles in the land of Ham, dreadful and awesome things at the Red Sea.

23.verse: Therefore He said He would destroy them. [And He would have done so] had not Moses, His chosen one, stepped into the breach before Him to turn away His threatening wrath.

24.verse: Then they spurned and despised the pleasant and desirable land [Canaan]; they believed not His word [neither trusting in, relying on, nor holding to it];

25.verse: But they murmured in their tents and hearkened not to the voice of the Lord.

26.verse: Therefore He lifted up His hand [as if taking an oath] against them, that He would cause them to fall in the wilderness,

27.verse: Cast out their descendants among the nations, and scatter them in the lands [of the earth].

28.verse: They joined themselves also to the [idol] Baal of Peor and ate sacrifices [offered] to the lifeless [gods].

29.verse: Thus they provoked the Lord to anger with their practices, and a plague broke out among them.

30.verse: Then stood up Phinehas [the priest] and executed judgment, and so the plague was stayed.

31.verse: And that was credited to him for righteousness (right doing and right standing with God) to all generations forever.

32.verse: They angered the Lord also at the waters of Meribah, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes;

33.verse: For they provoked [Moses'] spirit, so that he spoke unadvisedly with his lips.

34.verse: They did not destroy the [heathen] nations as the Lord commanded them,

35.verse: But mingled themselves with the [idolatrous] nations and learned their ways and works

36.verse: And served their idols, which were a snare to them.

37.verse: Yes, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons

38.verse: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; and the land was polluted with their blood.

39.verse: Thus were they defiled by their own works, and they played the harlot and practiced idolatry with their own deeds [of idolatrous rites].

40.verse: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against His people, insomuch that He abhorred and rejected His own heritage.

41.verse: And He gave them into the hands of the [heathen] nations, and they that hated them ruled over them.

42.verse: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under the hand of their foes.

43.verse: Many times did [God] deliver them, but they were rebellious in their counsel and sank low through their iniquity.

44.verse: Nevertheless He regarded their distress when He heard their cry;

45.verse: And He [earnestly] remembered for their sake His covenant and relented their sentence of evil [comforting and easing Himself] according to the abundance of His mercy and loving-kindness [when they cried out to Him].

46.verse: He also caused [Israel] to find sympathy among those who had carried them away captive.

47.verse: Deliver us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the nations, that we may give thanks to Your holy name and glory in praising You.

48.verse: Blessed (affectionately and gratefully praised) be the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting! And let all the people say, Amen! Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: O GIVE thanks to the Lord, for He is good; for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever!

2.verse: Let the redeemed of the Lord say so, whom He has delivered from the hand of the adversary,

3.verse: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the [Red] Sea in the south.

4.verse: Some wandered in the wilderness in a solitary desert track; they found no city for habitation.

5.verse: Hungry and thirsty, they fainted; their lives were near to being extinguished.

6.verse: Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble, and He delivered them out of their distresses.

7.verse: He led them forth by the straight and right way, that they might go to a city where they could establish their homes.

8.verse: Oh, that men would praise [and confess to] the Lord for His goodness and loving-kindness and His wonderful works to the children of men!

9.verse: For He satisfies the longing soul and fills the hungry soul with good.

10.verse: Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and in irons,

11.verse: Because they had rebelled against the words of God and spurned the counsel of the Most High.

12.verse: Therefore He bowed down their hearts with hard labor; they stumbled and fell down, and there was none to help.

13.verse: Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble, and He saved them out of their distresses.

14.verse: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death and broke apart the bonds that held them.

15.verse: Oh, that men would praise [and confess to] the Lord for His goodness and loving-kindness and His wonderful works to the children of men!

16.verse: For He has broken the gates of bronze and cut the bars of iron apart.

17.verse: Some are fools [made ill] because of the way of their transgressions and are afflicted because of their iniquities.

18.verse: They loathe every kind of food, and they draw near to the gates of death.

19.verse: Then they cry to the Lord in their trouble, and He delivers them out of their distresses.

20.verse: He sends forth His word and heals them and rescues them from the pit and destruction.

21.verse: Oh, that men would praise [and confess to] the Lord for His goodness and loving-kindness and His wonderful works to the children of men!

22.verse: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving and rehearse His deeds with shouts of joy and singing!

23.verse: Some go down to the sea and travel over it in ships to do business in great waters;

24.verse: These see the works of the Lord and His wonders in the deep.

25.verse: For He commands and raises up the stormy wind, which lifts up the waves of the sea.

26.verse: [Those aboard] mount up to the heavens, they go down again to the deeps; their courage melts away because of their plight.

27.verse: They reel to and fro and stagger like a drunken man and are at their wits' end [all their wisdom has come to nothing].

28.verse: Then they cry to the Lord in their trouble, and He brings them out of their distresses.

29.verse: He hushes the storm to a calm and to a gentle whisper, so that the waves of the sea are still.

30.verse: Then the men are glad because of the calm, and He brings them to their desired haven.

31.verse: Oh, that men would praise [and confess to] the Lord for His goodness and loving-kindness and His wonderful works to the children of men!

32.verse: Let them exalt Him also in the congregation of the people and praise Him in the company of the elders.

33.verse: He turns rivers into a wilderness, water springs into a thirsty ground,

34.verse: A fruitful land into a barren, salt waste, because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it.

35.verse: He turns a wilderness into a pool of water and a dry ground into water springs;

36.verse: And there He makes the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation,

37.verse: And sow fields, and plant vineyards which yield fruits of increase.

38.verse: He blesses them also, so that they are multiplied greatly, and allows not their cattle to decrease.

39.verse: When they are diminished and bowed down through oppression, trouble, and sorrow,

40.verse: He pours contempt upon princes and causes them to wander in waste places where there is no road.

41.verse: Yet He raises the poor and needy from affliction and makes their families like a flock.

42.verse: The upright shall see it and be glad, but all iniquity shall shut its mouth.

43.verse: Whoso is wise [if there be any truly wise] will observe and heed these things; and they will diligently consider the mercy and loving-kindness of the Lord.

1.verse: O GOD, my heart is fixed (steadfast, in the confidence of faith); I will sing, yes, I will sing praises, even with my glory [all the faculties and powers of one created in Your image]!

2.verse: Awake, harp and lyre; I myself will wake very early--I will waken the dawn!

3.verse: I will praise and give thanks to You, O Lord, among the peoples; and I will sing praises unto You among the nations.

4.verse: For Your mercy and loving-kindness are great and high as the heavens! Your truth and faithfulness reach to the skies!

5.verse: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens, and let Your glory be over all the earth.

6.verse: That Your beloved [followers] may be delivered, save with Your right hand and answer us! [or me]!

7.verse: God has promised in His holiness [regarding the establishment of David's dynasty]: I will rejoice, I will distribute [Canaan among My people], dividing Shechem and [the western region and allotting the eastern region which contains] the Valley of Succoth.

8.verse: Gilead is Mine, Manasseh is Mine; Ephraim also is My stronghold and the defense of My head; Judah is My scepter and lawgiver.

9.verse: Moab is My washbasin; upon Edom [My slave] My shoe I cast [to be cleaned]; over Philistia I shout [in triumph].

10.verse: Who will bring me [David] into the strong, fortified city [of Petra]? Who will lead me into Edom?

11.verse: Have You not cast us off, O God? And will You not go forth, O God, with our armies?

12.verse: Give us help against the adversary, for vain is the help of man.

13.verse: Through and with God we shall do valiantly, for He it is Who shall tread down our adversaries.

1.verse: O GOD of my praise! Keep not silence,

2.verse: For the mouths of the wicked and the mouth of deceit are opened against me; they have spoken to me and against me with lying tongues.

3.verse: They have compassed me about also with words of hatred and have fought against me without a cause.

4.verse: In return for my love they are my adversaries, but I resort to prayer.

5.verse: And they have rewarded and laid upon me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

6.verse: Set a wicked man over him [as a judge], and let [a malicious] accuser stand at his right hand.

7.verse: When [the wicked] is judged, let him be condemned, and let his prayer [for leniency] be turned into a sin.

8.verse: Let his days be few; and let another take his office and charge.

9.verse: Let his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.

10.verse: Let his children be continual vagabonds [as was Cain] and beg; let them seek their bread and be driven far from their ruined homes.

11.verse: Let the creditor and extortioner seize all that he has; and let strangers (barbarians and foreigners) plunder the fruits of his labor.

12.verse: Let there be none to extend or continue mercy and kindness to him, neither let there be any to have pity on his fatherless children.

13.verse: Let his posterity be cut off, and in the generation following let their names be blotted out.

14.verse: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered by the Lord; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

15.verse: Let them be before the Lord continually, that He may cut off the memory of them from the earth!--

16.verse: Because the man did not [earnestly] remember to show mercy, but pursued and persecuted the poor and needy man, and the broken in heart [he was ready] to slay.

17.verse: Yes, he loved cursing, and it came [back] upon him; he delighted not in blessing, and it was far from him.

18.verse: He clothed himself also with cursing as with his garment, and it seeped into his inward [life] like water, and like oil into his bones.

19.verse: Let it be to him as the raiment with which he covers himself and as the girdle with which he is girded continually.

20.verse: Let this be the reward of my adversaries from the Lord, and of those who speak evil against my life.

21.verse: But You deal with me and act for me, O God the Lord, for Your name's sake; because Your mercy and loving-kindness are good, O deliver me.

22.verse: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded and stricken within me.

23.verse: I am gone like the shadow when it lengthens and declines; I toss up and down and am shaken off as the locust.

24.verse: My knees are weak and totter from fasting; and my body is gaunt and has no fatness.

25.verse: I have become also a reproach and a taunt to others; when they see me, they shake their heads.

26.verse: Help me, O Lord my God; O save me according to Your mercy and loving-kindness!--

27.verse: That they may know that this is Your hand, that You, Lord, have done it.

28.verse: Let them curse, but do You bless. When adversaries arise, let them be put to shame, but let Your servant rejoice.

29.verse: Let my adversaries be clothed with shame and dishonor, and let them cover themselves with their own disgrace and confusion as with a robe.

30.verse: I will give great praise and thanks to the Lord with my mouth; yes, and I will praise Him among the multitude.

31.verse: For He will stand at the right hand of the poor and needy, to save him from those who condemn his life.

1.verse: THE LORD (God) says to my Lord (the Messiah), Sit at My right hand, until I make Your adversaries Your footstool.

2.verse: The Lord will send forth from Zion the scepter of Your strength; rule, then, in the midst of Your foes.

3.verse: Your people will offer themselves willingly in the day of Your power, in the beauty of holiness and in holy array out of the womb of the morning; to You [will spring forth] Your young men, who are as the dew.

4.verse: The Lord has sworn and will not revoke or change it: You are a priest forever, after the manner and order of Melchizedek.

5.verse: The Lord at Your right hand will shatter kings in the day of His indignation.

6.verse: He will execute judgment [in overwhelming punishment] upon the nations; He will fill the valleys with the dead bodies, He will crush the [chief] heads over lands many and far extended.

7.verse: He will drink of the brook by the way; therefore will He lift up His head [triumphantly].

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! (Hallelujah!) I will praise and give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart in the council of the upright and in the congregation.

2.verse: The works of the Lord are great, sought out by all those who have delight in them.

3.verse: His work is honorable and glorious, and His righteousness endures forever.

4.verse: He has made His wonderful works to be remembered; the Lord is gracious, merciful, and full of loving compassion.

5.verse: He has given food and provision to those who reverently and worshipfully fear Him; He will remember His covenant forever and imprint it [on His mind].

6.verse: He has declared and shown to His people the power of His works in giving them the heritage of the nations [of Canaan].

7.verse: The works of His hands are [absolute] truth and justice [faithful and right]; and all His decrees and precepts are sure (fixed, established, and trustworthy).

8.verse: They stand fast and are established forever and ever and are done in [absolute] truth and uprightness.

9.verse: He has sent redemption to His people; He has commanded His covenant to be forever; holy is His name, inspiring awe, reverence, and godly fear.

10.verse: The reverent fear and worship of the Lord is the beginning of Wisdom and skill [the preceding and the first essential, the prerequisite and the alphabet]; a good understanding, wisdom, and meaning have all those who do [the will of the Lord]. Their praise of Him endures forever. [Job. 28:28; Prov. 1:7; Matt. 22:37, 38; Rev. 14:7.]

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! (Hallelujah!) Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) is the man who fears (reveres and worships) the Lord, who delights greatly in His commandments.

2.verse: His [spiritual] offspring shall be mighty upon earth; the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

3.verse: Prosperity and welfare are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.

4.verse: Light arises in the darkness for the upright, gracious, compassionate, and just [who are in right standing with God].

5.verse: It is well with the man who deals generously and lends, who conducts his affairs with justice.

6.verse: He will not be moved forever; the [uncompromisingly] righteous (the upright, in right standing with God) shall be in everlasting remembrance.

7.verse: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings; his heart is firmly fixed, trusting (leaning on and being confident) in the Lord.

8.verse: His heart is established and steady, he will not be afraid while he waits to see his desire established upon his adversaries.

9.verse: He has distributed freely [he has given to the poor and needy]; his righteousness (uprightness and right standing with God) endures forever; his horn shall be exalted in honor.

10.verse: The wicked man will see it and be grieved and angered, he will gnash his teeth and disappear [in despair]; the desire of the wicked shall perish and come to nothing.

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! (Hallelujah!) Praise, O servants of the Lord, praise the name of the Lord!

2.verse: Blessed be the name of the Lord from this time forth and forever

3.verse: From the rising of the sun to the going down of it and from east to west, the name of the Lord is to be praised!

4.verse: The Lord is high above all nations, and His glory above the heavens!

5.verse: Who is like the Lord our God, Who has His seat on high,

6.verse: Who humbles Himself to regard the heavens and the earth!

7.verse: [The Lord] raises the poor out of the dust and lifts the needy from the ash heap and the dung hill,

8.verse: That He may seat them with princes, even with the princes of His people.

9.verse: He makes the barren woman to be a homemaker and a joyful mother of [spiritual] children. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: WHEN ISRAEL came forth out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,

2.verse: Judah became [God's] sanctuary (the Holy Place of His habitation), and Israel His dominion.

3.verse: The [Red] Sea looked and fled; the Jordan [River] was turned back.

4.verse: The mountains skipped like rams, the little hills like lambs.

5.verse: What ails you, O [Red] Sea, that you flee? O Jordan, that you turn back?

6.verse: You mountains, that you skip like rams, and you little hills, like lambs?

7.verse: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,

8.verse: Who turned the rock into a pool of water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

1.verse: NOT TO us, O Lord, not to us but to Your name give glory, for Your mercy and loving-kindness and for the sake of Your truth and faithfulness!

2.verse: Why should the nations say, Where is now their God?

3.verse: But our God is in heaven; He does whatever He pleases.

4.verse: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

5.verse: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

6.verse: They have ears, but they hear not; noses have they, but they smell not;

7.verse: They have hands, but they handle not; feet have they, but they walk not; neither can they make a sound with their throats.

8.verse: They who make idols are like them; so are all who trust in and lean on them.

9.verse: O Israel, trust and take refuge in the Lord! [Lean on, rely on, and be confident in Him!] He is their Help and their Shield.

10.verse: O house of Aaron [the priesthood], trust in and lean on the Lord! He is their Help and their Shield.

11.verse: You who [reverently] fear the Lord, trust in and lean on the Lord! He is their Help and their Shield.

12.verse: The Lord has been mindful of us, He will bless us: He will bless the house of Israel, He will bless the house of Aaron [the priesthood],

13.verse: He will bless those who reverently and worshipfully fear the Lord, both small and great.

14.verse: May the Lord give you increase more and more, you and your children.
