15.verse: May you be blessed of the Lord, Who made heaven and earth!

16.verse: The heavens are the Lord's heavens, but the earth has He given to the children of men.

17.verse: The dead praise not the Lord, neither any who go down into silence.

18.verse: But we will bless (affectionately and gratefully praise) the Lord from this time forth and forever. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: I LOVE the Lord, because He has heard [and now hears] my voice and my supplications.

2.verse: Because He has inclined His ear to me, therefore will I call upon Him as long as I live.

3.verse: The cords and sorrows of death were around me, and the terrors of Sheol (the place of the dead) had laid hold of me; I suffered anguish and grief (trouble and sorrow).

4.verse: Then called I upon the name of the Lord: O Lord, I beseech You, save my life and deliver me!

5.verse: Gracious is the Lord, and [rigidly] righteous; yes, our God is merciful.

6.verse: The Lord preserves the simple; I was brought low, and He helped and saved me.

7.verse: Return to your rest, O my soul, for the Lord has dealt bountifully with you.

8.verse: For You have delivered my life from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling and falling.

9.verse: I will walk before the Lord in the land of the living.

10.verse: I believed (trusted in, relied on, and clung to my God), and therefore have I spoken [even when I said], I am greatly afflicted.

11.verse: I said in my haste, All men are deceitful and liars.

12.verse: What shall I render to the Lord for all His benefits toward me? [How can I repay Him for all His bountiful dealings?]

13.verse: I will lift up the cup of salvation and deliverance and call on the name of the Lord.

14.verse: I will pay my vows to the Lord, yes, in the presence of all His people.

15.verse: Precious (important and no light matter) in the sight of the Lord is the death of His saints (His loving ones).

16.verse: O Lord, truly I am Your servant; I am Your servant, the son of Your handmaid; You have loosed my bonds.

17.verse: I will offer to You the sacrifice of thanksgiving and will call on the name of the Lord.

18.verse: I will pay my vows to the Lord, yes, in the presence of all His people,

19.verse: In the courts of the Lord's house--in the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: O PRAISE the Lord, all you nations! Praise Him, all you people!

2.verse: For His mercy and loving-kindness are great toward us, and the truth and faithfulness of the Lord endure forever. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: O GIVE thanks to the Lord, for He is good; for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever!

2.verse: Let Israel now say that His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever.

3.verse: Let the house of Aaron [the priesthood] now say that His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever.

4.verse: Let those now who reverently and worshipfully fear the Lord say that His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever.

5.verse: Out of my distress I called upon the Lord; the Lord answered me and set me free and in a large place.

6.verse: The Lord is on my side; I will not fear. What can man do to me?

7.verse: The Lord is on my side and takes my part, He is among those who help me; therefore shall I see my desire established upon those who hate me.

8.verse: It is better to trust and take refuge in the Lord than to put confidence in man.

9.verse: It is better to trust and take refuge in the Lord than to put confidence in princes.

10.verse: All nations (the surrounding tribes) compassed me about, but in the name of the Lord I will cut them off!

11.verse: They compassed me about, yes, they surrounded me on every side; but in the name of the Lord I will cut them off!

12.verse: They swarmed about me like bees, they blaze up and are extinguished like a fire of thorns; in the name of the Lord I will cut them off!

13.verse: You [my adversary] thrust sorely at me that I might fall, but the Lord helped me.

14.verse: The Lord is my Strength and Song; and He has become my Salvation.

15.verse: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents and private dwellings of the [uncompromisingly] righteous: the right hand of the Lord does valiantly and achieves strength!

16.verse: The right hand of the Lord is exalted; the right hand of the Lord does valiantly and achieves strength!

17.verse: I shall not die but live, and shall declare the works and recount the illustrious acts of the Lord.

18.verse: The Lord has chastened me sorely, but He has not given me over to death.

19.verse: Open to me the [temple] gates of righteousness; I will enter through them, and I will confess and praise the Lord.

20.verse: This is the gate of the Lord; the [uncompromisingly] righteous shall enter through it.

21.verse: I will confess, praise, and give thanks to You, for You have heard and answered me; and You have become my Salvation and Deliverer.

22.verse: The stone which the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone.

23.verse: This is from the Lord and is His doing; it is marvelous in our eyes.

24.verse: This is the day which the Lord has brought about; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

25.verse: Save now, we beseech You, O Lord; send now prosperity, O Lord, we beseech You, and give to us success!

26.verse: Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord; we bless you from the house of the Lord [you who come into His sanctuary under His guardianship].

27.verse: The Lord is God, Who has shown and given us light [He has illuminated us with grace, freedom, and joy]. Decorate the festival with leafy boughs and bind the sacrifices to be offered with thick cords [all over the priest's court, right up] to the horns of the altar.

28.verse: You are my God, and I will confess, praise, and give thanks to You; You are my God, I will extol You.

29.verse: O give thanks to the Lord, for He is good; for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever.

1.verse: BLESSED (HAPPY, fortunate, to be envied) are the undefiled (the upright, truly sincere, and blameless) in the way [of the revealed will of God], who walk (order their conduct and conversation) in the law of the Lord (the whole of God's revealed will).

2.verse: Blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied) are they who keep His testimonies, and who seek, inquire for and of Him and crave Him with the whole heart.

3.verse: Yes, they do no unrighteousness [no willful wandering from His precepts]; they walk in His ways.

4.verse: You have commanded us to keep Your precepts, that we should observe them diligently.

5.verse: Oh, that my ways were directed and established to observe Your statutes [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them]!

6.verse: Then shall I not be put to shame [by failing to inherit Your promises] when I have respect to all Your commandments.

7.verse: I will praise and give thanks to You with uprightness of heart when I learn [by sanctified experiences] Your righteous judgments [Your decisions against and punishments for particular lines of thought and conduct].

8.verse: I will keep Your statutes; O forsake me not utterly.

9.verse: How shall a young man cleanse his way? By taking heed and keeping watch [on himself] according to Your word [conforming his life to it].

10.verse: With my whole heart have I sought You, inquiring for and of You and yearning for You; Oh, let me not wander or step aside [either in ignorance or willfully] from Your commandments.

11.verse: Your word have I laid up in my heart, that I might not sin against You.

12.verse: Blessed are You, O Lord; teach me Your statutes.

13.verse: With my lips have I declared and recounted all the ordinances of Your mouth.

14.verse: I have rejoiced in the way of Your testimonies as much as in all riches.

15.verse: I will meditate on Your precepts and have respect to Your ways [the paths of life marked out by Your law].

16.verse: I will delight myself in Your statutes; I will not forget Your word.

17.verse: Deal bountifully with Your servant, that I may live; and I will observe Your word [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying it].

18.verse: Open my eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of Your law.

19.verse: I am a stranger and a temporary resident on the earth; hide not Your commandments from me.

20.verse: My heart is breaking with the longing that it has for Your ordinances and judgments at all times.

21.verse: You rebuke the proud and arrogant, the accursed ones, who err and wander from Your commandments.

22.verse: Take away from me reproach and contempt, for I keep Your testimonies.

23.verse: Princes also sat and talked against me, but Your servant meditated on Your statutes.

24.verse: Your testimonies also are my delight and my counselors.

25.verse: My earthly life cleaves to the dust; revive and stimulate me according to Your word!

26.verse: I have declared my ways and opened my griefs to You, and You listened to me; teach me Your statutes.

27.verse: Make me understand the way of Your precepts; so shall I meditate on and talk of Your wondrous works.

28.verse: My life dissolves and weeps itself away for heaviness; raise me up and strengthen me according to [the promises of] Your word.

29.verse: Remove from me the way of falsehood and unfaithfulness [to You], and graciously impart Your law to me.

30.verse: I have chosen the way of truth and faithfulness; Your ordinances have I set before me.

31.verse: I cleave to Your testimonies; O Lord, put me not to shame!

32.verse: I will [not merely walk, but] run the way of Your commandments, when You give me a heart that is willing.

33.verse: Teach me, O Lord, the way of Your statutes, and I will keep it to the end [steadfastly].

34.verse: Give me understanding, that I may keep Your law; yes, I will observe it with my whole heart.

35.verse: Make me go in the path of Your commandments, for in them do I delight.

36.verse: Incline my heart to Your testimonies and not to covetousness (robbery, sensuality, unworthy riches).

37.verse: Turn away my eyes from beholding vanity (idols and idolatry); and restore me to vigorous life and health in Your ways.

38.verse: Establish Your word and confirm Your promise to Your servant, which is for those who reverently fear and devotedly worship You.

39.verse: Turn away my reproach which I fear and dread, for Your ordinances are good.

40.verse: Behold, I long for Your precepts; in Your righteousness give me renewed life.

41.verse: Let Your mercy and loving-kindness come also to me, O Lord, even Your salvation according to Your promise;

42.verse: Then shall I have an answer for those who taunt and reproach me, for I lean on, rely on, and trust in Your word.

43.verse: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth, for I hope in Your ordinances.

44.verse: I will keep Your law continually, forever and ever [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying it].

45.verse: And I will walk at liberty and at ease, for I have sought and inquired for [and desperately required] Your precepts.

46.verse: I will speak of Your testimonies also before kings and will not be put to shame.

47.verse: For I will delight myself in Your commandments, which I love.

48.verse: My hands also will I lift up [in fervent supplication] to Your commandments, which I love, and I will meditate on Your statutes.

49.verse: Remember [fervently] the word and promise to Your servant, in which You have caused me to hope.

50.verse: This is my comfort and consolation in my affliction: that Your word has revived me and given me life.

51.verse: The proud have had me greatly in derision, yet have I not declined in my interest in or turned aside from Your law.

52.verse: When I have [earnestly] recalled Your ordinances from of old, O Lord, I have taken comfort.

53.verse: Burning indignation, terror, and sadness seize upon me because of the wicked, who forsake Your law.

54.verse: Your statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

55.verse: I have [earnestly] remembered Your name, O Lord, in the night, and I have observed Your law.

56.verse: This I have had [as the gift of Your grace and as my reward]: that I have kept Your precepts [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them].

57.verse: You are my portion, O Lord; I have promised to keep Your words.

58.verse: I entreated Your favor with my whole heart; be merciful and gracious to me according to Your promise.

59.verse: I considered my ways; I turned my feet to [obey] Your testimonies.

60.verse: I made haste and delayed not to keep Your commandments.

61.verse: Though the cords of the wicked have enclosed and ensnared me, I have not forgotten Your law.

62.verse: At midnight I will rise to give thanks to You because of Your righteous ordinances.

63.verse: I am a companion of all those who fear, revere, and worship You, and of those who observe and give heed to Your precepts.

64.verse: The earth, O Lord, is full of Your mercy and loving-kindness; teach me Your statutes.

65.verse: You have dealt well with Your servant, O Lord, according to Your promise.

66.verse: Teach me good judgment, wise and right discernment, and knowledge, for I have believed (trusted, relied on, and clung to) Your commandments.

67.verse: Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now Your word do I keep [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying it].

68.verse: You are good and kind and do good; teach me Your statutes.

69.verse: The arrogant and godless have put together a lie against me, but I will keep Your precepts with my whole heart.

70.verse: Their hearts are as fat as grease [their minds are dull and brutal], but I delight in Your law.

71.verse: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I might learn Your statutes.

72.verse: The law from Your mouth is better to me than thousands of gold and silver pieces.

73.verse: Your hands have made me, cunningly fashioned and established me; give me understanding, that I may learn Your commandments.

74.verse: Those who reverently and worshipfully fear You will see me and be glad, because I have hoped in Your word and tarried for it.

75.verse: I know, O Lord, that Your judgments are right and righteous, and that in faithfulness You have afflicted me.

76.verse: Let, I pray You, Your merciful kindness and steadfast love be for my comfort, according to Your promise to Your servant.

77.verse: Let Your tender mercy and loving-kindness come to me that I may live, for Your law is my delight!

78.verse: Let the proud be put to shame, for they dealt perversely with me without a cause; but I will meditate on Your precepts.

79.verse: Let those who reverently and worshipfully fear You turn to me, and those who have known Your testimonies.

80.verse: Let my heart be sound (sincere and wholehearted and blameless) in Your statutes, that I may not be put to shame.

81.verse: My soul languishes and grows faint for Your salvation, but I hope in Your word.

82.verse: My eyes fail, watching for [the fulfillment of] Your promise. I say, When will You comfort me?

83.verse: For I have become like a bottle [a wineskin blackened and shriveled] in the smoke [in which it hangs], yet do I not forget Your statutes.

84.verse: How many are the days of Your servant [which he must endure]? When will You judge those who pursue and persecute me?

85.verse: The godless and arrogant have dug pitfalls for me, men who do not conform to Your law.

86.verse: All Your commandments are faithful and sure. [The godless] pursue and persecute me with falsehood; help me [Lord]!

87.verse: They had almost consumed me upon earth, but I forsook not Your precepts.

88.verse: According to Your steadfast love give life to me; then I will keep the testimony of Your mouth [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying it].

89.verse: Forever, O Lord, Your word is settled in heaven [stands firm as the heavens].

90.verse: Your faithfulness is from generation to generation; You have established the earth, and it stands fast.

91.verse: All [the whole universe] are Your servants; therefore they continue this day according to Your ordinances.

92.verse: Unless Your law had been my delight, I would have perished in my affliction.

93.verse: I will never forget Your precepts, [how can I?] for it is by them You have quickened me (granted me life).

94.verse: I am Yours, therefore save me [Your own]; for I have sought (inquired of and for) Your precepts and required them [as my urgent need].

95.verse: The wicked wait for me to destroy me, but I will consider Your testimonies.

96.verse: I have seen that everything [human] has its limits and end [no matter how extensive, noble, and excellent]; but Your commandment is exceedingly broad and extends without limits [into eternity].

97.verse: Oh, how love I Your law! It is my meditation all the day.

98.verse: You, through Your commandments, make me wiser than my enemies, for [Your words] are ever before me.

99.verse: I have better understanding and deeper insight than all my teachers, because Your testimonies are my meditation.

100.verse: I understand more than the aged, because I keep Your precepts [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them].

101.verse: I have restrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep Your word [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying it].

102.verse: I have not turned aside from Your ordinances, for You Yourself have taught me.

103.verse: How sweet are Your words to my taste, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

104.verse: Through Your precepts I get understanding; therefore I hate every false way.

105.verse: Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.

106.verse: I have sworn [an oath] and have confirmed it, that I will keep Your righteous ordinances [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them].

107.verse: I am sorely afflicted; renew and quicken me [give me life], O Lord, according to Your word!

108.verse: Accept, I beseech You, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Lord, and teach me Your ordinances.

109.verse: My life is continually in my hand, yet I do not forget Your law.

110.verse: The wicked have laid a snare for me, yet I do not stray from Your precepts.

111.verse: Your testimonies have I taken as a heritage forever, for they are the rejoicing of my heart.

112.verse: I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes forever, even to the end.

113.verse: I hate the thoughts of undecided [in religion], double-minded people, but Your law do I love.

114.verse: You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in Your word.

115.verse: Depart from me, you evildoers, that I may keep the commandments of my God [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them].

116.verse: Uphold me according to Your promise, that I may live; and let me not be put to shame in my hope!

117.verse: Hold me up, that I may be safe and have regard for Your statutes continually!

118.verse: You spurn and set at nought all those who stray from Your statutes, for their own lying deceives them and their tricks are in vain.

119.verse: You put away and count as dross all the wicked of the earth [for there is no true metal in them]; therefore I love Your testimonies.

120.verse: My flesh trembles and shudders for fear and reverential, worshipful awe of You, and I am afraid and in dread of Your judgments.

121.verse: I have done justice and righteousness; leave me not to those who would oppress me.

122.verse: Be surety for Your servant for good [as Judah was surety for the safety of Benjamin]; let not the proud oppress me.

123.verse: My eyes fail, watching for Your salvation and for the fulfillment of Your righteous promise.

124.verse: Deal with Your servant according to Your mercy and loving-kindness, and teach me Your statutes.

125.verse: I am Your servant; give me understanding (discernment and comprehension), that I may know (discern and be familiar with the character of) Your testimonies.

126.verse: It is time for the Lord to act; they have frustrated Your law.

127.verse: Therefore I love Your commandments more than [resplendent] gold, yes, more than [perfectly] refined gold.

128.verse: Therefore I esteem as right all, yes, all Your precepts; I hate every false way.

129.verse: Your testimonies are wonderful [far exceeding anything conceived by man]; therefore my [penitent] self keeps them [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them].

130.verse: The entrance and unfolding of Your words give light; their unfolding gives understanding (discernment and comprehension) to the simple.

131.verse: I opened my mouth and panted [with eager desire], for I longed for Your commandments.

132.verse: Look upon me, be merciful unto me, and show me favor, as is Your way to those who love Your name.

133.verse: Establish my steps and direct them by [means of] Your word; let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

134.verse: Deliver me from the oppression of man; so will I keep Your precepts [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them].

135.verse: Make Your face shine [with pleasure] upon Your servant, and teach me Your statutes.

136.verse: Streams of water run down my eyes, because men do not keep Your law [they hear it not, nor receive it, love it, or obey it].

137.verse: [Rigidly] righteous are You, O Lord, and upright are Your judgments and all expressions of Your will.

138.verse: You have commanded and appointed Your testimonies in righteousness and in great faithfulness.

139.verse: My zeal has consumed me and cut me off, because my adversaries have forgotten Your words.

140.verse: Your word is very pure (tried and well refined); therefore Your servant loves it.

141.verse: I am small (insignificant) and despised, but I do not forget Your precepts.

142.verse: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and Your law is truth.

143.verse: Trouble and anguish have found and taken hold on me, yet Your commandments are my delight.

144.verse: Your righteous testimonies are everlasting and Your decrees are binding to eternity; give me understanding and I shall live [give me discernment and comprehension and I shall not die].

145.verse: I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O Lord; I will keep Your statutes [I will hear, receive, love, and obey them].

146.verse: I cried to You; save me, that I may keep Your testimonies [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them].

147.verse: I anticipated the dawning of the morning and cried [in childlike prayer]; I hoped in Your word.

148.verse: My eyes anticipate the night watches and I am awake before the cry of the watchman, that I may meditate on Your word.

149.verse: Hear my voice according to Your steadfast love; O Lord, quicken me and give me life according to Your [righteous] decrees.

150.verse: They draw near who follow after wrong thinking and persecute me with wickedness; they are far from Your law.

151.verse: You are near, O Lord [nearer to me than my foes], and all Your commandments are truth.

152.verse: Of old have I known Your testimonies, and for a long time, [therefore it is a thoroughly established conviction] that You have founded them forever.

153.verse: Consider my affliction and deliver me, for I do not forget Your law.

154.verse: Plead my cause and redeem me; revive me and give me life according to Your word.

155.verse: Salvation is far from the wicked, for they seek not nor hunger for Your statutes.

156.verse: Great are Your tender mercy and loving-kindness, O Lord; give me life according to Your ordinances.

157.verse: Many are my persecutors and my adversaries, yet I do not swerve from Your testimonies.

158.verse: I behold the treacherous and am grieved and loathe them, because they do not respect Your law [neither hearing, receiving, loving, nor obeying it].

159.verse: Consider how I love Your precepts; revive me and give life to me, O Lord, according to Your loving-kindness!

160.verse: The sum of Your word is truth [the total of the full meaning of all Your individual precepts]; and every one of Your righteous decrees endures forever.

161.verse: Princes pursue and persecute me without cause, but my heart stands in awe of Your words [dreading violation of them far more than the force of prince or potentate].

162.verse: I rejoice at Your word as one who finds great spoil.

163.verse: I hate and abhor falsehood, but Your law do I love.

164.verse: Seven times a day and all day long do I praise You because of Your righteous decrees.

165.verse: Great peace have they who love Your law; nothing shall offend them or make them stumble.

166.verse: I am hoping and waiting [eagerly] for Your salvation, O Lord, and I do Your commandments.

167.verse: Your testimonies have I kept [hearing, receiving, loving, and obeying them]; I love them exceedingly!

168.verse: I have observed Your precepts and Your testimonies, for all my ways are [fully known] before You.

169.verse: Let my mournful cry and supplication come [near] before You, O Lord; give me understanding (discernment and comprehension) according to Your word [of assurance and promise].

170.verse: Let my supplication come before You; deliver me according to Your word!

171.verse: My lips shall pour forth praise [with thanksgiving and renewed trust] when You teach me Your statutes.

172.verse: My tongue shall sing [praise for the fulfillment] of Your word, for all Your commandments are righteous.

173.verse: Let Your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen Your precepts.

174.verse: I have longed for Your salvation, O Lord, and Your law is my delight.

175.verse: Let me live that I may praise You, and let Your decrees help me.

176.verse: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek, inquire for, and demand Your servant, for I do not forget Your commandments.

1.verse: IN MY distress I cried to the Lord, and He answered me.

2.verse: Deliver me, O Lord, from lying lips and from deceitful tongues.

3.verse: What shall be given to you? Or what more shall be done to you, you deceitful tongue?--

4.verse: Sharp arrows of a [mighty] warrior, with [glowing] coals of the broom tree!

5.verse: Woe is me that I sojourn with Meshech, that I dwell beside the tents of Kedar [as if among notoriously barbarous people]!

6.verse: My life has too long had its dwelling with him who hates peace.

7.verse: I am for peace; but when I speak, they are for war.

1.verse: I WILL lift up my eyes to the hills [around Jerusalem, to sacred Mount Zion and Mount Moriah]--From whence shall my help come?

2.verse: My help comes from the Lord, Who made heaven and earth.

3.verse: He will not allow your foot to slip or to be moved; He Who keeps you will not slumber.

4.verse: Behold, He who keeps Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.

5.verse: The Lord is your keeper; the Lord is your shade on your right hand [the side not carrying a shield].

6.verse: The sun shall not smite you by day, nor the moon by night.

7.verse: The Lord will keep you from all evil; He will keep your life.

8.verse: The Lord will keep your going out and your coming in from this time forth and forevermore.

1.verse: I WAS glad when they said to me, Let us go to the house of the Lord!

2.verse: Our feet are standing within your gates, O Jerusalem!--

3.verse: Jerusalem, which is built as a city that is compacted together--

4.verse: To which the tribes go up, even the tribes of the Lord, as was decreed and as a testimony for Israel, to give thanks to the name of the Lord.

5.verse: For there the thrones of judgment were set, the thrones of the house of David.

6.verse: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem! May they prosper who love you [the Holy City]!

7.verse: May peace be within your walls and prosperity within your palaces!

8.verse: For my brethren and companions' sake, I will now say, Peace be within you!

9.verse: For the sake of the house of the Lord our God, I will seek, inquire for, and require your good.

1.verse: UNTO YOU do I lift up my eyes, O You Who are enthroned in heaven.

2.verse: Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master, and as the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes look to the Lord our God, until He has mercy and loving-kindness for us.

3.verse: Have mercy on us, O Lord, have mercy on and loving-kindness for us, for we are exceedingly satiated with contempt.

4.verse: Our life is exceedingly filled with the scorning and scoffing of those who are at ease and with the contempt of the proud (irresponsible tyrants who disregard God's law).

1.verse: IF IT had not been the Lord Who was on our side--now may Israel say--

2.verse: If it had not been the Lord Who was on our side when men rose up against us,

3.verse: Then they would have quickly swallowed us up alive when their wrath was kindled against us;

4.verse: Then the waters would have overwhelmed us and swept us away, the torrent would have gone over us;

5.verse: Then the proud waters would have gone over us.

6.verse: Blessed be the Lord, Who has not given us as prey to their teeth!

7.verse: We are like a bird escaped from the snare of the fowlers; the snare is broken, and we have escaped!

8.verse: Our help is in the name of the Lord, Who made heaven and earth.

1.verse: THOSE WHO trust in, lean on, and confidently hope in the Lord are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved but abides and stands fast forever.

2.verse: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the Lord is round about His people from this time forth and forever.

3.verse: For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest upon the land of the [uncompromisingly] righteous, lest the righteous (God's people) stretch forth their hands to iniquity and apostasy.

4.verse: Do good, O Lord, to those who are good, and to those who are right [with You and all people] in their hearts.

5.verse: As for such as turn aside to their crooked ways [of indifference to God], the Lord will lead them forth with the workers of iniquity. Peace be upon Israel!

1.verse: WHEN THE Lord brought back the captives [who returned] to Zion, we were like those who dream [it seemed so unreal].

2.verse: Then were our mouths filled with laughter, and our tongues with singing. Then they said among the nations, The Lord has done great things for them.

3.verse: The Lord has done great things for us! We are glad!

4.verse: Turn to freedom our captivity and restore our fortunes, O Lord, as the streams in the South (the Negeb) [are restored by the torrents].

5.verse: They who sow in tears shall reap in joy and singing.

6.verse: He who goes forth bearing seed and weeping [at needing his precious supply of grain for sowing] shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.

1.verse: EXCEPT THE Lord builds the house, they labor in vain who build it; except the Lord keeps the city, the watchman wakes but in vain.

2.verse: It is vain for you to rise up early, to take rest late, to eat the bread of [anxious] toil--for He gives [blessings] to His beloved in sleep.

3.verse: Behold, children are a heritage from the Lord, the fruit of the womb a reward.

4.verse: As arrows are in the hand of a warrior, so are the children of one's youth.

5.verse: Happy, blessed, and fortunate is the man whose quiver is filled with them! They will not be put to shame when they speak with their adversaries [in gatherings] at the [city's] gate.

1.verse: BLESSED (HAPPY, fortunate, to be envied) is everyone who fears, reveres, and worships the Lord, who walks in His ways and lives according to His commandments.

2.verse: For you shall eat [the fruit] of the labor of your hands; happy (blessed, fortunate, enviable) shall you be, and it shall be well with you.

3.verse: Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine in the innermost parts of your house; your children shall be like olive plants round about your table.

4.verse: Behold, thus shall the man be blessed who reverently and worshipfully fears the Lord.

5.verse: May the Lord bless you out of Zion [His sanctuary], and may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life;

6.verse: Yes, may you see your children's children. Peace be upon Israel!

1.verse: MANY A time and much have they afflicted me from my youth up--let Israel now say--

2.verse: Many a time and much have they afflicted me from my youth up, yet they have not prevailed against me.

3.verse: The plowers plowed upon my back; they made long their furrows.

4.verse: The Lord is [uncompromisingly] righteous; He has cut asunder the thick cords by which the wicked [enslaved us].

5.verse: Let them all be put to shame and turned backward who hate Zion.

6.verse: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withers before it grows up,

7.verse: With which the mower fills not his hand, nor the binder of sheaves his bosom--

8.verse: While those who go by do not say, The blessing of the Lord be upon you! We bless you in the name of the Lord!

1.verse: OUT OF the depths have I cried to You, O Lord.

2.verse: Lord, hear my voice; let Your ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

3.verse: If You, Lord, should keep account of and treat [us according to our] sins, O Lord, who could stand?

4.verse: But there is forgiveness with You [just what man needs], that You may be reverently feared and worshiped.

5.verse: I wait for the Lord, I expectantly wait, and in His word do I hope.

6.verse: I am looking and waiting for the Lord more than watchmen for the morning, I say, more than watchmen for the morning.

7.verse: O Israel, hope in the Lord! For with the Lord there is mercy and loving-kindness, and with Him is plenteous redemption.

8.verse: And He will redeem Israel from all their iniquities.

1.verse: LORD, MY heart is not haughty, nor my eyes lofty; neither do I exercise myself in matters too great or in things too wonderful for me.

2.verse: Surely I have calmed and quieted my soul; like a weaned child with his mother, like a weaned child is my soul within me [ceased from fretting].

3.verse: O Israel, hope in the Lord from this time forth and forever.

1.verse: LORD, [earnestly] remember to David's credit all his humiliations and hardships and endurance--

2.verse: How he swore to the Lord and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

3.verse: Surely I will not enter my dwelling house or get into my bed--

4.verse: I will not permit my eyes to sleep or my eyelids to slumber,

5.verse: Until I have found a place for the Lord, a habitation for the Mighty One of Jacob.

6.verse: Behold, at Ephratah we [first] heard of [the discovered ark]; we found it in the fields of the wood [at Kiriath-jearim].

7.verse: Let us go into His tabernacle; let us worship at His footstool.

8.verse: Arise, O Lord, to Your resting-place, You and the ark [the symbol] of Your strength.

9.verse: Let Your priests be clothed with righteousness (right living and right standing with God); and let Your saints shout for joy!

10.verse: For Your servant David's sake, turn not away the face of Your anointed and reject not Your own king.

11.verse: The Lord swore to David in truth; He will not turn back from it: One of the fruit of your body I will set upon your throne.

12.verse: If your children will keep My covenant and My testimony that I shall teach them, their children also shall sit upon your throne forever.

13.verse: For the Lord has chosen Zion, He has desired it for His habitation:

14.verse: This is My resting-place forever [says the Lord]; here will I dwell, for I have desired it.

15.verse: I will surely and abundantly bless her provision; I will satisfy her poor with bread.

16.verse: Her priests also will I clothe with salvation, and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

17.verse: There will I make a horn spring forth and bud for David; I have ordained and prepared a lamp for My anointed [fulfilling the promises of old].

18.verse: His enemies will I clothe with shame, but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

1.verse: BEHOLD, HOW good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

2.verse: It is like the precious ointment poured on the head, that ran down on the beard, even the beard of Aaron [the first high priest], that came down upon the collar and skirts of his garments [consecrating the whole body].

3.verse: It is like the dew of [lofty] Mount Hermon and the dew that comes on the hills of Zion; for there the Lord has commanded the blessing, even life forevermore [upon the high and the lowly].

1.verse: BEHOLD, BLESS (affectionately and gratefully praise) the Lord, all you servants of the Lord, [singers] who by night stand in the house of the Lord.

2.verse: Lift up your hands in holiness and to the sanctuary and bless the Lord [affectionately and gratefully praise Him]!

3.verse: The Lord bless you out of Zion, even He Who made heaven and earth.

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! (Hallelujah!) Praise the name of the Lord; praise Him, O you servants of the Lord!

2.verse: You who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God,

3.verse: Praise the Lord! For the Lord is good; sing praises to His name, for He is gracious and lovely!

4.verse: For the Lord has chosen [the descendants of] Jacob for Himself, Israel for His peculiar possession and treasure.

5.verse: For I know that the Lord is great and that our Lord is above all gods.

6.verse: Whatever the Lord pleases, that has He done in the heavens and on earth, in the seas and all deeps--

7.verse: Who causes the vapors to arise from the ends of the earth, Who makes lightnings for the rain, Who brings the wind out of His storehouses;

8.verse: Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast;

9.verse: Who sent signs and wonders into the midst of you, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh and all his servants;

10.verse: Who smote nations many and great and slew mighty kings--

11.verse: Sihon king of the Amorites, Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan.

12.verse: [The Lord] gave their land as a heritage, a heritage to Israel His people.

13.verse: Your name, O Lord, endures forever, Your fame, O Lord, throughout all ages.

14.verse: For the Lord will judge and vindicate His people, and He will delay His judgments [manifesting His righteousness and mercy] and take into favor His servants [those who meet His terms of separation unto Him].

15.verse: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

16.verse: [Idols] have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

17.verse: They have ears, but they hear not, nor is there any breath in their mouths.

18.verse: Those who make [idols] are like them; so is everyone who trusts in and relies on them.

19.verse: Bless (affectionately and gratefully praise) the Lord, O house of Israel; bless the Lord, O house of Aaron [God's ministers].

20.verse: Bless the Lord, O house of Levi [the dedicated tribe]; you who reverently and worshipfully fear the Lord, bless the Lord [affectionately and gratefully praise Him]!

21.verse: Blessed out of Zion be the Lord, Who dwells [with us] at Jerusalem! Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: O GIVE thanks to the Lord, for He is good; for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever.

2.verse: O give thanks to the God of gods, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever.

3.verse: O give thanks to the Lord of lords, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever--

4.verse: To Him Who alone does great wonders, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

5.verse: To Him Who by wisdom and understanding made the heavens, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

6.verse: To Him Who stretched out the earth upon the waters, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

7.verse: To Him Who made the great lights, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever--

8.verse: The sun to rule over the day, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

9.verse: The moon and stars to rule by night, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

10.verse: To Him Who smote Egypt in their firstborn, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

11.verse: And brought out Israel from among them, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

12.verse: With a strong hand and with an outstretched arm, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

13.verse: To Him Who divided the Red Sea into parts, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

14.verse: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

15.verse: But shook off and overthrew Pharaoh and his host into the Red Sea, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

16.verse: To Him Who led His people through the wilderness, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

17.verse: To Him Who smote great kings, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

18.verse: And slew famous kings, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever--

19.verse: Sihon king of the Amorites, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

20.verse: And Og king of Bashan, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

21.verse: And gave their land as a heritage, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

22.verse: Even a heritage to Israel His servant, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

23.verse: To Him Who [earnestly] remembered us in our low estate and imprinted us [on His heart], for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

24.verse: And rescued us from our enemies, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

25.verse: To Him Who gives food to all flesh, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever;

26.verse: O give thanks to the God of heaven, for His mercy and loving-kindness endure forever!

1.verse: BY THE rivers of Babylon, there we [captives] sat down, yes, we wept when we [earnestly] remembered Zion [the city of our God imprinted on our hearts].

2.verse: On the willow trees in the midst of [Babylon] we hung our harps.

3.verse: For there they who led us captive required of us a song with words, and our tormentors and they who wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

4.verse: How shall we sing the Lord's song in a strange land?

5.verse: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill [with the harp].

6.verse: Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth if I remember you not, if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy!

7.verse: Remember, O Lord, against the Edomites, that they said in the day of Jerusalem's fall, Down, down to the ground with her!

8.verse: O Daughter of Babylon [you devastator, you!], who [ought to be and] shall be destroyed, happy and blessed shall he be who requites you as you have served us.

9.verse: Happy and blessed shall he be who takes and dashes your little ones against the rock!

1.verse: I WILL confess and praise You [O God] with my whole heart; before the gods will I sing praises to You.

2.verse: I will worship toward Your holy temple and praise Your name for Your loving-kindness and for Your truth and faithfulness; for You have exalted above all else Your name and Your word and You have magnified Your word above all Your name!

3.verse: In the day when I called, You answered me; and You strengthened me with strength (might and inflexibility to temptation) in my inner self.

4.verse: All the kings of the land shall give You credit and praise You, O Lord, for they have heard of the promises of Your mouth [which were fulfilled].

5.verse: Yes, they shall sing of the ways of the Lord and joyfully celebrate His mighty acts, for great is the glory of the Lord.

6.verse: For though the Lord is high, yet has He respect to the lowly [bringing them into fellowship with Him]; but the proud and haughty He knows and recognizes [only] at a distance.

7.verse: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You will revive me; You will stretch forth Your hand against the wrath of my enemies, and Your right hand will save me.

8.verse: The Lord will perfect that which concerns me; Your mercy and loving-kindness, O Lord, endure forever--forsake not the works of Your own hands.

1.verse: O LORD, you have searched me [thoroughly] and have known me.

2.verse: You know my downsitting and my uprising; You understand my thought afar off.

3.verse: You sift and search out my path and my lying down, and You are acquainted with all my ways.

4.verse: For there is not a word in my tongue [still unuttered], but, behold, O Lord, You know it altogether.

5.verse: You have beset me and shut me in--behind and before, and You have laid Your hand upon me.

6.verse: Your [infinite] knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high above me, I cannot reach it.

7.verse: Where could I go from Your Spirit? Or where could I flee from Your presence?

8.verse: If I ascend up into heaven, You are there; if I make my bed in Sheol (the place of the dead), behold, You are there.

9.verse: If I take the wings of the morning or dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,

10.verse: Even there shall Your hand lead me, and Your right hand shall hold me.

11.verse: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me and the night shall be [the only] light about me,

12.verse: Even the darkness hides nothing from You, but the night shines as the day; the darkness and the light are both alike to You.

13.verse: For You did form my inward parts; You did knit me together in my mother's womb.

14.verse: I will confess and praise You for You are fearful and wonderful and for the awful wonder of my birth! Wonderful are Your works, and that my inner self knows right well.

15.verse: My frame was not hidden from You when I was being formed in secret [and] intricately and curiously wrought [as if embroidered with various colors] in the depths of the earth [a region of darkness and mystery].

16.verse: Your eyes saw my unformed substance, and in Your book all the days [of my life] were written before ever they took shape, when as yet there was none of them.

17.verse: How precious and weighty also are Your thoughts to me, O God! How vast is the sum of them!

18.verse: If I could count them, they would be more in number than the sand. When I awoke, [could I count to the end] I would still be with You.

19.verse: If You would [only] slay the wicked, O God, and the men of blood depart from me--

20.verse: Who speak against You wickedly, Your enemies who take Your name in vain!

21.verse: Do I not hate them, O Lord, who hate You? And am I not grieved and do I not loathe those who rise up against You?

22.verse: I hate them with perfect hatred; they have become my enemies.

23.verse: Search me [thoroughly], O God, and know my heart! Try me and know my thoughts!

24.verse: And see if there is any wicked or hurtful way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

1.verse: DELIVER ME, O Lord, from evil men; preserve me from violent men;

2.verse: They devise mischiefs in their heart; continually they gather together and stir up wars.

3.verse: They sharpen their tongues like a serpent's; adders' poison is under their lips. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

4.verse: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent men who have purposed to thrust aside my steps.

5.verse: The proud have hidden a snare for me; they have spread cords as a net by the wayside, they have set traps for me. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

6.verse: I said to the Lord, You are my God; give ear to the voice of my supplications, O Lord.

7.verse: O God the Lord, the Strength of my salvation, You have covered my head in the day of battle.

8.verse: Grant not, O Lord, the desires of the wicked; further not their wicked plot and device, lest they exalt themselves. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

9.verse: Those who are fencing me in raise their heads; may the mischief of their own lips and the very things they desire for me come upon them.

10.verse: Let burning coals fall upon them; let them be cast into the fire, into floods of water or deep water pits, from which they shall not rise.

11.verse: Let not a man of slanderous tongue be established in the earth; let evil hunt the violent man to overthrow him [let calamity follow his evildoings].

12.verse: I know and rest in confidence upon it that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and will secure justice for the poor and needy [of His believing children].

13.verse: Surely the [uncompromisingly] righteous shall give thanks to Your name; the upright shall dwell in Your presence (before Your very face).

1.verse: LORD, I call upon You; hasten to me. Give ear to my voice when I cry to You.

2.verse: Let my prayer be set forth as incense before You, the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

3.verse: Set a guard, O Lord, before my mouth; keep watch at the door of my lips.

4.verse: Incline my heart not to submit or consent to any evil thing or to be occupied in deeds of wickedness with men who work iniquity; and let me not eat of their dainties.

5.verse: Let the righteous man smite and correct me--it is a kindness. Oil so choice let not my head refuse or discourage; for even in their evils or calamities shall my prayer continue.

6.verse: When their rulers are overthrown in stony places, [their followers] shall hear my words, that they are sweet (pleasant, mild, and just).

7.verse: The unburied bones [of slaughtered rulers] shall lie scattered at the mouth of Sheol, [as unregarded] as the lumps of soil behind the plowman when he breaks open the ground.

8.verse: But my eyes are toward You, O God the Lord; in You do I trust and take refuge; pour not out my life nor leave it destitute and bare.

9.verse: Keep me from the trap which they have laid for me, and the snares of evildoers.

10.verse: Let the wicked fall together into their own nets, while I pass over them and escape.

1.verse: I CRY to the Lord with my voice; with my voice to the Lord do I make supplication.

2.verse: I pour out my complaint before Him; I tell before Him my trouble.

3.verse: When my spirit was overwhelmed and fainted [throwing all its weight] upon me, then You knew my path. In the way where I walk they have hidden a snare for me.

4.verse: Look on the right hand [the point of attack] and see; for there is no man who knows me [to appear for me]. Refuge has failed me and I have no way to flee; no man cares for my life or my welfare.

5.verse: I cried to You, O Lord; I said, You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.

6.verse: Attend to my loud cry, for I am brought very low; deliver me from my persecutors, for they are stronger than I.

7.verse: Bring my life out of prison, that I may confess, praise, and give thanks to Your name; the righteous will surround me and crown themselves because of me, for You will deal bountifully with me.

1.verse: HEAR MY prayer, O Lord, give ear to my supplications! In Your faithfulness answer me, and in Your righteousness.

2.verse: And enter not into judgment with Your servant, for in Your sight no man living is [in himself] righteous or justified.

3.verse: For the enemy has pursued and persecuted my soul, he has crushed my life down to the ground; he has made me to dwell in dark places as those who have been long dead.

4.verse: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed and faints within me [wrapped in gloom]; my heart within my bosom grows numb.

5.verse: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all Your doings; I ponder the work of Your hands.

6.verse: I spread forth my hands to You; my soul thirsts after You like a thirsty land [for water]. Selah [pause, and calmly think of that]!

7.verse: Answer me speedily, O Lord, for my spirit fails; hide not Your face from me, lest I become like those who go down into the pit (the grave).

8.verse: Cause me to hear Your loving-kindness in the morning, for on You do I lean and in You do I trust. Cause me to know the way wherein I should walk, for I lift up my inner self to You.

9.verse: Deliver me, O Lord, from my enemies; I flee to You to hide me.

10.verse: Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God; let Your good Spirit lead me into a level country and into the land of uprightness.

11.verse: Save my life, O Lord, for Your name's sake; in Your righteousness, bring my life out of trouble and free me from distress.

12.verse: And in your mercy and loving-kindness, cut off my enemies and destroy all those who afflict my inner self, for I am Your servant.

1.verse: BLESSED BE the Lord, my Rock and my keen and firm Strength, Who teaches my hands to war and my fingers to fight--

2.verse: My Steadfast Love and my Fortress, my High Tower and my Deliverer, my Shield and He in Whom I trust and take refuge, Who subdues my people under me.

3.verse: Lord, what is man that You take notice of him? Or [the] son of man that You take account of him?

4.verse: Man is like vanity and a breath; his days are as a shadow that passes away.

5.verse: Bow Your heavens, O Lord, and come down; touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

6.verse: Cast forth lightning and scatter [my enemies]; send out Your arrows and embarrass and frustrate them.

7.verse: Stretch forth Your hand from above; rescue me and deliver me out of great waters, from the hands of hostile aliens (tribes around us)

8.verse: Whose mouths speak deceit and whose right hands are right hands [raised in taking] fraudulent oaths.

9.verse: I will sing a new song to You, O God; upon a harp, an instrument of ten strings, will I offer praises to You.

10.verse: You are He Who gives salvation to kings, Who rescues David His servant from the hurtful sword [of evil].

11.verse: Rescue me and deliver me out of the power of [hostile] alien [tribes] whose mouths speak deceit and whose right hands are right hands [raised in taking] fraudulent oaths.

12.verse: When our sons shall be as plants grown large in their youth and our daughters as sculptured corner pillars hewn like those of a palace;

13.verse: When our garners are full, affording all manner of store, and our sheep bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our pastures;

14.verse: When our oxen are well loaded; when there is no invasion [of hostile armies] and no going forth [against besiegers--when there is no murder or manslaughter] and no outcry in our streets;

15.verse: Happy and blessed are the people who are in such a case; yes, happy (blessed, fortunate, prosperous, to be envied) are the people whose God is the Lord!

1.verse: I WILL extol You, my God, O King; and I will bless Your name forever and ever [with grateful, affectionate praise].

2.verse: Every day [with its new reasons] will I bless You [affectionately and gratefully praise You]; yes, I will praise Your name forever and ever.

3.verse: Great is the Lord and highly to be praised; and His greatness is [so vast and deep as to be] unsearchable.

4.verse: One generation shall laud Your works to another and shall declare Your mighty acts.

5.verse: On the glorious splendor of Your majesty and on Your wondrous works I will meditate.

6.verse: Men shall speak of the might of Your tremendous and terrible acts, and I will declare Your greatness.

7.verse: They shall pour forth [like a fountain] the fame of Your great and abundant goodness and shall sing aloud of Your rightness and justice.

8.verse: The Lord is gracious and full of compassion, slow to anger and abounding in mercy and loving-kindness.

9.verse: The Lord is good to all, and His tender mercies are over all His works [the entirety of things created].

10.verse: All Your works shall praise You, O Lord, and Your loving ones shall bless You [affectionately and gratefully shall Your saints confess and praise You]!

11.verse: They shall speak of the glory of Your kingdom and talk of Your power,

12.verse: To make known to the sons of men God's mighty deeds and the glorious majesty of His kingdom.

13.verse: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and Your dominion endures throughout all generations.

14.verse: The Lord upholds all those [of His own] who are falling and raises up all those who are bowed down.

15.verse: The eyes of all wait for You [looking, watching, and expecting] and You give them their food in due season.

16.verse: You open Your hand and satisfy every living thing with favor.

17.verse: The Lord is [rigidly] righteous in all His ways and gracious and merciful in all His works.

18.verse: The Lord is near to all who call upon Him, to all who call upon Him sincerely and in truth.

19.verse: He will fulfill the desires of those who reverently and worshipfully fear Him; He also will hear their cry and will save them.

20.verse: The Lord preserves all those who love Him, but all the wicked will He destroy.

21.verse: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord; and let all flesh bless (affectionately and gratefully praise) His holy name forever and ever.

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! (Hallelujah!) Praise the Lord, O my soul!

2.verse: While I live will I praise the Lord; I will sing praises to my God while I have any being.

3.verse: Put not your trust in princes, in a son of man, in whom there is no help.

4.verse: When his breath leaves him, he returns to his earth; in that very day his [previous] thoughts, plans, and purposes perish.

5.verse: Happy (blessed, fortunate, enviable) is he who has the God of [special revelation to] Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the Lord his God,

6.verse: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, Who keeps truth and is faithful forever,

7.verse: Who executes justice for the oppressed, Who gives food to the hungry. The Lord sets free the prisoners,

8.verse: The Lord opens the eyes of the blind, the Lord lifts up those who are bowed down, the Lord loves the [uncompromisingly] righteous (those upright in heart and in right standing with Him).

9.verse: The Lord protects and preserves the strangers and temporary residents, He upholds the fatherless and the widow and sets them upright, but the way of the wicked He makes crooked (turns upside down and brings to ruin).

10.verse: The Lord shall reign forever, even Your God, O Zion, from generation to generation. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! For it is good to sing praises to our God, for He is gracious and lovely; praise is becoming and appropriate.

2.verse: The Lord is building up Jerusalem; He is gathering together the exiles of Israel.

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds [curing their pains and their sorrows].

4.verse: He determines and counts the number of the stars; He calls them all by their names.

5.verse: Great is our Lord and of great power; His understanding is inexhaustible and boundless.

6.verse: The Lord lifts up the humble and downtrodden; He casts the wicked down to the ground.

7.verse: Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving; sing praises with the harp or the lyre to our God!--

8.verse: Who covers the heavens with clouds, Who prepares rain for the earth, Who makes grass to grow on the mountains.

9.verse: He gives to the beast his food, and to the young ravens that for which they cry.

10.verse: He delights not in the strength of the horse, nor does He take pleasure in the legs of a man.

11.verse: The Lord takes pleasure in those who reverently and worshipfully fear Him, in those who hope in His mercy and loving-kindness.

12.verse: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!

13.verse: For He has strengthened and made hard the bars of your gates, and He has blessed your children within you.

14.verse: He makes peace in your borders; He fills you with the finest of the wheat.

15.verse: He sends forth His commandment to the earth; His word runs very swiftly.

16.verse: He gives [to the earth] snow like [a blanket of] wool; He scatters the hoarfrost like ashes.

17.verse: He casts forth His ice like crumbs; who can stand before His cold?

18.verse: He sends out His word, and melts [ice and snow]; He causes His wind to blow, and the waters flow.

19.verse: He declares His word to Jacob, His statutes and His ordinances to Israel.

20.verse: He has not dealt so with any [other] nation; they have not known (understood, appreciated, given heed to, and cherished) His ordinances. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! Praise the Lord from the heavens, praise Him in the heights!

2.verse: Praise Him, all His angels, praise Him, all His hosts!

3.verse: Praise Him, sun and moon, praise Him, all you stars of light!

4.verse: Praise Him, you highest heavens and you waters above the heavens!

5.verse: Let them praise the name of the Lord, for He commanded and they were created.

6.verse: He also established them forever and ever; He made a decree which shall not pass away [He fixed their bounds which cannot be passed over].

7.verse: Praise the Lord from the earth, you sea monsters and all deeps!

8.verse: You lightning, hail, fog, and frost, you stormy wind fulfilling His orders!

9.verse: Mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars!

10.verse: Beasts and all cattle, creeping things and flying birds!

11.verse: Kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all rulers and judges of the earth!

12.verse: Both young men and maidens, old men and children!

13.verse: Let them praise and exalt the name of the Lord, for His name alone is exalted and supreme! His glory and majesty are above earth and heaven!

14.verse: He has lifted up a horn for His people [giving them power, prosperity, dignity, and preeminence], a song of praise for all His godly ones, for the people of Israel, who are near to Him. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! Sing to the Lord a new song, praise Him in the assembly of His saints!

2.verse: Let Israel rejoice in Him, their Maker; let Zion's children triumph and be joyful in their King!

3.verse: Let them praise His name in chorus and choir and with the [single or group] dance; let them sing praises to Him with the tambourine and lyre!

4.verse: For the Lord takes pleasure in His people; He will beautify the humble with salvation and adorn the wretched with victory.

5.verse: Let the saints be joyful in the glory and beauty [which God confers upon them]; let them sing for joy upon their beds.

6.verse: Let the high praises of God be in their throats and a two-edged sword in their hands,

7.verse: To wreak vengeance upon the nations and chastisement upon the peoples,

8.verse: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron,

9.verse: To execute upon them the judgment written. He [the Lord] is the honor of all His saints. Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)

1.verse: PRAISE THE Lord! Praise God in His sanctuary; praise Him in the heavens of His power!

2.verse: Praise Him for His mighty acts; praise Him according to the abundance of His greatness!

3.verse: Praise Him with trumpet sound; praise Him with lute and harp!

4.verse: Praise Him with tambourine and [single or group] dance; praise Him with stringed and wind instruments or flutes!

5.verse: Praise Him with resounding cymbals; praise Him with loud clashing cymbals!

6.verse: Let everything that has breath and every breath of life praise the Lord! Praise the Lord! (Hallelujah!)
